 23 (function() {

 25   // Baseline setup
 26   // --------------
 27 
 28   // Establish the root object, `window` in the browser, or `global` on the server.
 29   var root = this;
 30 
 31   // Save the previous value of the `_` variable.
 32   var previousUnderscore = root._;
 33 
 34   // Establish the object that gets returned to break out of a loop iteration.
 35   var breaker = {};
 36 
 37   // Save bytes in the minified (but not gzipped) version:
 38   var ArrayProto = Array.prototype, ObjProto = Object.prototype, FuncProto = Function.prototype;
 39 
 40   // Create quick reference variables for speed access to core prototypes.
 41   var push             = ArrayProto.push,
 42       slice            = ArrayProto.slice,
 43       concat           = ArrayProto.concat,
 44       toString         = ObjProto.toString,
 45       hasOwnProperty   = ObjProto.hasOwnProperty;
 46 
 47   // All **ECMAScript 5** native function implementations that we hope to use
 48   // are declared here.
 49   var
 50     nativeForEach      = ArrayProto.forEach,
 51     nativeMap          = ArrayProto.map,
 52     nativeReduce       = ArrayProto.reduce,
 53     nativeReduceRight  = ArrayProto.reduceRight,
 54     nativeFilter       = ArrayProto.filter,
 55     nativeEvery        = ArrayProto.every,
 56     nativeSome         = ArrayProto.some,
 57     nativeIndexOf      = ArrayProto.indexOf,
 58     nativeLastIndexOf  = ArrayProto.lastIndexOf,
 59     nativeIsArray      = Array.isArray,
 60     nativeKeys         = Object.keys,
 61     nativeBind         = FuncProto.bind;
 62 
 63   // Create a safe reference to the Underscore object for use below.
 64   var _ = function(obj) {
 65     if (obj instanceof _) return obj;
 66     if (!(this instanceof _)) return new _(obj);
 67     this._wrapped = obj;
 68   };
 69 
 70   // Export the Underscore object for **Node.js**, with
 71   // backwards-compatibility for the old `require()` API. If we're in
 72   // the browser, add `_` as a global object via a string identifier,
 73   // for Closure Compiler "advanced" mode.
 74   if (typeof exports !== 'undefined') {
 75     if (typeof module !== 'undefined' && module.exports) {
 76       exports = module.exports = _;
 77     }
 78     exports._ = _;
 79   } else {
 80     root._ = _;
 81   }

 83   // Current version.
 84   _.VERSION = '1.4.4';

 86   // Collection Functions
 87   // --------------------
 88 
 89   // The cornerstone, an `each` implementation, aka `forEach`.
 90   // Handles objects with the built-in `forEach`, arrays, and raw objects.
 91   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `forEach` if available.
 92   var each = _.each = _.forEach = function(obj, iterator, context) {
 93     if (obj == null) return;
 94     if (nativeForEach && obj.forEach === nativeForEach) {
 95       obj.forEach(iterator, context);
 96     } else if (obj.length === +obj.length) {
 97       for (var i = 0, l = obj.length; i < l; i++) {
 98         if (iterator.call(context, obj[i], i, obj) === breaker) return;
 99       }
100     } else {
101       for (var key in obj) {
102         if (_.has(obj, key)) {
103           if (iterator.call(context, obj[key], key, obj) === breaker) return;
104         }
105       }
106     }
107   };
108 
109   // Return the results of applying the iterator to each element.
110   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `map` if available.
111   _.map = _.collect = function(obj, iterator, context) {
112     var results = [];
113     if (obj == null) return results;
114     if (nativeMap && obj.map === nativeMap) return obj.map(iterator, context);
115     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
116       results[results.length] = iterator.call(context, value, index, list);
117     });
118     return results;
119   };
120 
121   var reduceError = 'Reduce of empty array with no initial value';
122 
123   // **Reduce** builds up a single result from a list of values, aka `inject`,
124   // or `foldl`. Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `reduce` if available.
125   _.reduce = _.foldl = _.inject = function(obj, iterator, memo, context) {
126     var initial = arguments.length > 2;
127     if (obj == null) obj = [];
128     if (nativeReduce && obj.reduce === nativeReduce) {
129       if (context) iterator = _.bind(iterator, context);
130       return initial ? obj.reduce(iterator, memo) : obj.reduce(iterator);
131     }
132     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
133       if (!initial) {
134         memo = value;
135         initial = true;
136       } else {
137         memo = iterator.call(context, memo, value, index, list);
138       }
139     });
140     if (!initial) throw new TypeError(reduceError);
141     return memo;
142   };
143 
144   // The right-associative version of reduce, also known as `foldr`.
145   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `reduceRight` if available.
146   _.reduceRight = _.foldr = function(obj, iterator, memo, context) {
147     var initial = arguments.length > 2;
148     if (obj == null) obj = [];
149     if (nativeReduceRight && obj.reduceRight === nativeReduceRight) {
150       if (context) iterator = _.bind(iterator, context);
151       return initial ? obj.reduceRight(iterator, memo) : obj.reduceRight(iterator);
152     }
153     var length = obj.length;
154     if (length !== +length) {
155       var keys = _.keys(obj);
156       length = keys.length;
157     }
158     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
159       index = keys ? keys[--length] : --length;
160       if (!initial) {
161         memo = obj[index];
162         initial = true;
163       } else {
164         memo = iterator.call(context, memo, obj[index], index, list);
165       }
166     });
167     if (!initial) throw new TypeError(reduceError);
168     return memo;
169   };
170 
171   // Return the first value which passes a truth test. Aliased as `detect`.
172   _.find = _.detect = function(obj, iterator, context) {
173     var result;
174     any(obj, function(value, index, list) {
175       if (iterator.call(context, value, index, list)) {
176         result = value;
177         return true;
178       }
179     });
180     return result;
181   };
182 
183   // Return all the elements that pass a truth test.
184   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `filter` if available.
185   // Aliased as `select`.
186   _.filter = _.select = function(obj, iterator, context) {
187     var results = [];
188     if (obj == null) return results;
189     if (nativeFilter && obj.filter === nativeFilter) return obj.filter(iterator, context);
190     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
191       if (iterator.call(context, value, index, list)) results[results.length] = value;
192     });
193     return results;
194   };
195 
196   // Return all the elements for which a truth test fails.
197   _.reject = function(obj, iterator, context) {
198     return _.filter(obj, function(value, index, list) {
199       return !iterator.call(context, value, index, list);
200     }, context);
201   };
202 
203   // Determine whether all of the elements match a truth test.
204   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `every` if available.
205   // Aliased as `all`.
206   _.every = _.all = function(obj, iterator, context) {
207     iterator || (iterator = _.identity);
208     var result = true;
209     if (obj == null) return result;
210     if (nativeEvery && obj.every === nativeEvery) return obj.every(iterator, context);
211     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
212       if (!(result = result && iterator.call(context, value, index, list))) return breaker;
213     });
214     return !!result;
215   };
216 
217   // Determine if at least one element in the object matches a truth test.
218   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `some` if available.
219   // Aliased as `any`.
220   var any = _.some = _.any = function(obj, iterator, context) {
221     iterator || (iterator = _.identity);
222     var result = false;
223     if (obj == null) return result;
224     if (nativeSome && obj.some === nativeSome) return obj.some(iterator, context);
225     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
226       if (result || (result = iterator.call(context, value, index, list))) return breaker;
227     });
228     return !!result;
229   };

231   // Determine if the array or object contains a given value (using `===`).
232   // Aliased as `include`.
233   _.contains = _.include = function(obj, target) {
234     if (obj == null) return false;
235     if (nativeIndexOf && obj.indexOf === nativeIndexOf) return obj.indexOf(target) != -1;
236     return any(obj, function(value) {
237       return value === target;
238     });
239   };
240 
241   // Invoke a method (with arguments) on every item in a collection.
242   _.invoke = function(obj, method) {
243     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
244     var isFunc = _.isFunction(method);
245     return _.map(obj, function(value) {
246       return (isFunc ? method : value[method]).apply(value, args);
247     });
248   };
249 
250   // Convenience version of a common use case of `map`: fetching a property.
251   _.pluck = function(obj, key) {
252     return _.map(obj, function(value){ return value[key]; });
253   };
254 
255   // Convenience version of a common use case of `filter`: selecting only objects
256   // containing specific `key:value` pairs.
257   _.where = function(obj, attrs, first) {
258     if (_.isEmpty(attrs)) return first ? null : [];
259     return _[first ? 'find' : 'filter'](obj, function(value) {
260       for (var key in attrs) {
261         if (attrs[key] !== value[key]) return false;
262       }
263       return true;
264     });
265   };
266 
267   // Convenience version of a common use case of `find`: getting the first object
268   // containing specific `key:value` pairs.
269   _.findWhere = function(obj, attrs) {
270     return _.where(obj, attrs, true);
271   };

273   // Return the maximum element or (element-based computation).
274   // Can't optimize arrays of integers longer than 65,535 elements.
275   // See: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=80797
276   _.max = function(obj, iterator, context) {
277     if (!iterator && _.isArray(obj) && obj[0] === +obj[0] && obj.length < 65535) {
278       return Math.max.apply(Math, obj);
279     }
280     if (!iterator && _.isEmpty(obj)) return -Infinity;
281     var result = {computed : -Infinity, value: -Infinity};
282     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
283       var computed = iterator ? iterator.call(context, value, index, list) : value;
284       computed >= result.computed && (result = {value : value, computed : computed});
285     });
286     return result.value;
287   };
288 
289   // Return the minimum element (or element-based computation).
290   _.min = function(obj, iterator, context) {
291     if (!iterator && _.isArray(obj) && obj[0] === +obj[0] && obj.length < 65535) {
292       return Math.min.apply(Math, obj);
293     }
294     if (!iterator && _.isEmpty(obj)) return Infinity;
295     var result = {computed : Infinity, value: Infinity};
296     each(obj, function(value, index, list) {
297       var computed = iterator ? iterator.call(context, value, index, list) : value;
298       computed < result.computed && (result = {value : value, computed : computed});
299     });
300     return result.value;
301   };
302 
303   // Shuffle an array.
304   _.shuffle = function(obj) {
305     var rand;
306     var index = 0;
307     var shuffled = [];
308     each(obj, function(value) {
309       rand = _.random(index++);
310       shuffled[index - 1] = shuffled[rand];
311       shuffled[rand] = value;
312     });
313     return shuffled;
314   };
315 
316   // An internal function to generate lookup iterators.
317   var lookupIterator = function(value) {
318     return _.isFunction(value) ? value : function(obj){ return obj[value]; };
319   };
320 
321   // Sort the object's values by a criterion produced by an iterator.
322   _.sortBy = function(obj, value, context) {
323     var iterator = lookupIterator(value);
324     return _.pluck(_.map(obj, function(value, index, list) {
325       return {
326         value : value,
327         index : index,
328         criteria : iterator.call(context, value, index, list)
329       };
330     }).sort(function(left, right) {
331       var a = left.criteria;
332       var b = right.criteria;
333       if (a !== b) {
334         if (a > b || a === void 0) return 1;
335         if (a < b || b === void 0) return -1;
336       }
337       return left.index < right.index ? -1 : 1;
338     }), 'value');
339   };
340 
341   // An internal function used for aggregate "group by" operations.
342   var group = function(obj, value, context, behavior) {
343     var result = {};
344     var iterator = lookupIterator(value || _.identity);
345     each(obj, function(value, index) {
346       var key = iterator.call(context, value, index, obj);
347       behavior(result, key, value);
348     });
349     return result;
350   };
351 
352   // Groups the object's values by a criterion. Pass either a string attribute
353   // to group by, or a function that returns the criterion.
354   _.groupBy = function(obj, value, context) {
355     return group(obj, value, context, function(result, key, value) {
356       (_.has(result, key) ? result[key] : (result[key] = [])).push(value);
357     });
358   };
359 
360   // Counts instances of an object that group by a certain criterion. Pass
361   // either a string attribute to count by, or a function that returns the
362   // criterion.
363   _.countBy = function(obj, value, context) {
364     return group(obj, value, context, function(result, key) {
365       if (!_.has(result, key)) result[key] = 0;
366       result[key]++;
367     });
368   };
369 
370   // Use a comparator function to figure out the smallest index at which
371   // an object should be inserted so as to maintain order. Uses binary search.
372   _.sortedIndex = function(array, obj, iterator, context) {
373     iterator = iterator == null ? _.identity : lookupIterator(iterator);
374     var value = iterator.call(context, obj);
375     var low = 0, high = array.length;
376     while (low < high) {
377       var mid = (low + high) >>> 1;
378       iterator.call(context, array[mid]) < value ? low = mid + 1 : high = mid;
379     }
380     return low;
381   };
382 
383   // Safely convert anything iterable into a real, live array.
384   _.toArray = function(obj) {
385     if (!obj) return [];
386     if (_.isArray(obj)) return slice.call(obj);
387     if (obj.length === +obj.length) return _.map(obj, _.identity);
388     return _.values(obj);
389   };
390 
391   // Return the number of elements in an object.
392   _.size = function(obj) {
393     if (obj == null) return 0;
394     return (obj.length === +obj.length) ? obj.length : _.keys(obj).length;
395   };

397   // Array Functions
398   // ---------------

400   // Get the first element of an array. Passing **n** will return the first N
401   // values in the array. Aliased as `head` and `take`. The **guard** check
402   // allows it to work with `_.map`.
403   _.first = _.head = _.take = function(array, n, guard) {
404     if (array == null) return void 0;
405     return (n != null) && !guard ? slice.call(array, 0, n) : array[0];
406   };
407 
408   // Returns everything but the last entry of the array. Especially useful on
409   // the arguments object. Passing **n** will return all the values in
410   // the array, excluding the last N. The **guard** check allows it to work with
411   // `_.map`.
412   _.initial = function(array, n, guard) {
413     return slice.call(array, 0, array.length - ((n == null) || guard ? 1 : n));
414   };
415 
416   // Get the last element of an array. Passing **n** will return the last N
417   // values in the array. The **guard** check allows it to work with `_.map`.
418   _.last = function(array, n, guard) {
419     if (array == null) return void 0;
420     if ((n != null) && !guard) {
421       return slice.call(array, Math.max(array.length - n, 0));
422     } else {
423       return array[array.length - 1];
424     }
425   };
426 
427   // Returns everything but the first entry of the array. Aliased as `tail` and `drop`.
428   // Especially useful on the arguments object. Passing an **n** will return
429   // the rest N values in the array. The **guard**
430   // check allows it to work with `_.map`.
431   _.rest = _.tail = _.drop = function(array, n, guard) {
432     return slice.call(array, (n == null) || guard ? 1 : n);
433   };
434 
435   // Trim out all falsy values from an array.
436   _.compact = function(array) {
437     return _.filter(array, _.identity);
438   };
439 
440   // Internal implementation of a recursive `flatten` function.
441   var flatten = function(input, shallow, output) {
442     each(input, function(value) {
443       if (_.isArray(value)) {
444         shallow ? push.apply(output, value) : flatten(value, shallow, output);
445       } else {
446         output.push(value);
447       }
448     });
449     return output;
450   };
451 
452   // Return a completely flattened version of an array.
453   _.flatten = function(array, shallow) {
454     return flatten(array, shallow, []);
455   };
456 
457   // Return a version of the array that does not contain the specified value(s).
458   _.without = function(array) {
459     return _.difference(array, slice.call(arguments, 1));
460   };
461 
462   // Produce a duplicate-free version of the array. If the array has already
463   // been sorted, you have the option of using a faster algorithm.
464   // Aliased as `unique`.
465   _.uniq = _.unique = function(array, isSorted, iterator, context) {
466     if (_.isFunction(isSorted)) {
467       context = iterator;
468       iterator = isSorted;
469       isSorted = false;
470     }
471     var initial = iterator ? _.map(array, iterator, context) : array;
472     var results = [];
473     var seen = [];
474     each(initial, function(value, index) {
475       if (isSorted ? (!index || seen[seen.length - 1] !== value) : !_.contains(seen, value)) {
476         seen.push(value);
477         results.push(array[index]);
478       }
479     });
480     return results;
481   };
482 
483   // Produce an array that contains the union: each distinct element from all of
484   // the passed-in arrays.
485   _.union = function() {
486     return _.uniq(concat.apply(ArrayProto, arguments));
487   };
488 
489   // Produce an array that contains every item shared between all the
490   // passed-in arrays.
491   _.intersection = function(array) {
492     var rest = slice.call(arguments, 1);
493     return _.filter(_.uniq(array), function(item) {
494       return _.every(rest, function(other) {
495         return _.indexOf(other, item) >= 0;
496       });
497     });
498   };
499 
500   // Take the difference between one array and a number of other arrays.
501   // Only the elements present in just the first array will remain.
502   _.difference = function(array) {
503     var rest = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
504     return _.filter(array, function(value){ return !_.contains(rest, value); });
505   };
506 
507   // Zip together multiple lists into a single array -- elements that share
508   // an index go together.
509   _.zip = function() {
510     var args = slice.call(arguments);
511     var length = _.max(_.pluck(args, 'length'));
512     var results = new Array(length);
513     for (var i = 0; i < length; i++) {
514       results[i] = _.pluck(args, "" + i);
515     }
516     return results;
517   };
518 
519   // Converts lists into objects. Pass either a single array of `[key, value]`
520   // pairs, or two parallel arrays of the same length -- one of keys, and one of
521   // the corresponding values.
522   _.object = function(list, values) {
523     if (list == null) return {};
524     var result = {};
525     for (var i = 0, l = list.length; i < l; i++) {
526       if (values) {
527         result[list[i]] = values[i];
528       } else {
529         result[list[i][0]] = list[i][1];
530       }
531     }
532     return result;
533   };
534 
535   // If the browser doesn't supply us with indexOf (I'm looking at you, **MSIE**),
536   // we need this function. Return the position of the first occurrence of an
537   // item in an array, or -1 if the item is not included in the array.
538   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `indexOf` if available.
539   // If the array is large and already in sort order, pass `true`
540   // for **isSorted** to use binary search.
541   _.indexOf = function(array, item, isSorted) {
542     if (array == null) return -1;
543     var i = 0, l = array.length;
544     if (isSorted) {
545       if (typeof isSorted == 'number') {
546         i = (isSorted < 0 ? Math.max(0, l + isSorted) : isSorted);
547       } else {
548         i = _.sortedIndex(array, item);
549         return array[i] === item ? i : -1;
550       }
551     }
552     if (nativeIndexOf && array.indexOf === nativeIndexOf) return array.indexOf(item, isSorted);
553     for (; i < l; i++) if (array[i] === item) return i;
554     return -1;
555   };
556 
557   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `lastIndexOf` if available.
558   _.lastIndexOf = function(array, item, from) {
559     if (array == null) return -1;
560     var hasIndex = from != null;
561     if (nativeLastIndexOf && array.lastIndexOf === nativeLastIndexOf) {
562       return hasIndex ? array.lastIndexOf(item, from) : array.lastIndexOf(item);
563     }
564     var i = (hasIndex ? from : array.length);
565     while (i--) if (array[i] === item) return i;
566     return -1;
567   };
568 
569   // Generate an integer Array containing an arithmetic progression. A port of
570   // the native Python `range()` function. See
571   // [the Python documentation](http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#range).
572   _.range = function(start, stop, step) {
573     if (arguments.length <= 1) {
574       stop = start || 0;
575       start = 0;
576     }
577     step = arguments[2] || 1;
578 
579     var len = Math.max(Math.ceil((stop - start) / step), 0);
580     var idx = 0;
581     var range = new Array(len);
582 
583     while(idx < len) {
584       range[idx++] = start;
585       start += step;
586     }
587 
588     return range;
589   };

591   // Function (ahem) Functions
592   // ------------------
593 
594   // Create a function bound to a given object (assigning `this`, and arguments,
595   // optionally). Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `Function.bind` if
596   // available.
597   _.bind = function(func, context) {
598     if (func.bind === nativeBind && nativeBind) return nativeBind.apply(func, slice.call(arguments, 1));
599     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
600     return function() {
601       return func.apply(context, args.concat(slice.call(arguments)));
602     };
603   };
604 
605   // Partially apply a function by creating a version that has had some of its
606   // arguments pre-filled, without changing its dynamic `this` context.
607   _.partial = function(func) {
608     var args = slice.call(arguments, 1);
609     return function() {
610       return func.apply(this, args.concat(slice.call(arguments)));
611     };
612   };
613 
614   // Bind all of an object's methods to that object. Useful for ensuring that
615   // all callbacks defined on an object belong to it.
616   _.bindAll = function(obj) {
617     var funcs = slice.call(arguments, 1);
618     if (funcs.length === 0) funcs = _.functions(obj);
619     each(funcs, function(f) { obj[f] = _.bind(obj[f], obj); });
620     return obj;
621   };
622 
623   // Memoize an expensive function by storing its results.
624   _.memoize = function(func, hasher) {
625     var memo = {};
626     hasher || (hasher = _.identity);
627     return function() {
628       var key = hasher.apply(this, arguments);
629       return _.has(memo, key) ? memo[key] : (memo[key] = func.apply(this, arguments));
630     };
631   };
632 
633   // Delays a function for the given number of milliseconds, and then calls
634   // it with the arguments supplied.
635   _.delay = function(func, wait) {
636     var args = slice.call(arguments, 2);
637     return setTimeout(function(){ return func.apply(null, args); }, wait);
638   };
639 
640   // Defers a function, scheduling it to run after the current call stack has
641   // cleared.
642   _.defer = function(func) {
643     return _.delay.apply(_, [func, 1].concat(slice.call(arguments, 1)));
644   };
645 
646   // Returns a function, that, when invoked, will only be triggered at most once
647   // during a given window of time.
648   _.throttle = function(func, wait) {
649     var context, args, timeout, result;
650     var previous = 0;
651     var later = function() {
652       previous = new Date;
653       timeout = null;
654       result = func.apply(context, args);
655     };
656     return function() {
657       var now = new Date;
658       var remaining = wait - (now - previous);
659       context = this;
660       args = arguments;
661       if (remaining <= 0) {
662         clearTimeout(timeout);
663         timeout = null;
664         previous = now;
665         result = func.apply(context, args);
666       } else if (!timeout) {
667         timeout = setTimeout(later, remaining);
668       }
669       return result;
670     };
671   };
672 
673   // Returns a function, that, as long as it continues to be invoked, will not
674   // be triggered. The function will be called after it stops being called for
675   // N milliseconds. If `immediate` is passed, trigger the function on the
676   // leading edge, instead of the trailing.
677   _.debounce = function(func, wait, immediate) {
678     var timeout, result;
679     return function() {
680       var context = this, args = arguments;
681       var later = function() {
682         timeout = null;
683         if (!immediate) result = func.apply(context, args);
684       };
685       var callNow = immediate && !timeout;
686       clearTimeout(timeout);
687       timeout = setTimeout(later, wait);
688       if (callNow) result = func.apply(context, args);
689       return result;
690     };
691   };
692 
693   // Returns a function that will be executed at most one time, no matter how
694   // often you call it. Useful for lazy initialization.
695   _.once = function(func) {
696     var ran = false, memo;
697     return function() {
698       if (ran) return memo;
699       ran = true;
700       memo = func.apply(this, arguments);
701       func = null;
702       return memo;
703     };
704   };
705 
706   // Returns the first function passed as an argument to the second,
707   // allowing you to adjust arguments, run code before and after, and
708   // conditionally execute the original function.
709   _.wrap = function(func, wrapper) {
710     return function() {
711       var args = [func];
712       push.apply(args, arguments);
713       return wrapper.apply(this, args);
714     };
715   };
716 
717   // Returns a function that is the composition of a list of functions, each
718   // consuming the return value of the function that follows.
719   _.compose = function() {
720     var funcs = arguments;
721     return function() {
722       var args = arguments;
723       for (var i = funcs.length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
724         args = [funcs[i].apply(this, args)];
725       }
726       return args[0];
727     };
728   };
729 
730   // Returns a function that will only be executed after being called N times.
731   _.after = function(times, func) {
732     if (times <= 0) return func();
733     return function() {
734       if (--times < 1) {
735         return func.apply(this, arguments);
736       }
737     };
738   };

743   // Retrieve the names of an object's properties.
744   // Delegates to **ECMAScript 5**'s native `Object.keys`
745   _.keys = nativeKeys || function(obj) {
746     if (obj !== Object(obj)) throw new TypeError('Invalid object');
747     var keys = [];
748     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) keys[keys.length] = key;
749     return keys;
750   };

752   // Retrieve the values of an object's properties.
753   _.values = function(obj) {
754     var values = [];
755     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) values.push(obj[key]);
756     return values;
757   };

759   // Convert an object into a list of `[key, value]` pairs.
760   _.pairs = function(obj) {
761     var pairs = [];
762     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) pairs.push([key, obj[key]]);
763     return pairs;
764   };

766   // Invert the keys and values of an object. The values must be serializable.
767   _.invert = function(obj) {
768     var result = {};
769     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) result[obj[key]] = key;
770     return result;
771   };

773   // Return a sorted list of the function names available on the object.
774   // Aliased as `methods`
775   _.functions = _.methods = function(obj) {
776     var names = [];
777     for (var key in obj) {
778       if (_.isFunction(obj[key])) names.push(key);
779     }
780     return names.sort();
781   };

783   // Extend a given object with all the properties in passed-in object(s).
784   _.extend = function(obj) {
785     each(slice.call(arguments, 1), function(source) {
786       if (source) {
787         for (var prop in source) {
788           obj[prop] = source[prop];
789         }
790       }
791     });
792     return obj;
793   };

795   // Return a copy of the object only containing the whitelisted properties.
796   _.pick = function(obj) {
797     var copy = {};
798     var keys = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
799     each(keys, function(key) {
800       if (key in obj) copy[key] = obj[key];
801     });
802     return copy;
803   };

805    // Return a copy of the object without the blacklisted properties.
806   _.omit = function(obj) {
807     var copy = {};
808     var keys = concat.apply(ArrayProto, slice.call(arguments, 1));
809     for (var key in obj) {
810       if (!_.contains(keys, key)) copy[key] = obj[key];
811     }
812     return copy;

815   // Fill in a given object with default properties.

818       if (source) {
819         for (var prop in source) {
820           if (obj[prop] == null) obj[prop] = source[prop];
821         }
822       }
823     });
824     return obj;

827   // Create a (shallow-cloned) duplicate of an object.
828   _.clone = function(obj) {
829     if (!_.isObject(obj)) return obj;
830     return _.isArray(obj) ? obj.slice() : _.extend({}, obj);

833   // Invokes interceptor with the obj, and then returns obj.
834   // The primary purpose of this method is to "tap into" a method chain, in
835   // order to perform operations on intermediate results within the chain.
836   _.tap = function(obj, interceptor) {
837     interceptor(obj);
838     return obj;

841   // Internal recursive comparison function for `isEqual`.
842   var eq = function(a, b, aStack, bStack) {
843     // Identical objects are equal. `0 === -0`, but they aren't identical.
844     // See the Harmony `egal` proposal: http://wiki.ecmascript.org/doku.php?id=harmony:egal.
845     if (a === b) return a !== 0 || 1 / a == 1 / b;
846     // A strict comparison is necessary because `null == undefined`.
847     if (a == null || b == null) return a === b;
848     // Unwrap any wrapped objects.
849     if (a instanceof _) a = a._wrapped;
850     if (b instanceof _) b = b._wrapped;
851     // Compare `[[Class]]` names.
852     var className = toString.call(a);
853     if (className != toString.call(b)) return false;
854     switch (className) {
855       // Strings, numbers, dates, and booleans are compared by value.
856       case '[object String]':
857         // Primitives and their corresponding object wrappers are equivalent; thus, `"5"` is
858         // equivalent to `new String("5")`.
859         return a == String(b);
860       case '[object Number]':
861         // `NaN`s are equivalent, but non-reflexive. An `egal` comparison is performed for
862         // other numeric values.
863         return a != +a ? b != +b : (a == 0 ? 1 / a == 1 / b : a == +b);
864       case '[object Date]':
865       case '[object Boolean]':
866         // Coerce dates and booleans to numeric primitive values. Dates are compared by their
867         // millisecond representations. Note that invalid dates with millisecond representations
868         // of `NaN` are not equivalent.
869         return +a == +b;
870       // RegExps are compared by their source patterns and flags.
871       case '[object RegExp]':
872         return a.source == b.source &&
873                a.global == b.global &&
874                a.multiline == b.multiline &&
875                a.ignoreCase == b.ignoreCase;
876     }
877     if (typeof a != 'object' || typeof b != 'object') return false;
878     // Assume equality for cyclic structures. The algorithm for detecting cyclic
879     // structures is adapted from ES 5.1 section 15.12.3, abstract operation `JO`.
880     var length = aStack.length;
881     while (length--) {
882       // Linear search. Performance is inversely proportional to the number of
883       // unique nested structures.
884       if (aStack[length] == a) return bStack[length] == b;
885     }
886     // Add the first object to the stack of traversed objects.
887     aStack.push(a);
888     bStack.push(b);
889     var size = 0, result = true;
890     // Recursively compare objects and arrays.
891     if (className == '[object Array]') {
892       // Compare array lengths to determine if a deep comparison is necessary.
893       size = a.length;
894       result = size == b.length;
895       if (result) {
896         // Deep compare the contents, ignoring non-numeric properties.
897         while (size--) {
898           if (!(result = eq(a[size], b[size], aStack, bStack))) break;
899         }
900       }
901     } else {
902       // Objects with different constructors are not equivalent, but `Object`s
903       // from different frames are.
904       var aCtor = a.constructor, bCtor = b.constructor;
905       if (aCtor !== bCtor && !(_.isFunction(aCtor) && (aCtor instanceof aCtor) &&
906                                _.isFunction(bCtor) && (bCtor instanceof bCtor))) {
907         return false;
908       }
909       // Deep compare objects.
910       for (var key in a) {
911         if (_.has(a, key)) {
912           // Count the expected number of properties.
913           size++;
914           // Deep compare each member.
915           if (!(result = _.has(b, key) && eq(a[key], b[key], aStack, bStack))) break;
916         }
917       }
918       // Ensure that both objects contain the same number of properties.
919       if (result) {
920         for (key in b) {
921           if (_.has(b, key) && !(size--)) break;
922         }
923         result = !size;
924       }
925     }
926     // Remove the first object from the stack of traversed objects.
927     aStack.pop();
928     bStack.pop();
929     return result;
930   };
931 
932   // Perform a deep comparison to check if two objects are equal.
933   _.isEqual = function(a, b) {
934     return eq(a, b, [], []);
935   };

937   // Is a given array, string, or object empty?
938   // An "empty" object has no enumerable own-properties.
939   _.isEmpty = function(obj) {
940     if (obj == null) return true;
941     if (_.isArray(obj) || _.isString(obj)) return obj.length === 0;
942     for (var key in obj) if (_.has(obj, key)) return false;
943     return true;
944   };

1037   // Return a random integer between min and max (inclusive).
1038   _.random = function(min, max) {
1039     if (max == null) {
1040       max = min;
1041       min = 0;
1042     }
1043     return min + Math.floor(Math.random() * (max - min + 1));
1044   };

1046   // List of HTML entities for escaping.
1047   var entityMap = {
1048     escape: {
1049       '&': '&',
1050       '<': '<',
1051       '>': '>',
1052       '"': '"',
1053       "'": ''',
1054       '/': '/'
1055     }
1056   };
1057   entityMap.unescape = _.invert(entityMap.escape);
1058 
1059   // Regexes containing the keys and values listed immediately above.
1060   var entityRegexes = {
1061     escape:   new RegExp('[' + _.keys(entityMap.escape).join('') + ']', 'g'),
1062     unescape: new RegExp('(' + _.keys(entityMap.unescape).join('|') + ')', 'g')
1063   };

1065   // Functions for escaping and unescaping strings to/from HTML interpolation.
1066   _.each(['escape', 'unescape'], function(method) {
1067     _[method] = function(string) {
1068       if (string == null) return '';
1069       return ('' + string).replace(entityRegexes[method], function(match) {
1070         return entityMap[method][match];
1071       });
1072     };
1073   });

1075   // If the value of the named property is a function then invoke it;
1076   // otherwise, return it.
1077   _.result = function(object, property) {
1078     if (object == null) return null;
1079     var value = object[property];
1080     return _.isFunction(value) ? value.call(object) : value;

1083   // Add your own custom functions to the Underscore object.

1086       var func = _[name] = obj[name];
1087       _.prototype[name] = function() {
1088         var args = [this._wrapped];
1089         push.apply(args, arguments);
1090         return result.call(this, func.apply(_, args));

1103   // By default, Underscore uses ERB-style template delimiters, change the
1104   // following template settings to use alternative delimiters.
1105   _.templateSettings = {
1106     evaluate    : /<%([\s\S]+?)%>/g,
1107     interpolate : /<%=([\s\S]+?)%>/g,
1108     escape      : /<%-([\s\S]+?)%>/g
1109   };
1110 
1111   // When customizing `templateSettings`, if you don't want to define an
1112   // interpolation, evaluation or escaping regex, we need one that is
1113   // guaranteed not to match.
1114   var noMatch = /(.)^/;
1115 
1116   // Certain characters need to be escaped so that they can be put into a
1117   // string literal.
1118   var escapes = {
1119     "'":      "'",
1120     '\\':     '\\',
1121     '\r':     'r',
1122     '\n':     'n',
1123     '\t':     't',
1124     '\u2028': 'u2028',
1125     '\u2029': 'u2029'
1126   };
1127 
1128   var escaper = /\\|'|\r|\n|\t|\u2028|\u2029/g;
1129 
1130   // JavaScript micro-templating, similar to John Resig's implementation.
1131   // Underscore templating handles arbitrary delimiters, preserves whitespace,
1132   // and correctly escapes quotes within interpolated code.
1133   _.template = function(text, data, settings) {
1134     var render;
1135     settings = _.defaults({}, settings, _.templateSettings);
1136 
1137     // Combine delimiters into one regular expression via alternation.
1138     var matcher = new RegExp([
1139       (settings.escape || noMatch).source,
1140       (settings.interpolate || noMatch).source,
1141       (settings.evaluate || noMatch).source
1142     ].join('|') + '|$', 'g');
1143 
1144     // Compile the template source, escaping string literals appropriately.
1145     var index = 0;
1146     var source = "__p+='";
1147     text.replace(matcher, function(match, escape, interpolate, evaluate, offset) {
1148       source += text.slice(index, offset)
1149         .replace(escaper, function(match) { return '\\' + escapes[match]; });
1150 
1151       if (escape) {
1152         source += "'+\n((__t=(" + escape + "))==null?'':_.escape(__t))+\n'";
1153       }
1154       if (interpolate) {
1155         source += "'+\n((__t=(" + interpolate + "))==null?'':__t)+\n'";
1156       }
1157       if (evaluate) {
1158         source += "';\n" + evaluate + "\n__p+='";
1159       }
1160       index = offset + match.length;
1161       return match;
1162     });
1163     source += "';\n";
1164 
1165     // If a variable is not specified, place data values in local scope.
1166     if (!settings.variable) source = 'with(obj||{}){\n' + source + '}\n';
1167 
1168     source = "var __t,__p='',__j=Array.prototype.join," +
1169       "print=function(){__p+=__j.call(arguments,'');};\n" +
1170       source + "return __p;\n";
1171 
1172     try {
1173       render = new Function(settings.variable || 'obj', '_', source);
1174     } catch (e) {
1175       e.source = source;
1176       throw e;
1177     }
1178 
1179     if (data) return render(data, _);
1180     var template = function(data) {
1181       return render.call(this, data, _);
1182     };
1183 
1184     // Provide the compiled function source as a convenience for precompilation.
1185     template.source = 'function(' + (settings.variable || 'obj') + '){\n' + source + '}';
1186 
1187     return template;
1188   };

1191   _.chain = function(obj) {
1192     return _(obj).chain();
1193   };

1199   // underscore functions. Wrapped objects may be chained.

1201   // Helper function to continue chaining intermediate results.
1202   var result = function(obj) {
1203     return this._chain ? _(obj).chain() : obj;
1204   };

1209   // Add all mutator Array functions to the wrapper.
1210   each(['pop', 'push', 'reverse', 'shift', 'sort', 'splice', 'unshift'], function(name) {
1211     var method = ArrayProto[name];
1212     _.prototype[name] = function() {
1213       var obj = this._wrapped;
1214       method.apply(obj, arguments);
1215       if ((name == 'shift' || name == 'splice') && obj.length === 0) delete obj[0];
1216       return result.call(this, obj);

1218   });

1221   each(['concat', 'join', 'slice'], function(name) {
1222     var method = ArrayProto[name];
1223     _.prototype[name] = function() {
1224       return result.call(this, method.apply(this._wrapped, arguments));
1225     };
1226   });

1232       this._chain = true;
1233       return this;
1234     },
1235

1237     value: function() {

1292   // Helper function to correctly set up the prototype chain, for subclasses.
1293   // Similar to `goog.inherits`, but uses a hash of prototype properties and
1294   // class properties to be extended.
1295   var inherits = function(parent, protoProps, staticProps) {
1296     var child;
1297 
1298     // The constructor function for the new subclass is either defined by you
1299     // (the "constructor" property in your `extend` definition), or defaulted
1300     // by us to simply call the parent's constructor.
1301     if (protoProps && protoProps.hasOwnProperty('constructor')) {
1302       child = protoProps.constructor;
1303     } else {
1304       /** @ignore */
1305       child = function(){ parent.apply(this, arguments); };
1306     }
1307 
1308     // Inherit class (static) properties from parent.
1309     Bmob._.extend(child, parent);
1310 
1311     // Set the prototype chain to inherit from `parent`, without calling
1312     // `parent`'s constructor function.
1313     EmptyConstructor.prototype = parent.prototype;
1314     child.prototype = new EmptyConstructor();
1315 
1316     // Add prototype properties (instance properties) to the subclass,
1317     // if supplied.
1318     if (protoProps) {
1319       Bmob._.extend(child.prototype, protoProps);
1320     }
1321 
1322     // Add static properties to the constructor function, if supplied.
1323     if (staticProps) {
1324       Bmob._.extend(child, staticProps);
1325     }
1326 
1327     // Correctly set child's `prototype.constructor`.
1328     child.prototype.constructor = child;
1329 
1330     // Set a convenience property in case the parent's prototype is
1331     // needed later.
1332     child.__super__ = parent.prototype;
1333 
1334     return child;
1335   };
1336 
1337   // Set the server for Bmob to talk to.
1338   Bmob.serverURL = "https://api.bmob.cn";
1339   
1340   // Check whether we are running in Node.js.
1341   if (typeof(process) !== "undefined" &&
1342       process.versions &&
1343       process.versions.node) {
1344     Bmob._isNode = true;
1345   }

1353    */
1354   Bmob.initialize = function(applicationId, applicationKey, masterKey) {
1355     if (masterKey) {
1356       throw "Bmob.initialize() was passed a Master Key, which is only " +
1357         "allowed from within Node.js.";
1358     }
1359     Bmob._initialize(applicationId, applicationKey,masterKey);
1360   };

1363    * Call this method first to set up authentication tokens for Bmob.
1364    * This method is for Bmob's own private use.

1367

1371     Bmob.applicationKey = applicationKey;

1384   /**
1385    * Returns prefix for localStorage keys used by this instance of Bmob.
1386    * @param {String} path The relative suffix to append to it.
1387    *     null or undefined is treated as the empty string.
1388    * @return {String} The full key name.
1389    */
1390   Bmob._getBmobPath = function(path) {
1391     if (!Bmob.applicationId) {
1392       throw "You need to call Bmob.initialize before using Bmob.";
1393     }
1394     if (!path) {
1395       path = "";
1396     }
1397     if (!Bmob._.isString(path)) {
1398       throw "Tried to get a localStorage path that wasn't a String.";
1399     }
1400     if (path[0] === "/") {
1401       path = path.substring(1);
1402     }
1403     return "Bmob/" + Bmob.applicationId + "/" + path;
1404   };
1405 
1406   /**
1407    * Returns the unique string for this app on this machine.
1408    * Gets reset when localStorage is cleared.
1409    */
1410   Bmob._installationId = null;
1411   Bmob._getInstallationId = function() {
1412     // See if it's cached in RAM.
1413     if (Bmob._installationId) {
1414       return Bmob._installationId;
1415     }
1416 
1417     // Try to get it from localStorage.
1418     var path = Bmob._getBmobPath("installationId");
1419     Bmob._installationId = Bmob.localStorage.getItem(path);
1420 
1421     if (!Bmob._installationId || Bmob._installationId === "") {
1422       // It wasn't in localStorage, so create a new one.
1423       var hexOctet = function() {
1424         return Math.floor((1+Math.random())*0x10000).toString(16).substring(1);
1425       };
1426       Bmob._installationId = (
1427         hexOctet() + hexOctet() + "-" +
1428         hexOctet() + "-" +
1429         hexOctet() + "-" +
1430         hexOctet() + "-" +
1431         hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet());
1432       Bmob.localStorage.setItem(path, Bmob._installationId);
1433     }
1434 
1435     return Bmob._installationId;
1436   };
1437 
1438   Bmob._parseDate = function(iso8601) {
1439     var regexp = new RegExp(
1440       "^([0-9]{1,4})-([0-9]{1,2})-([0-9]{1,2})" + "T" +
1441       "([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2}):([0-9]{1,2})" +
1442       "(.([0-9]+))?" + "Z$");
1443     var match = regexp.exec(iso8601);
1444     if (!match) {
1445       return null;
1446     }
1447 
1448     var year = match[1] || 0;
1449     var month = (match[2] || 1) - 1;
1450     var day = match[3] || 0;
1451     var hour = match[4] || 0;
1452     var minute = match[5] || 0;
1453     var second = match[6] || 0;
1454     var milli = match[8] || 0;
1455 
1456     return new Date(Date.UTC(year, month, day, hour, minute, second, milli));
1457   };

1459   Bmob._ajaxIE8 = function(method, url, data) {
1460     var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
1461     var xdr = new XDomainRequest();
1462     xdr.onload = function() {
1463       var response;
1464       try {
1465         response = JSON.parse(xdr.responseText);
1466       } catch (e) {
1467         promise.reject(e);
1468       }
1469       if (response) {
1470         promise.resolve(response);
1471       }
1472     };
1473     xdr.onerror = xdr.ontimeout = function() {
1474       promise.reject(xdr);
1475     };
1476     xdr.onprogress = function() {};
1477     xdr.open(method, url);
1478     xdr.send(data);
1479     return promise;
1480   };
1481 
1482 
1483   Bmob._ajax = function(method, url, data, success, error) {
1484     var options = {
1485       success: success,
1486       error: error
1487     };
1488 
1489     if (typeof(XDomainRequest) !== "undefined") {
1490       return Bmob._ajaxIE8(method, url, data)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1491     }
1492 
1493     var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
1494     var handled = false;
1495 
1496     var xhr = new Bmob.XMLHttpRequest();
1497     xhr.onreadystatechange = function() {
1498       if (xhr.readyState === 4) {
1499         if (handled) {
1500           return;
1501         }
1502         handled = true;
1503 
1504         if (xhr.status >= 200 && xhr.status < 300) {
1505           var response;
1506           try {
1507             response = JSON.parse(xhr.responseText);
1508           } catch (e) {
1509             promise.reject(e);
1510           }
1511           if (response) {
1512             promise.resolve(response, xhr.status, xhr);
1513           }
1514         } else {
1515           promise.reject(xhr);
1516         }
1517       }
1518     };
1519     xhr.open(method, url, true);
1520 	xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "text/plain");  // avoid pre-flight.
1521     //xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "text/plain");  // avoid pre-flight.
1522 	//xhr.setRequestHeader("212312313", "32432342");  // avoid pre-flight.
1523     if (Bmob._isNode) {
1524       // Add a special user agent just for request from node.js.
1525       xhr.setRequestHeader("User-Agent",
1526                            "Bmob/" + Bmob.VERSION +
1527                            " (NodeJS " + process.versions.node + ")");
1528     }
1529     xhr.send(data);
1530     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1531   };

1533   // A self-propagating extend function.
1534   Bmob._extend = function(protoProps, classProps) {
1535     var child = inherits(this, protoProps, classProps);
1536     child.extend = this.extend;
1537     return child;
1538   };

1540   /**
1541    * route is classes, users, login, etc.
1542    * objectId is null if there is no associated objectId.
1543    * method is the http method for the REST API.
1544    * dataObject is the payload as an object, or null if there is none.
1545    * @ignore
1546    */
1547   Bmob._request = function(route, className, objectId, method, dataObject) {
1548     if (!Bmob.applicationId) {
1549       throw "You must specify your applicationId using Bmob.initialize";
1550     }
1551 
1552     if (!Bmob.applicationKey && !Bmob.masterKey) {
1553       throw "You must specify a key using Bmob.initialize";
1554     }
1555 
1556 
1557     if (route !== "batch" &&
1558         route !== "classes" &&
1559         route !== "files" &&
1560         route !== "functions" &&
1561         route !== "login" &&
1562         route !== "push" &&
1563         route !== "search/select" &&
1564         route !== "images/thumbnail" &&
1565         route !== "images/watermark" &&
1566         route !== "requestPasswordReset" &&
1567         route !== "requestEmailVerify" &&
1568         route !== "users" &&
1569         !(/users\/[^\/]+\/friendship\/[^\/]+/.test(route))) {
1570       throw "Bad route: '" + route + "'.";
1571     }
1572 
1573     var url = Bmob.serverURL;
1574     if (url.charAt(url.length - 1) !== "/") {
1575       url += "/";
1576     }
1577     url += "1/" + route;
1578     if (className) {
1579       url += "/" + className;
1580     }
1581     if (objectId) {
1582       url += "/" + objectId;
1583     }
1584     if((route ==='users' || route === 'classes') && method === 'PUT' && dataObject._fetchWhenSave){
1585       delete dataObject._fetchWhenSave;
1586       url += '?new=true';
1587     }
1588 
1589     dataObject = Bmob._.clone(dataObject || {});
1590     if (method !== "POST") {
1591       dataObject._Method = method;
1592       method = "POST";
1593     }
1594 
1595 	
1596     dataObject._ApplicationId = Bmob.applicationId;
1597     dataObject._RestKey = Bmob.applicationKey;
1598     if(Bmob._useMasterKey)
1599         dataObject._MasterKey = Bmob.masterKey;
1600     dataObject._ClientVersion = Bmob.VERSION;
1601     dataObject._InstallationId = Bmob._getInstallationId();
1602 	
1603 	
1604     // Pass the session token on every request.
1605     var currentUser = Bmob.User.current();
1606     if (currentUser && currentUser._sessionToken) {
1607       dataObject._SessionToken = currentUser._sessionToken;
1608     }
1609     var data = JSON.stringify(dataObject);
1610 
1611     return Bmob._ajax(method, url, data).then(null, function(response) {
1612       // Transform the error into an instance of Bmob.Error by trying to parse
1613       // the error string as JSON.
1614       var error;
1615       if (response && response.responseText) {
1616         try {
1617           var errorJSON = JSON.parse(response.responseText);
1618           if (errorJSON) {
1619             error = new Bmob.Error(errorJSON.code, errorJSON.error);
1620           }
1621         } catch (e) {
1622           // If we fail to parse the error text, that's okay.
1623         }
1624       }
1625       error = error || new Bmob.Error(-1, response.responseText);
1626       // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
1627       // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
1628       return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
1629     });
1630   };
1631 
1632   // Helper function to get a value from a Backbone object as a property
1633   // or as a function.
1634   Bmob._getValue = function(object, prop) {
1635     if (!(object && object[prop])) {
1636       return null;
1637     }
1638     return Bmob._.isFunction(object[prop]) ? object[prop]() : object[prop];
1639   };
1640 
1641   /**
1642    * Converts a value in a Bmob Object into the appropriate representation.
1643    * This is the JS equivalent of Java's Bmob.maybeReferenceAndEncode(Object)
1644    * if seenObjects is falsey. Otherwise any Bmob.Objects not in
1645    * seenObjects will be fully embedded rather than encoded
1646    * as a pointer.  This array will be used to prevent going into an infinite
1647    * loop because we have circular references.  If <seenObjects>
1648    * is set, then none of the Bmob Objects that are serialized can be dirty.
1649    */
1650   Bmob._encode = function(value, seenObjects, disallowObjects) {
1651     var _ = Bmob._;
1652     if (value instanceof Bmob.Object) {
1653       if (disallowObjects) {
1654         throw "Bmob.Objects not allowed here";
1655       }
1656       if (!seenObjects || _.include(seenObjects, value) || !value._hasData) {
1657         return value._toPointer();
1658       }
1659       if (!value.dirty()) {
1660         seenObjects = seenObjects.concat(value);
1661         return Bmob._encode(value._toFullJSON(seenObjects),
1662                              seenObjects,
1663                              disallowObjects);
1664       }
1665       throw "Tried to save an object with a pointer to a new, unsaved object.";
1666     }
1667     if (value instanceof Bmob.ACL) {
1668       return value.toJSON();
1669     }
1670     if (_.isDate(value)) {
1671       return { "__type": "Date", "iso": value.toJSON() };
1672     }
1673     if (value instanceof Bmob.GeoPoint) {
1674       return value.toJSON();
1675     }
1676     if (_.isArray(value)) {
1677       return _.map(value, function(x) {
1678         return Bmob._encode(x, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
1679       });
1680     }
1681     if (_.isRegExp(value)) {
1682       return value.source;
1683     }
1684     if (value instanceof Bmob.Relation) {
1685       return value.toJSON();
1686     }
1687     if (value instanceof Bmob.Op) {
1688       return value.toJSON();
1689     }
1690     if (value instanceof Bmob.File) {
1691       if (!value.url()) {
1692         throw "Tried to save an object containing an unsaved file.";
1693       }
1694       return {
1695         __type: "File",
1696         id:  value.id,
1697         name: value.name(),
1698         url: value.url()
1699       };
1700     }
1701     if (_.isObject(value)) {
1702       var output = {};
1703       Bmob._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
1704         output[k] = Bmob._encode(v, seenObjects, disallowObjects);
1705       });
1706       return output;
1707     }
1708     return value;
1709   };
1710 
1711   /**
1712    * The inverse function of Bmob._encode.
1713    * TODO: make decode not mutate value.
1714    */
1715   Bmob._decode = function(key, value) {
1716     var _ = Bmob._;
1717     if (!_.isObject(value)) {
1718       return value;
1719     }
1720     if (_.isArray(value)) {
1721       Bmob._arrayEach(value, function(v, k) {
1722         value[k] = Bmob._decode(k, v);
1723       });
1724       return value;
1725     }
1726     if (value instanceof Bmob.Object) {
1727       return value;
1728     }
1729     if (value instanceof Bmob.File) {
1730       return value;
1731     }
1732     if (value instanceof Bmob.Op) {
1733       return value;
1734     }
1735     if (value.__op) {
1736       return Bmob.Op._decode(value);
1737     }
1738     if (value.__type === "Pointer") {
1739       var className = value.className;
1740       var pointer = Bmob.Object._create(className);
1741       if(value.createdAt){
1742           delete value.__type;
1743           delete value.className;
1744           pointer._finishFetch(value, true);
1745       }else{
1746           pointer._finishFetch({ objectId: value.objectId }, false);
1747       }
1748       return pointer;
1749     }
1750     if (value.__type === "Object") {
1751       // It's an Object included in a query result.
1752       var className = value.className;
1753       delete value.__type;
1754       delete value.className;
1755       var object = Bmob.Object._create(className);
1756       object._finishFetch(value, true);
1757       return object;
1758     }
1759     if (value.__type === "Date") {
1760       return Bmob._parseDate(value.iso);
1761     }
1762     if (value.__type === "GeoPoint") {
1763       return new Bmob.GeoPoint({
1764         latitude: value.latitude,
1765         longitude: value.longitude
1766       });
1767     }
1768     if (key === "ACL") {
1769       if (value instanceof Bmob.ACL) {
1770         return value;
1771       }
1772       return new Bmob.ACL(value);
1773     }
1774     if (value.__type === "Relation") {
1775       var relation = new Bmob.Relation(null, key);
1776       relation.targetClassName = value.className;
1777       return relation;
1778     }
1779     if (value.__type === "File") {
1780       var file = new Bmob.File(value.name);
1781       file._metaData = value.metaData || {};
1782       file._url = value.url;
1783       file.id = value.objectId;
1784       return file;
1785     }
1786     Bmob._objectEach(value, function(v, k) {
1787       value[k] = Bmob._decode(k, v);
1788     });
1789     return value;
1790   };
1791 
1792   Bmob._arrayEach = Bmob._.each;
1793 
1794   /**
1795    * Does a deep traversal of every item in object, calling func on every one.
1796    * @param {Object} object The object or array to traverse deeply.
1797    * @param {Function} func The function to call for every item. It will
1798    *     be passed the item as an argument. If it returns a truthy value, that
1799    *     value will replace the item in its parent container.
1800    * @returns {} the result of calling func on the top-level object itself.
1801    */
1802   Bmob._traverse = function(object, func, seen) {
1803     if (object instanceof Bmob.Object) {
1804       seen = seen || [];
1805       if (Bmob._.indexOf(seen, object) >= 0) {
1806         // We've already visited this object in this call.
1807         return;
1808       }
1809       seen.push(object);
1810       Bmob._traverse(object.attributes, func, seen);
1811       return func(object);
1812     }
1813     if (object instanceof Bmob.Relation || object instanceof Bmob.File) {
1814       // Nothing needs to be done, but we don't want to recurse into the
1815       // object's parent infinitely, so we catch this case.
1816       return func(object);
1817     }
1818     if (Bmob._.isArray(object)) {
1819       Bmob._.each(object, function(child, index) {
1820         var newChild = Bmob._traverse(child, func, seen);
1821         if (newChild) {
1822           object[index] = newChild;
1823         }
1824       });
1825       return func(object);
1826     }
1827     if (Bmob._.isObject(object)) {
1828       Bmob._each(object, function(child, key) {
1829         var newChild = Bmob._traverse(child, func, seen);
1830         if (newChild) {
1831           object[key] = newChild;
1832         }
1833       });
1834       return func(object);
1835     }
1836     return func(object);
1837   };
1838 
1839   /**
1840    * This is like _.each, except:
1841    * * it doesn't work for so-called array-like objects,
1842    * * it does work for dictionaries with a "length" attribute.
1843    */
1844   Bmob._objectEach = Bmob._each = function(obj, callback) {
1845     var _ = Bmob._;
1846     if (_.isObject(obj)) {
1847       _.each(_.keys(obj), function(key) {
1848         callback(obj[key], key);
1849       });
1850     } else {
1851       _.each(obj, callback);
1852     }
1853   };
1854 
1855   // Helper function to check null or undefined.
1856   Bmob._isNullOrUndefined = function(x) {
1857     return Bmob._.isNull(x) || Bmob._.isUndefined(x);
1858   };
1859 }(this));

2177 /*global _: false */
2178 (function() {
2179   var root = this;
2180   var Bmob = (root.Bmob || (root.Bmob = {}));
2181   var eventSplitter = /\s+/;
2182   var slice = Array.prototype.slice;
2183 
2184   /**
2185    *
2186    * <p>Bmob.Events 是 fork of Backbone's Events module</p>
2187    *
2188    * <p>A module that can be mixed in to any object in order to provide
2189    * it with custom events. You may bind callback functions to an event
2190    * with `on`, or remove these functions with `off`.
2191    * Triggering an event fires all callbacks in the order that `on` was
2192    * called.
2193    *
2194    * <pre>
2195    *     var object = {};
2196    *     _.extend(object, Bmob.Events);
2197    *     object.on('expand', function(){ alert('expanded'); });
2198    *     object.trigger('expand');</pre></p>
2199    *
2200    * <p>For more information, see the
2201    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Events">Backbone
2202    * documentation</a>.</p>
2203    */
2204   Bmob.Events = {
2205     /**
2206      * Bind one or more space separated events, `events`, to a `callback`
2207      * function. Passing `"all"` will bind the callback to all events fired.
2208      */
2209     on: function(events, callback, context) {
2210 
2211       var calls, event, node, tail, list;
2212       if (!callback) {
2213         return this;
2214       }
2215       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
2216       calls = this._callbacks || (this._callbacks = {});
2217 
2218       // Create an immutable callback list, allowing traversal during
2219       // modification.  The tail is an empty object that will always be used
2220       // as the next node.
2221       event = events.shift();
2222       while (event) {
2223         list = calls[event];
2224         node = list ? list.tail : {};
2225         node.next = tail = {};
2226         node.context = context;
2227         node.callback = callback;
2228         calls[event] = {tail: tail, next: list ? list.next : node};
2229         event = events.shift();
2230       }
2231 
2232       return this;
2233     },
2234 
2235     /**
2236      * Remove one or many callbacks. If `context` is null, removes all callbacks
2237      * with that function. If `callback` is null, removes all callbacks for the
2238      * event. If `events` is null, removes all bound callbacks for all events.
2239      */
2240     off: function(events, callback, context) {
2241       var event, calls, node, tail, cb, ctx;
2242 
2243       // No events, or removing *all* events.
2244       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
2245         return;
2246       }
2247       if (!(events || callback || context)) {
2248         delete this._callbacks;
2249         return this;
2250       }
2251 
2252       // Loop through the listed events and contexts, splicing them out of the
2253       // linked list of callbacks if appropriate.
2254       events = events ? events.split(eventSplitter) : _.keys(calls);
2255       event = events.shift();
2256       while (event) {
2257         node = calls[event];
2258         delete calls[event];
2259         if (!node || !(callback || context)) {
2260           continue;
2261         }
2262         // Create a new list, omitting the indicated callbacks.
2263         tail = node.tail;
2264         node = node.next;
2265         while (node !== tail) {
2266           cb = node.callback;
2267           ctx = node.context;
2268           if ((callback && cb !== callback) || (context && ctx !== context)) {
2269             this.on(event, cb, ctx);
2270           }
2271           node = node.next;
2272         }
2273         event = events.shift();
2274       }
2275 
2276       return this;
2277     },
2278 
2279     /**
2280      * Trigger one or many events, firing all bound callbacks. Callbacks are
2281      * passed the same arguments as `trigger` is, apart from the event name
2282      * (unless you're listening on `"all"`, which will cause your callback to
2283      * receive the true name of the event as the first argument).
2284      */
2285     trigger: function(events) {
2286       var event, node, calls, tail, args, all, rest;
2287       if (!(calls = this._callbacks)) {
2288         return this;
2289       }
2290       all = calls.all;
2291       events = events.split(eventSplitter);
2292       rest = slice.call(arguments, 1);
2293 
2294       // For each event, walk through the linked list of callbacks twice,
2295       // first to trigger the event, then to trigger any `"all"` callbacks.
2296       event = events.shift();
2297       while (event) {
2298         node = calls[event];
2299         if (node) {
2300           tail = node.tail;
2301           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
2302             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, rest);
2303           }
2304         }
2305         node = all;
2306         if (node) {
2307           tail = node.tail;
2308           args = [event].concat(rest);
2309           while ((node = node.next) !== tail) {
2310             node.callback.apply(node.context || this, args);
2311           }
2312         }
2313         event = events.shift();
2314       }
2315 
2316       return this;
2317     }
2318   };
2319 
2320   /**
2321    * @function
2322    */
2323   Bmob.Events.bind = Bmob.Events.on;
2324 
2325   /**
2326    * @function
2327    */
2328   Bmob.Events.unbind = Bmob.Events.off;
2329 }.call(this));

2338   /**
2339    * 通过下面的任意一种形式可以创建GeoPoint<br>
2340    *   <pre>
2341    *   new GeoPoint(otherGeoPoint)
2342    *   new GeoPoint(30, 30)
2343    *   new GeoPoint([30, 30])
2344    *   new GeoPoint({latitude: 30, longitude: 30})
2345    *   new GeoPoint()  // defaults to (0, 0)
2346    *   </pre>
2347    * @class
2348    *
2349    * <p>在BmobObject中使用坐标点，或者在geo查询中使用</p>
2350    * <p>在一个表中只有一个字段能使用GeoPoint.</p>
2351    *
2352    * <p>Example:<pre>
2353    *   var point = new Bmob.GeoPoint(30.0, -20.0);
2354    *   var object = new Bmob.Object("PlaceObject");
2355    *   object.set("location", point);
2356    *   object.save();</pre></p>
2357    */
2358   Bmob.GeoPoint = function(arg1, arg2) {
2359     if (_.isArray(arg1)) {
2360       Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(arg1[0], arg1[1]);
2361       this.latitude = arg1[0];
2362       this.longitude = arg1[1];
2363     } else if (_.isObject(arg1)) {
2364       Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(arg1.latitude, arg1.longitude);
2365       this.latitude = arg1.latitude;
2366       this.longitude = arg1.longitude;
2367     } else if (_.isNumber(arg1) && _.isNumber(arg2)) {
2368       Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(arg1, arg2);
2369       this.latitude = arg1;
2370       this.longitude = arg2;
2371     } else {
2372       this.latitude = 0;
2373       this.longitude = 0;
2374     }
2375 
2376     // Add properties so that anyone using Webkit or Mozilla will get an error
2377     // if they try to set values that are out of bounds.
2378     var self = this;
2379     if (this.__defineGetter__ && this.__defineSetter__) {
2380       // Use _latitude and _longitude to actually store the values, and add
2381       // getters and setters for latitude and longitude.
2382       this._latitude = this.latitude;
2383       this._longitude = this.longitude;
2384       this.__defineGetter__("latitude", function() {
2385         return self._latitude;
2386       });
2387       this.__defineGetter__("longitude", function() {
2388         return self._longitude;
2389       });
2390       this.__defineSetter__("latitude", function(val) {
2391         Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(val, self.longitude);
2392         self._latitude = val;
2393       });
2394       this.__defineSetter__("longitude", function(val) {
2395         Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(self.latitude, val);
2396         self._longitude = val;
2397       });
2398     }
2399   };

2401   /**
2402    * @lends Bmob.GeoPoint.prototype
2403    * @property {float} latitude North-south portion of the coordinate, in range
2404    *   [-90, 90].  Throws an exception if set out of range in a modern browser.
2405    * @property {float} longitude East-west portion of the coordinate, in range
2406    *   [-180, 180].  Throws if set out of range in a modern browser.
2407    */
2408 
2409   /**
2410    * Throws an exception if the given lat-long is out of bounds.
2411    */
2412   Bmob.GeoPoint._validate = function(latitude, longitude) {
2413     if (latitude < -90.0) {
2414       throw "Bmob.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " < -90.0.";
2415     }
2416     if (latitude > 90.0) {
2417       throw "Bmob.GeoPoint latitude " + latitude + " > 90.0.";
2418     }
2419     if (longitude < -180.0) {
2420       throw "Bmob.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " < -180.0.";
2421     }
2422     if (longitude > 180.0) {
2423       throw "Bmob.GeoPoint longitude " + longitude + " > 180.0.";
2424     }
2425   };
2426 
2427   /**
2428    * 使用用户当前的位置创建GeoPoint对象。
2429    * 成功时调用options.success，或者options.error。
2430    * @param {Object} options 调用成功或失败的回调
2431    */
2432   Bmob.GeoPoint.current = function(options) {
2433     var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
2434     navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(function(location) {
2435       promise.resolve(new Bmob.GeoPoint({
2436         latitude: location.coords.latitude,
2437         longitude: location.coords.longitude
2438       }));
2439 
2440     }, function(error) {
2441       promise.reject(error);
2442     });
2443 
2444     return promise._thenRunCallbacks(options);
2445   };

2447   Bmob.GeoPoint.prototype = {
2448     /**
2449      * 返回geopoint的json
2450      * @return {Object}
2451      */
2452     toJSON: function() {
2453       Bmob.GeoPoint._validate(this.latitude, this.longitude);
2454       return {
2455         "__type": "GeoPoint",
2456         latitude: this.latitude,
2457         longitude: this.longitude
2458       };
2459     },
2460 
2461     /**
2462      * 返回两个geopoint之间的弧度
2463      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point 另一个Bmob.GeoPoint.
2464      * @return {Number}
2465      */
2466     radiansTo: function(point) {
2467       var d2r = Math.PI / 180.0;
2468       var lat1rad = this.latitude * d2r;
2469       var long1rad = this.longitude * d2r;
2470       var lat2rad = point.latitude * d2r;
2471       var long2rad = point.longitude * d2r;
2472       var deltaLat = lat1rad - lat2rad;
2473       var deltaLong = long1rad - long2rad;
2474       var sinDeltaLatDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLat / 2);
2475       var sinDeltaLongDiv2 = Math.sin(deltaLong / 2);
2476       // Square of half the straight line chord distance between both points.
2477       var a = ((sinDeltaLatDiv2 * sinDeltaLatDiv2) +
2478                (Math.cos(lat1rad) * Math.cos(lat2rad) *
2479                 sinDeltaLongDiv2 * sinDeltaLongDiv2));
2480       a = Math.min(1.0, a);
2481       return 2 * Math.asin(Math.sqrt(a));
2482     },
2483 
2484     /**
2485      * 返回两个geopoint之间的千米数
2486      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point 另一个Bmob.GeoPoint.
2487      * @return {Number}
2488      */
2489     kilometersTo: function(point) {
2490       return this.radiansTo(point) * 6371.0;
2491     },
2492 
2493     /**
2494      * 返回两个geopoint之间的米数
2495      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point 另一个Bmob.GeoPoint.
2496      * @return {Number}
2497      */
2498     milesTo: function(point) {
2499       return this.radiansTo(point) * 3958.8;
2500     }
2501   };

2505 (function(root) {

2510   var PUBLIC_KEY = "*";
2511 
2512   /**
2513    * 创建ACL
2514    * 如果传任何参数，则任何人都没有权限
2515    * 如果传入的参数是Bmob.User，那个usr会有读写权限。
2516    * 如果传入的参数是json对象，则会有相应的acl权限。
2517    * 
2518    * @see Bmob.Object#setACL
2519    * @class
2520    *
2521    * <p>权限控制可以被添加到任何
2522    * <code>Bmob.Object</code>，用来控制用户的访问权限
2523    * </p>
2524    */
2525   Bmob.ACL = function(arg1) {
2526     var self = this;
2527     self.permissionsById = {};
2528     if (_.isObject(arg1)) {
2529       if (arg1 instanceof Bmob.User) {
2530         self.setReadAccess(arg1, true);
2531         self.setWriteAccess(arg1, true);
2532       } else {
2533         if (_.isFunction(arg1)) {
2534           throw "Bmob.ACL() called with a function.  Did you forget ()?";
2535         }
2536         Bmob._objectEach(arg1, function(accessList, userId) {
2537           if (!_.isString(userId)) {
2538             throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid userId.";
2539           }
2540           self.permissionsById[userId] = {};
2541           Bmob._objectEach(accessList, function(allowed, permission) {
2542             if (permission !== "read" && permission !== "write") {
2543               throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid permission type.";
2544             }
2545             if (!_.isBoolean(allowed)) {
2546               throw "Tried to create an ACL with an invalid permission value.";
2547             }
2548             self.permissionsById[userId][permission] = allowed;
2549           });
2550         });
2551       }
2552     }
2553   };
2554 
2555   /**
2556    * 返回acl的json对象
2557    * @return {Object}
2558    */
2559   Bmob.ACL.prototype.toJSON = function() {
2560     return _.clone(this.permissionsById);
2561   };

2563   Bmob.ACL.prototype._setAccess = function(accessType, userId, allowed) {
2564     if (userId instanceof Bmob.User) {
2565       userId = userId.id;
2566     } else if (userId instanceof Bmob.Role) {
2567       userId = "role:" + userId.getName();
2568     }
2569     if (!_.isString(userId)) {
2570       throw "userId must be a string.";
2571     }
2572     if (!_.isBoolean(allowed)) {
2573       throw "allowed must be either true or false.";
2574     }
2575     var permissions = this.permissionsById[userId];
2576     if (!permissions) {
2577       if (!allowed) {
2578         // The user already doesn't have this permission, so no action needed.
2579         return;
2580       } else {
2581         permissions = {};
2582         this.permissionsById[userId] = permissions;
2583       }
2584     }
2585 
2586     if (allowed) {
2587       this.permissionsById[userId][accessType] = true;
2588     } else {
2589       delete permissions[accessType];
2590       if (_.isEmpty(permissions)) {
2591         delete permissions[userId];
2592       }
2593     }
2594   };
2595 
2596   Bmob.ACL.prototype._getAccess = function(accessType, userId) {
2597     if (userId instanceof Bmob.User) {
2598       userId = userId.id;
2599     } else if (userId instanceof Bmob.Role) {
2600       userId = "role:" + userId.getName();
2601     }
2602     var permissions = this.permissionsById[userId];
2603     if (!permissions) {
2604       return false;
2605     }
2606     return permissions[accessType] ? true : false;
2607   };

2756   /**
2757    * A Bmob.Op is an atomic operation that can be applied to a field in a
2758    * Bmob.Object. For example, calling <code>object.set("foo", "bar")</code>
2759    * is an example of a Bmob.Op.Set. Calling <code>object.unset("foo")</code>
2760    * is a Bmob.Op.Unset. These operations are stored in a Bmob.Object and
2761    * sent to the server as part of <code>object.save()</code> operations.
2762    * Instances of Bmob.Op should be immutable.
2763    *
2764    * You should not create subclasses of Bmob.Op or instantiate Bmob.Op
2765    * directly.
2766    */
2767   Bmob.Op = function() {
2768     this._initialize.apply(this, arguments);
2769   };

2786      * instance of a subclass of Bmob.Op.
2787      */

2789       Bmob.Op._opDecoderMap[opName] = decoder;
2790     },

2793      * Converts a json object into an instance of a subclass of Bmob.Op.
2794      */
2795     _decode: function(json) {
2796       var decoder = Bmob.Op._opDecoderMap[json.__op];
2797       if (decoder) {
2798         return decoder(json);
2799       } else {
2800         return undefined;
2801       }
2802     }

2990    * 添加一个元素到数组中，当元素已经存在，将不会重复添加。

2992   Bmob.Op.AddUnique = Bmob.Op._extend(
2993       /** @lends Bmob.Op.AddUnique.prototype */ {
2994 
2995     _initialize: function(objects) {
2996       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
2997     },
2998 
2999     /**
3000      * 返回添加到数组中的对象
3001      * @return {Array} 添加到数组中的对象
3002      */
3003     objects: function() {
3004       return this._objects;
3005     },
3006 
3007     /**
3008      * 返回发送到bmob的json
3009      * @return {Object}
3010      */
3011     toJSON: function() {
3012       return { __op: "AddUnique", objects: Bmob._encode(this.objects()) };
3013     },
3014 
3015     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3016       if (!previous) {
3017         return this;
3018       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Unset) {
3019         return new Bmob.Op.Set(this.objects());
3020       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Set) {
3021         return new Bmob.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
3022       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.AddUnique) {
3023         return new Bmob.Op.AddUnique(this._estimate(previous.objects()));
3024       } else {
3025         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3026       }
3027     },
3028 
3029     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3030       if (!oldValue) {
3031         return _.clone(this.objects());
3032       } else {
3033         // We can't just take the _.uniq(_.union(...)) of oldValue and
3034         // this.objects, because the uniqueness may not apply to oldValue
3035         // (especially if the oldValue was set via .set())
3036         var newValue = _.clone(oldValue);
3037         Bmob._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
3038           if (obj instanceof Bmob.Object && obj.id) {
3039             var matchingObj = _.find(newValue, function(anObj) {
3040               return (anObj instanceof Bmob.Object) && (anObj.id === obj.id);
3041             });
3042             if (!matchingObj) {
3043               newValue.push(obj);
3044             } else {
3045               var index = _.indexOf(newValue, matchingObj);
3046               newValue[index] = obj;
3047             }
3048           } else if (!_.contains(newValue, obj)) {
3049             newValue.push(obj);
3050           }
3051         });
3052         return newValue;
3053       }
3054     }
3055   });

3058     return new Bmob.Op.AddUnique(Bmob._decode(undefined, json.objects));

3063    * 从数组中移除一个元素。

3065   Bmob.Op.Remove = Bmob.Op._extend(/** @lends Bmob.Op.Remove.prototype */ {
3066     _initialize: function(objects) {
3067       this._objects = _.uniq(objects);
3068     },
3069 
3070     /**
3071      * 返回移除出数组的对象
3072      * @return {Array} 移除出数组的对象
3073      */
3074     objects: function() {
3075       return this._objects;
3076     },
