3078     /**
3079      * 返回发送到bmob的json
3080      * @return {Object}
3081      */
3082     toJSON: function() {
3083       return { __op: "Remove", objects: Bmob._encode(this.objects()) };
3084     },
3085 
3086     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3087       if (!previous) {
3088         return this;
3089       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Unset) {
3090         return previous;
3091       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Set) {
3092         return new Bmob.Op.Set(this._estimate(previous.value()));
3093       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Remove) {
3094         return new Bmob.Op.Remove(_.union(previous.objects(), this.objects()));
3095       } else {
3096         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3097       }
3098     },
3099 
3100     _estimate: function(oldValue) {
3101       if (!oldValue) {
3102         return [];
3103       } else {
3104         var newValue = _.difference(oldValue, this.objects());
3105         // If there are saved Bmob Objects being removed, also remove them.
3106         Bmob._arrayEach(this.objects(), function(obj) {
3107           if (obj instanceof Bmob.Object && obj.id) {
3108             newValue = _.reject(newValue, function(other) {
3109               return (other instanceof Bmob.Object) && (other.id === obj.id);
3110             });
3111           }
3112         });
3113         return newValue;
3114       }
3115     }
3116   });

3122   /**
3123    * @class
3124    * 关系操作标明这个字段是Bmob.Relation的实体，同时对象可以从关系中添加或移除
3125    */
3126   Bmob.Op.Relation = Bmob.Op._extend(
3127       /** @lends Bmob.Op.Relation.prototype */ {
3128 
3129     _initialize: function(adds, removes) {
3130       this._targetClassName = null;
3131 
3132       var self = this;
3133 
3134       var pointerToId = function(object) {
3135         if (object instanceof Bmob.Object) {
3136           if (!object.id) {
3137             throw "You can't add an unsaved Bmob.Object to a relation.";
3138           }
3139           if (!self._targetClassName) {
3140             self._targetClassName = object.className;
3141           }
3142           if (self._targetClassName !== object.className) {
3143             throw "Tried to create a Bmob.Relation with 2 different types: " +
3144                   self._targetClassName + " and " + object.className + ".";
3145           }
3146           return object.id;
3147         }
3148         return object;
3149       };
3150 
3151       this.relationsToAdd = _.uniq(_.map(adds, pointerToId));
3152       this.relationsToRemove = _.uniq(_.map(removes, pointerToId));
3153     },
3154 
3155     /**
3156      * 返回添加到关系中的Bmob.Object的数组对象
3157      * @return {Array}
3158      */
3159     added: function() {
3160       var self = this;
3161       return _.map(this.relationsToAdd, function(objectId) {
3162         var object = Bmob.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
3163         object.id = objectId;
3164         return object;
3165       });
3166     },
3167 
3168     /**
3169      * 返回移除的Bmob.Object的数组对象
3170      * @return {Array}
3171      */
3172     removed: function() {
3173       var self = this;
3174       return _.map(this.relationsToRemove, function(objectId) {
3175         var object = Bmob.Object._create(self._targetClassName);
3176         object.id = objectId;
3177         return object;
3178       });
3179     },
3180 
3181     /**
3182      * 返回发送到bmob的json
3183      * @return {Object}
3184      */
3185     toJSON: function() {
3186       var adds = null;
3187       var removes = null;
3188       var self = this;
3189       var idToPointer = function(id) {
3190         return { __type: 'Pointer',
3191                  className: self._targetClassName,
3192                  objectId: id };
3193       };
3194       var pointers = null;
3195       if (this.relationsToAdd.length > 0) {
3196         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToAdd, idToPointer);
3197         adds = { "__op": "AddRelation", "objects": pointers };
3198       }
3199 
3200       if (this.relationsToRemove.length > 0) {
3201         pointers = _.map(this.relationsToRemove, idToPointer);
3202         removes = { "__op": "RemoveRelation", "objects": pointers };
3203       }
3204 
3205       if (adds && removes) {
3206         return { "__op": "Batch", "ops": [adds, removes]};
3207       }
3208 
3209       return adds || removes || {};
3210     },
3211 
3212     _mergeWithPrevious: function(previous) {
3213       if (!previous) {
3214         return this;
3215       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Unset) {
3216         throw "You can't modify a relation after deleting it.";
3217       } else if (previous instanceof Bmob.Op.Relation) {
3218         if (previous._targetClassName &&
3219             previous._targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
3220           throw "Related object must be of class " + previous._targetClassName +
3221               ", but " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
3222         }
3223         var newAdd = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToAdd,
3224                                           this.relationsToRemove),
3225                              this.relationsToAdd);
3226         var newRemove = _.union(_.difference(previous.relationsToRemove,
3227                                              this.relationsToAdd),
3228                                 this.relationsToRemove);
3229 
3230         var newRelation = new Bmob.Op.Relation(newAdd, newRemove);
3231         newRelation._targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3232         return newRelation;
3233       } else {
3234         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3235       }
3236     },
3237 
3238     _estimate: function(oldValue, object, key) {
3239       if (!oldValue) {
3240         var relation = new Bmob.Relation(object, key);
3241         relation.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3242       } else if (oldValue instanceof Bmob.Relation) {
3243         if (this._targetClassName) {
3244           if (oldValue.targetClassName) {
3245             if (oldValue.targetClassName !== this._targetClassName) {
3246               throw "Related object must be a " + oldValue.targetClassName +
3247                   ", but a " + this._targetClassName + " was passed in.";
3248             }
3249           } else {
3250             oldValue.targetClassName = this._targetClassName;
3251           }
3252         }
3253         return oldValue;
3254       } else {
3255         throw "Op is invalid after previous op.";
3256       }
3257     }
3258   });
3259 
3260   Bmob.Op._registerDecoder("AddRelation", function(json) {
3261     return new Bmob.Op.Relation(Bmob._decode(undefined, json.objects), []);
3262   });
3263   Bmob.Op._registerDecoder("RemoveRelation", function(json) {
3264     return new Bmob.Op.Relation([], Bmob._decode(undefined, json.objects));
3265   });

3274   /**
3275    * Creates a new Relation for the given parent object and key. This
3276    * constructor should rarely be used directly, but rather created by
3277    * Bmob.Object.relation.
3278    * @param {Bmob.Object} parent The parent of this relation.
3279    * @param {String} key The key for this relation on the parent.
3280    * @see Bmob.Object#relation
3281    *
3282    * <p>
3283    * A class that is used to access all of the children of a many-to-many
3284    * relationship.  Each instance of Bmob.Relation is associated with a
3285    * particular parent object and key.
3286    * </p>
3287    */
3288   Bmob.Relation = function(parent, key) {
3289     this.parent = parent;
3290     this.key = key;
3291     this.targetClassName = null;
3292   };
3293 
3294   /**
3295    * Creates a query that can be used to query the parent objects in this relation.
3296    * @param {String} parentClass The parent class or name.
3297    * @param {String} relationKey The relation field key in parent.
3298    * @param {Bmob.Object} child The child object.
3299    * @return {Bmob.Query}
3300    */
3301   Bmob.Relation.reverseQuery = function(parentClass, relationKey, child){
3302     var query = new Bmob.Query(parentClass);
3303     query.equalTo(relationKey, child._toPointer());
3304     return query;
3305   };
3306 
3307   Bmob.Relation.prototype = {
3308     /**
3309      * Makes sure that this relation has the right parent and key.
3310      */
3311     _ensureParentAndKey: function(parent, key) {
3312       this.parent = this.parent || parent;
3313       this.key = this.key || key;
3314       if (this.parent !== parent) {
3315         throw "Internal Error. Relation retrieved from two different Objects.";
3316       }
3317       if (this.key !== key) {
3318         throw "Internal Error. Relation retrieved from two different keys.";
3319       }
3320     },
3321 
3322     /**
3323      * Adds a Bmob.Object or an array of Bmob.Objects to the relation.
3324      * @param {} objects The item or items to add.
3325      */
3326     add: function(objects) {
3327       if (!_.isArray(objects)) {
3328         objects = [objects];
3329       }
3330 
3331       var change = new Bmob.Op.Relation(objects, []);
3332       this.parent.set(this.key, change);
3333       this.targetClassName = change._targetClassName;
3334     },
3335 
3336     /**
3337      * Removes a Bmob.Object or an array of Bmob.Objects from this relation.
3338      * @param {} objects The item or items to remove.
3339      */
3340     remove: function(objects) {
3341       if (!_.isArray(objects)) {
3342         objects = [objects];
3343       }
3344 
3345       var change = new Bmob.Op.Relation([], objects);
3346       this.parent.set(this.key, change);
3347       this.targetClassName = change._targetClassName;
3348     },
3349 
3350     /**
3351      * Returns a JSON version of the object suitable for saving to disk.
3352      * @return {Object}
3353      */
3354     toJSON: function() {
3355       return { "__type": "Relation", "className": this.targetClassName };
3356     },
3357 
3358     /**
3359      * Returns a Bmob.Query that is limited to objects in this
3360      * relation.
3361      * @return {Bmob.Query}
3362      */
3363     query: function() {
3364       var targetClass;
3365       var query;
3366       if (!this.targetClassName) {
3367         targetClass = Bmob.Object._getSubclass(this.parent.className);
3368         query = new Bmob.Query(targetClass);
3369         query._extraOptions.redirectClassNameForKey = this.key;
3370       } else {
3371         targetClass = Bmob.Object._getSubclass(this.targetClassName);
3372         query = new Bmob.Query(targetClass);
3373       }
3374       query._addCondition("$relatedTo", "object", this.parent._toPointer());
3375       query._addCondition("$relatedTo", "key", this.key);
3376 
3377       return query;
3378     }
3379   };

3382 (function(root) {
3383   root.Bmob = root.Bmob || {};
3384   var Bmob = root.Bmob;
3385   var _ = Bmob._;
3386 
3387   /**
3388    * A Promise is returned by async methods as a hook to provide callbacks to be
3389    * called when the async task is fulfilled.
3390    *
3391    * <p>Typical usage would be like:<pre>
3392    *    query.findAsync().then(function(results) {
3393    *      results[0].set("foo", "bar");
3394    *      return results[0].saveAsync();
3395    *    }).then(function(result) {
3396    *      console.log("Updated " + result.id);
3397    *    });
3398    * </pre></p>
3399    *
3400    * @see Bmob.Promise.prototype.next
3401    */
3402   Bmob.Promise = function() {
3403     this._resolved = false;
3404     this._rejected = false;
3405     this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3406     this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3407   };
3408 
3409   _.extend(Bmob.Promise, /** @lends Bmob.Promise */ {
3410 
3411     /**
3412      * Returns true iff the given object fulfils the Promise interface.
3413      * @return {Boolean}
3414      */
3415     is: function(promise) {
3416       return promise && promise.then && _.isFunction(promise.then);
3417     },
3418 
3419     /**
3420      * Returns a new promise that is resolved with a given value.
3421      * @return {Bmob.Promise} the new promise.
3422      */
3423     as: function() {
3424       var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
3425       promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3426       return promise;
3427     },
3428 
3429     /**
3430      * Returns a new promise that is rejected with a given error.
3431      * @return {Bmob.Promise} the new promise.
3432      */
3433     error: function() {
3434       var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
3435       promise.reject.apply(promise, arguments);
3436       return promise;
3437     },
3438 
3439     /**
3440      * Returns a new promise that is fulfilled when all of the input promises
3441      * are resolved. If any promise in the list fails, then the returned promise
3442      * will fail with the last error. If they all succeed, then the returned
3443      * promise will succeed, with the result being an array with the results of
3444      * all the input promises.
3445      * @param {Array} promises a list of promises to wait for.
3446      * @return {Bmob.Promise} the new promise.
3447      */
3448     when: function(promises) {
3449       // Allow passing in Promises as separate arguments instead of an Array.
3450       var objects;
3451       if (promises && Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(promises.length)) {
3452         objects = arguments;
3453       } else {
3454         objects = promises;
3455       }
3456 
3457       var total = objects.length;
3458       var hadError = false;
3459       var results = [];
3460       var errors = [];
3461       results.length = objects.length;
3462       errors.length = objects.length;
3463 
3464       if (total === 0) {
3465         return Bmob.Promise.as.apply(this, results);
3466       }
3467 
3468       var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
3469 
3470       var resolveOne = function() {
3471         total = total - 1;
3472         if (total === 0) {
3473           if (hadError) {
3474             promise.reject(errors);
3475           } else {
3476             promise.resolve.apply(promise, results);
3477           }
3478         }
3479       };
3480 
3481       Bmob._arrayEach(objects, function(object, i) {
3482         if (Bmob.Promise.is(object)) {
3483           object.then(function(result) {
3484             results[i] = result;
3485             resolveOne();
3486           }, function(error) {
3487             errors[i] = error;
3488             hadError = true;
3489             resolveOne();
3490           });
3491         } else {
3492           results[i] = object;
3493           resolveOne();
3494         }
3495       });
3496 
3497       return promise;
3498     },
3499 
3500     /**
3501      * Runs the given asyncFunction repeatedly, as long as the predicate
3502      * function returns a truthy value. Stops repeating if asyncFunction returns
3503      * a rejected promise.
3504      * @param {Function} predicate should return false when ready to stop.
3505      * @param {Function} asyncFunction should return a Promise.
3506      */
3507     _continueWhile: function(predicate, asyncFunction) {
3508       if (predicate()) {
3509         return asyncFunction().then(function() {
3510           return Bmob.Promise._continueWhile(predicate, asyncFunction);
3511         });
3512       }
3513       return Bmob.Promise.as();
3514     }
3515   });
3516 
3517   _.extend(Bmob.Promise.prototype, /** @lends Bmob.Promise.prototype */ {
3518 
3519     /**
3520      * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
3521      * @param {Object} result the result to pass to the callbacks.
3522      */
3523     resolve: function(result) {
3524       if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
3525         throw "A promise was resolved even though it had already been " +
3526           (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
3527       }
3528       this._resolved = true;
3529       this._result = arguments;
3530       var results = arguments;
3531       Bmob._arrayEach(this._resolvedCallbacks, function(resolvedCallback) {
3532         resolvedCallback.apply(this, results);
3533       });
3534       this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3535       this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3536     },
3537 
3538     /**
3539      * Marks this promise as fulfilled, firing any callbacks waiting on it.
3540      * @param {Object} error the error to pass to the callbacks.
3541      */
3542     reject: function(error) {
3543       if (this._resolved || this._rejected) {
3544         throw "A promise was rejected even though it had already been " +
3545           (this._resolved ? "resolved" : "rejected") + ".";
3546       }
3547       this._rejected = true;
3548       this._error = error;
3549       Bmob._arrayEach(this._rejectedCallbacks, function(rejectedCallback) {
3550         rejectedCallback(error);
3551       });
3552       this._resolvedCallbacks = [];
3553       this._rejectedCallbacks = [];
3554     },
3555 
3556     /**
3557      * Adds callbacks to be called when this promise is fulfilled. Returns a new
3558      * Promise that will be fulfilled when the callback is complete. It allows
3559      * chaining. If the callback itself returns a Promise, then the one returned
3560      * by "then" will not be fulfilled until that one returned by the callback
3561      * is fulfilled.
3562      * @param {Function} resolvedCallback Function that is called when this
3563      * Promise is resolved. Once the callback is complete, then the Promise
3564      * returned by "then" will also be fulfilled.
3565      * @param {Function} rejectedCallback Function that is called when this
3566      * Promise is rejected with an error. Once the callback is complete, then
3567      * the promise returned by "then" with be resolved successfully. If
3568      * rejectedCallback is null, or it returns a rejected Promise, then the
3569      * Promise returned by "then" will be rejected with that error.
3570      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A new Promise that will be fulfilled after this
3571      * Promise is fulfilled and either callback has completed. If the callback
3572      * returned a Promise, then this Promise will not be fulfilled until that
3573      * one is.
3574      */
3575     then: function(resolvedCallback, rejectedCallback) {
3576       var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
3577 
3578       var wrappedResolvedCallback = function() {
3579         var result = arguments;
3580         if (resolvedCallback) {
3581           result = [resolvedCallback.apply(this, result)];
3582         }
3583         if (result.length === 1 && Bmob.Promise.is(result[0])) {
3584           result[0].then(function() {
3585             promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3586           }, function(error) {
3587             promise.reject(error);
3588           });
3589         } else {
3590           promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
3591         }
3592       };
3593 
3594       var wrappedRejectedCallback = function(error) {
3595         var result = [];
3596         if (rejectedCallback) {
3597           result = [rejectedCallback(error)];
3598           if (result.length === 1 && Bmob.Promise.is(result[0])) {
3599             result[0].then(function() {
3600               promise.resolve.apply(promise, arguments);
3601             }, function(error) {
3602               promise.reject(error);
3603             });
3604           } else {
3605             // A Promises/A+ compliant implementation would call:
3606             // promise.resolve.apply(promise, result);
3607             promise.reject(result[0]);
3608           }
3609         } else {
3610           promise.reject(error);
3611         }
3612       };
3613 
3614       if (this._resolved) {
3615         wrappedResolvedCallback.apply(this, this._result);
3616       } else if (this._rejected) {
3617         wrappedRejectedCallback(this._error);
3618       } else {
3619         this._resolvedCallbacks.push(wrappedResolvedCallback);
3620         this._rejectedCallbacks.push(wrappedRejectedCallback);
3621       }
3622 
3623       return promise;
3624     },
3625 
3626     /**
3627      * Run the given callbacks after this promise is fulfilled.
3628      * @param optionsOrCallback {} A Backbone-style options callback, or a
3629      * callback function. If this is an options object and contains a "model"
3630      * attributes, that will be passed to error callbacks as the first argument.
3631      * @param model {} If truthy, this will be passed as the first result of
3632      * error callbacks. This is for Backbone-compatability.
3633      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that will be resolved after the
3634      * callbacks are run, with the same result as this.
3635      */
3636     _thenRunCallbacks: function(optionsOrCallback, model) {
3637       var options;
3638       if (_.isFunction(optionsOrCallback)) {
3639         var callback = optionsOrCallback;
3640         options = {
3641           success: function(result) {
3642             callback(result, null);
3643           },
3644           error: function(error) {
3645             callback(null, error);
3646           }
3647         };
3648       } else {
3649         options = _.clone(optionsOrCallback);
3650       }
3651       options = options || {};
3652 
3653       return this.then(function(result) {
3654         if (options.success) {
3655           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
3656         } else if (model) {
3657           // When there's no callback, a sync event should be triggered.
3658           model.trigger('sync', model, result, options);
3659         }
3660         return Bmob.Promise.as.apply(Bmob.Promise, arguments);
3661       }, function(error) {
3662         if (options.error) {
3663           if (!_.isUndefined(model)) {
3664             options.error(model, error);
3665           } else {
3666             options.error(error);
3667           }
3668         } else if (model) {
3669           // When there's no error callback, an error event should be triggered.
3670           model.trigger('error', model, error, options);
3671         }
3672         // By explicitly returning a rejected Promise, this will work with
3673         // either jQuery or Promises/A semantics.
3674         return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
3675       });
3676     },
3677 
3678     /**
3679      * Adds a callback function that should be called regardless of whether
3680      * this promise failed or succeeded. The callback will be given either the
3681      * array of results for its first argument, or the error as its second,
3682      * depending on whether this Promise was rejected or resolved. Returns a
3683      * new Promise, like "then" would.
3684      * @param {Function} continuation the callback.
3685      */
3686     _continueWith: function(continuation) {
3687       return this.then(function() {
3688         return continuation(arguments, null);
3689       }, function(error) {
3690         return continuation(null, error);
3691       });
3692     }
3693 
3694   });
3695 
3696 }(this));

3704   var b64Digit = function(number) {
3705     if (number < 26) {
3706       return String.fromCharCode(65 + number);
3707     }
3708     if (number < 52) {
3709       return String.fromCharCode(97 + (number - 26));
3710     }
3711     if (number < 62) {
3712       return String.fromCharCode(48 + (number - 52));
3713     }
3714     if (number === 62) {
3715       return "+";
3716     }
3717     if (number === 63) {
3718       return "/";
3719     }
3720     throw "Tried to encode large digit " + number + " in base64.";
3721   };
3722 
3723 
3724   var encodeBase64 = function(str) {
3725     var base64EncodeChars = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
3726 
3727     var out, i, len;
3728     var c1, c2, c3;
3729 
3730     len = str.length;
3731     i = 0;
3732     out = "";
3733     while(i < len) {
3734       c1 = str.charCodeAt(i++) & 0xff;
3735       if(i == len)
3736       {
3737           out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(c1 >> 2);
3738           out += base64EncodeChars.charAt((c1 & 0x3) << 4);
3739           out += "==";
3740           break;
3741       }
3742       c2 = str.charCodeAt(i++);
3743       if(i == len)
3744       {
3745           out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(c1 >> 2);
3746           out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(((c1 & 0x3)<< 4) | ((c2 & 0xF0) >> 4));
3747           out += base64EncodeChars.charAt((c2 & 0xF) << 2);
3748           out += "=";
3749           break;
3750       }
3751       c3 = str.charCodeAt(i++);
3752       out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(c1 >> 2);
3753       out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(((c1 & 0x3)<< 4) | ((c2 & 0xF0) >> 4));
3754       out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(((c2 & 0xF) << 2) | ((c3 & 0xC0) >>6));
3755       out += base64EncodeChars.charAt(c3 & 0x3F);
3756     }
3757     return out;
3758 
3759 
3760   };

3963   /**
3964    * Reads a File using a FileReader.
3965    * @param file {File} the File to read.

3969    */
3970   var readAsync = function(file, type) {
3971     var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
3972 
3973     if (typeof(FileReader) === "undefined") {
3974       return Bmob.Promise.error(new Bmob.Error(
3975           -1, "Attempted to use a FileReader on an unsupported browser."));
3976     }
3977 
3978     var reader = new FileReader();
3979     reader.onloadend = function() {
3980 
3981 
3982       promise.resolve(reader.result);
3983     };
3984     reader.readAsBinaryString(file);
3985     return promise;
3986   };

3988   /**
3989    *  Bmob.File 保存文件到bmob
3990    * cloud.
3991    * @param name {String} 文件名。在服务器中，这会改为唯一的文件名
3992    * @param data {file} 文件的数据
3993    *     
3994    *     文件对象是在" file upload control"中被选中，只能在下面的浏览器使用
3995    *        in Firefox 3.6+, Safari 6.0.2+, Chrome 7+, and IE 10+.
3996    *        例如:<pre>
3997    *     
3998    * var fileUploadControl = $("#profilePhotoFileUpload")[0];
3999    * if (fileUploadControl.files.length > 0) {
4000    *   var file = fileUploadControl.files[0];
4001    *   var name = "photo.jpg";
4002    *   var bmobFile = new Bmob.File(name, file);
4003    *   bmobFile.save().then(function() {
4004    *     // The file has been saved to Bmob.
4005    *   }, function(error) {
4006    *     // The file either could not be read, or could not be saved to Bmob.
4007    *   });
4008    * }</pre>
4009    * @param type {String} 文件的类型.
4010    */
4011   Bmob.File = function(name, data, type) {
4012     // this._name = name;
4013     this._name = encodeBase64(name);
4014     // this._name = "aGVsbG8udHh0";
4015     var currentUser = Bmob.User.current();
4016     this._metaData = {
4017        owner: (currentUser !=null ? currentUser.id : 'unknown')
4018     };
4019 
4020     // Guess the content type from the extension if we need to.
4021     var extension = /\.([^.]*)$/.exec(name);
4022     if (extension) {
4023       extension = extension[1].toLowerCase();
4024     }
4025     var guessedType = type || mimeTypes[extension] || "text/plain";
4026     this._guessedType = guessedType;
4027 
4028     if (typeof(File) !== "undefined" && data instanceof File) {
4029       this._source = readAsync(data, type);
4030     } else {
4031       // throw "Creating a Bmob.File from a String is not yet supported.";
4032       this._source = Bmob.Promise.as(data, guessedType);
4033       this._metaData.size = data.length;      
4034     }
4035   };

4064     group: function() {

4068     /**
4069     * <p>Returns the file's metadata JSON object if no arguments is given.Returns the
4070     * metadata value if a key is given.Set metadata value if key and value are both given.</p>
4071     * <p><pre>
4072     *  var metadata = file.metaData(); //Get metadata JSON object.
4073     *  var size = file.metaData('size');  // Get the size metadata value.
4074     *  file.metaData('format', 'jpeg'); //set metadata attribute and value.
4075     *</pre></p>
4076     * @return {Object} The file's metadata JSON object.
4077     * @param {String} attr an optional metadata key.
4078     * @param {Object} value an optional metadata value.
4079     **/
4080     metaData: function(attr, value) {
4081       if(attr != null && value != null){
4082          this._metaData[attr] = value;
4083          return this;
4084       }else if(attr != null){
4085          return this._metaData[attr];
4086       }else{
4087         return this._metaData;
4088       }
4089     },

4093      * Destroy the file.
4094      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
4095      *     completes.
4096      */
4097     destroy: function(options){
4098       if(!this._url && !this._group )
4099         return Bmob.Promise.error('The file url and group is not eixsts.')._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4100       
4101       var data = {
4102               group: this._group,
4103               _ContentType: "application/json",
4104               url: this._url,
4105               metaData: self._metaData,
4106             };
4107       var request = Bmob._request("files", null, null, 'DELETE',data);
4108       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4109     },
4110 
4111     /**
4112      * Saves the file to the Bmob cloud.
4113      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
4114      * @return {Bmob.Promise} Promise that is resolved when the save finishes.
4115      */
4116     save: function(options) {
4117       var self = this;
4118       if (!self._previousSave) {
4119         if(self._source){
4120           self._previousSave = self._source.then(function(base64, type) {
4121             var data = {
4122               base64: encodeBase64(base64),
4123               _ContentType: "text/plain",
4124               mime_type: "text/plain",
4125               metaData: self._metaData,
4126             };
4127             if(!self._metaData.size){
4128               self._metaData.size = base64.length;
4129             }
4130             return Bmob._request("files", self._name, null, 'POST', data);
4131           }).then(function(response) {
4132 
4133             self._name = response.filename;
4134             self._url = response.url;
4135             self._group = response.group;
4136 
4137             return self;
4138           });
4139         } else  {
4140           throw "not source file"
4141         }
4142       }
4143       return self._previousSave._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4144     }
4145   };

4149 // Bmob.Object is analogous to the Java BmobObject.
4150 // It also implements the same interface as a Backbone model.
4151 
4152 (function(root) {
4153   root.Bmob = root.Bmob || {};
4154   var Bmob = root.Bmob;
4155   var _ = Bmob._;
4156 
4157   /**
4158    * Creates a new model with defined attributes. A client id (cid) is
4159    * automatically generated and assigned for you.
4160    *
4161    * <p>You won't normally call this method directly.  It is recommended that
4162    * you use a subclass of <code>Bmob.Object</code> instead, created by calling
4163    * <code>extend</code>.</p>
4164    *
4165    * <p>However, if you don't want to use a subclass, or aren't sure which
4166    * subclass is appropriate, you can use this form:<pre>
4167    *     var object = new Bmob.Object("ClassName");
4168    * </pre>
4169    * That is basically equivalent to:<pre>
4170    *     var MyClass = Bmob.Object.extend("ClassName");
4171    *     var object = new MyClass();
4172    * </pre></p>
4173    *
4174    * @param {Object} attributes The initial set of data to store in the object.
4175    * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for creating the
4176    *     object.  The only option currently supported is "collection".
4177    * @see Bmob.Object.extend
4178    *
4179    *
4180    * <p>The fundamental unit of Bmob data, which implements the Backbone Model
4181    * interface.</p>
4182    */
4183   Bmob.Object = function(attributes, options) {
4184     // Allow new Bmob.Object("ClassName") as a shortcut to _create.
4185     if (_.isString(attributes)) {
4186       return Bmob.Object._create.apply(this, arguments);
4187     }
4188 
4189     attributes = attributes || {};
4190     if (options && options.parse) {
4191       attributes = this.parse(attributes);
4192     }
4193     var defaults = Bmob._getValue(this, 'defaults');
4194     if (defaults) {
4195       attributes = _.extend({}, defaults, attributes);
4196     }
4197     if (options && options.collection) {
4198       this.collection = options.collection;
4199     }
4200 
4201     this._serverData = {};  // The last known data for this object from cloud.
4202     this._opSetQueue = [{}];  // List of sets of changes to the data.
4203     this.attributes = {};  // The best estimate of this's current data.
4204 
4205     this._hashedJSON = {};  // Hash of values of containers at last save.
4206     this._escapedAttributes = {};
4207     this.cid = _.uniqueId('c');
4208     this.changed = {};
4209     this._silent = {};
4210     this._pending = {};
4211     if (!this.set(attributes, {silent: true})) {
4212       throw new Error("Can't create an invalid Bmob.Object");
4213     }
4214     this.changed = {};
4215     this._silent = {};
4216     this._pending = {};
4217     this._hasData = true;
4218     this._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
4219     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
4220   };
4221 
4222   /**
4223    * @lends Bmob.Object.prototype
4224    * @property {String} id The objectId of the Bmob Object.
4225    */
4226 
4227   /**
4228    * Saves the given list of Bmob.Object.
4229    * If any error is encountered, stops and calls the error handler.
4230    * There are two ways you can call this function.
4231    *
4232    * The Backbone way:<pre>
4233    *   Bmob.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], {
4234    *     success: function(list) {
4235    *       // All the objects were saved.
4236    *     },
4237    *     error: function(error) {
4238    *       // An error occurred while saving one of the objects.
4239    *     },
4240    *   });
4241    * </pre>
4242    * A simplified syntax:<pre>
4243    *   Bmob.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], function(list, error) {
4244    *     if (list) {
4245    *       // All the objects were saved.
4246    *     } else {
4247    *       // An error occurred.
4248    *     }
4249    *   });
4250    * </pre>
4251    *
4252    * @param {Array} list A list of <code>Bmob.Object</code>.
4253    * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style callback object.
4254    */
4255   Bmob.Object.saveAll = function(list, options) {
4256     return Bmob.Object._deepSaveAsync(list)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
4257   };

4259   // Attach all inheritable methods to the Bmob.Object prototype.
4260   _.extend(Bmob.Object.prototype, Bmob.Events,
4261            /** @lends Bmob.Object.prototype */ {
4262     _existed: false,
4263     _fetchWhenSave: false,
4264 
4265     /**
4266      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
4267      * initialization logic.
4268      */
4269     initialize: function(){},
4270 
4271    /**
4272      * Set whether to enable fetchWhenSave option when updating object.
4273      * When set true, SDK would fetch the latest object after saving.
4274      * Default is false.
4275      * @param {boolean} enable  true to enable fetchWhenSave option.
4276      */
4277     fetchWhenSave: function(enable){
4278       if (typeof enable !== 'boolean'){
4279         throw "Expect boolean value for fetchWhenSave";
4280       }
4281       this._fetchWhenSave = enable;
4282     },
4283 
4284     /**
4285      * Returns a JSON version of the object suitable for saving to Bmob.
4286      * @return {Object}
4287      */
4288     toJSON: function() {
4289       var json = this._toFullJSON();
4290       Bmob._arrayEach(["__type", "className"],
4291                        function(key) { delete json[key]; });
4292       return json;
4293     },
4294 
4295     _toFullJSON: function(seenObjects) {
4296       var json = _.clone(this.attributes);
4297       Bmob._objectEach(json, function(val, key) {
4298         json[key] = Bmob._encode(val, seenObjects);
4299       });
4300       Bmob._objectEach(this._operations, function(val, key) {
4301         json[key] = val;
4302       });
4303 
4304       if (_.has(this, "id")) {
4305         json.objectId = this.id;
4306       }
4307       if (_.has(this, "createdAt")) {
4308         if (_.isDate(this.createdAt)) {
4309           json.createdAt = this.createdAt.toJSON();
4310         } else {
4311           json.createdAt = this.createdAt;
4312         }
4313       }
4314 
4315       if (_.has(this, "updatedAt")) {
4316         if (_.isDate(this.updatedAt)) {
4317           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt.toJSON();
4318         } else {
4319           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt;
4320         }
4321       }
4322       json.__type = "Object";
4323       json.className = this.className;
4324       return json;
4325     },
4326 
4327     /**
4328      * Updates _hashedJSON to reflect the current state of this object.
4329      * Adds any changed hash values to the set of pending changes.
4330      */
4331     _refreshCache: function() {
4332       var self = this;
4333       if (self._refreshingCache) {
4334         return;
4335       }
4336       self._refreshingCache = true;
4337       Bmob._objectEach(this.attributes, function(value, key) {
4338         if (value instanceof Bmob.Object) {
4339           value._refreshCache();
4340         } else if (_.isObject(value)) {
4341           if (self._resetCacheForKey(key)) {
4342             self.set(key, new Bmob.Op.Set(value), { silent: true });
4343           }
4344         }
4345       });
4346       delete self._refreshingCache;
4347     },
4348 
4349     /**
4350      * Returns true if this object has been modified since its last
4351      * save/refresh.  If an attribute is specified, it returns true only if that
4352      * particular attribute has been modified since the last save/refresh.
4353      * @param {String} attr An attribute name (optional).
4354      * @return {Boolean}
4355      */
4356     dirty: function(attr) {
4357       this._refreshCache();
4358 
4359       var currentChanges = _.last(this._opSetQueue);
4360 
4361       if (attr) {
4362         return (currentChanges[attr] ? true : false);
4363       }
4364       if (!this.id) {
4365         return true;
4366       }
4367       if (_.keys(currentChanges).length > 0) {
4368         return true;
4369       }
4370       return false;
4371     },
4372 
4373     /**

4382                objectId: this.id };

4393     /**
4394      * Gets a relation on the given class for the attribute.
4395      * @param String attr The attribute to get the relation for.
4396      */
4397     relation: function(attr) {
4398       var value = this.get(attr);
4399       if (value) {
4400         if (!(value instanceof Bmob.Relation)) {
4401           throw "Called relation() on non-relation field " + attr;
4402         }
4403         value._ensureParentAndKey(this, attr);
4404         return value;
4405       } else {
4406         return new Bmob.Relation(this, attr);
4407       }
4408     },
4409 
4410     /**
4411      * Gets the HTML-escaped value of an attribute.
4412      */
4413     escape: function(attr) {
4414       var html = this._escapedAttributes[attr];
4415       if (html) {
4416         return html;
4417       }
4418       var val = this.attributes[attr];
4419       var escaped;
4420       if (Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(val)) {
4421         escaped = '';
4422       } else {
4423         escaped = _.escape(val.toString());
4424       }
4425       this._escapedAttributes[attr] = escaped;
4426       return escaped;
4427     },
4428 
4429     /**
4430      * Returns <code>true</code> if the attribute contains a value that is not
4431      * null or undefined.
4432      * @param {String} attr The string name of the attribute.
4433      * @return {Boolean}
4434      */
4435     has: function(attr) {
4436       return !Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(this.attributes[attr]);
4437     },
4438 
4439     /**
4440      * Pulls "special" fields like objectId, createdAt, etc. out of attrs
4441      * and puts them on "this" directly.  Removes them from attrs.
4442      * @param attrs - A dictionary with the data for this Bmob.Object.
4443      */
4444     _mergeMagicFields: function(attrs) {
4445       // Check for changes of magic fields.
4446       var model = this;
4447       var specialFields = ["id", "objectId", "createdAt", "updatedAt"];
4448       Bmob._arrayEach(specialFields, function(attr) {
4449         if (attrs[attr]) {
4450           if (attr === "objectId") {
4451             model.id = attrs[attr];
4452           } else if ((attr === "createdAt" || attr === "updatedAt") &&
4453                      !_.isDate(attrs[attr])) {
4454             model[attr] = Bmob._parseDate(attrs[attr]);
4455           } else {
4456             model[attr] = attrs[attr];
4457           }
4458           delete attrs[attr];
4459         }
4460       });
4461     },
4462 
4463     /**
4464      * Returns the json to be sent to the server.
4465      */
4466     _startSave: function() {
4467       this._opSetQueue.push({});
4468     },
4469 
4470     /**
4471      * Called when a save fails because of an error. Any changes that were part
4472      * of the save need to be merged with changes made after the save. This
4473      * might throw an exception is you do conflicting operations. For example,
4474      * if you do:
4475      *   object.set("foo", "bar");
4476      *   object.set("invalid field name", "baz");
4477      *   object.save();
4478      *   object.increment("foo");
4479      * then this will throw when the save fails and the client tries to merge
4480      * "bar" with the +1.
4481      */
4482     _cancelSave: function() {
4483       var self = this;
4484       var failedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
4485       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
4486       var nextChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
4487       Bmob._objectEach(failedChanges, function(op, key) {
4488         var op1 = failedChanges[key];
4489         var op2 = nextChanges[key];
4490         if (op1 && op2) {
4491           nextChanges[key] = op2._mergeWithPrevious(op1);
4492         } else if (op1) {
4493           nextChanges[key] = op1;
4494         }
4495       });
4496       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
4497     },
4498 
4499     /**
4500      * Called when a save completes successfully. This merges the changes that
4501      * were saved into the known server data, and overrides it with any data
4502      * sent directly from the server.
4503      */
4504     _finishSave: function(serverData) {
4505       // Grab a copy of any object referenced by this object. These instances
4506       // may have already been fetched, and we don't want to lose their data.
4507       // Note that doing it like this means we will unify separate copies of the
4508       // same object, but that's a risk we have to take.
4509       var fetchedObjects = {};
4510       Bmob._traverse(this.attributes, function(object) {
4511         if (object instanceof Bmob.Object && object.id && object._hasData) {
4512           fetchedObjects[object.id] = object;
4513         }
4514       });
4515 
4516       var savedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
4517       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
4518       this._applyOpSet(savedChanges, this._serverData);
4519       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
4520       var self = this;
4521       Bmob._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
4522         self._serverData[key] = Bmob._decode(key, value);
4523 
4524         // Look for any objects that might have become unfetched and fix them
4525         // by replacing their values with the previously observed values.
4526         var fetched = Bmob._traverse(self._serverData[key], function(object) {
4527           if (object instanceof Bmob.Object && fetchedObjects[object.id]) {
4528             return fetchedObjects[object.id];
4529           }
4530         });
4531         if (fetched) {
4532           self._serverData[key] = fetched;
4533         }
4534       });
4535       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
4536       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
4537     },
4538 
4539     /**
4540      * Called when a fetch or login is complete to set the known server data to
4541      * the given object.
4542      */
4543     _finishFetch: function(serverData, hasData) {
4544       // Clear out any changes the user might have made previously.
4545       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
4546 
4547       // Bring in all the new server data.
4548       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
4549       var self = this;
4550       Bmob._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
4551         self._serverData[key] = Bmob._decode(key, value);
4552       });
4553 
4554       // Refresh the attributes.
4555       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
4556 
4557       // Clear out the cache of mutable containers.
4558       this._refreshCache();
4559       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
4560 
4561       this._hasData = hasData;
4562     },
4563 
4564     /**
4565      * Applies the set of Bmob.Op in opSet to the object target.
4566      */
4567     _applyOpSet: function(opSet, target) {
4568       var self = this;
4569       Bmob._objectEach(opSet, function(change, key) {
4570         target[key] = change._estimate(target[key], self, key);
4571         if (target[key] === Bmob.Op._UNSET) {
4572           delete target[key];
4573         }
4574       });
4575     },
4576 
4577     /**
4578      * Replaces the cached value for key with the current value.
4579      * Returns true if the new value is different than the old value.
4580      */
4581     _resetCacheForKey: function(key) {
4582       var value = this.attributes[key];
4583       if (_.isObject(value) &&
4584           !(value instanceof Bmob.Object) &&
4585           !(value instanceof Bmob.File)) {
4586         value = value.toJSON ? value.toJSON() : value;
4587         var json = JSON.stringify(value);
4588         if (this._hashedJSON[key] !== json) {
4589           this._hashedJSON[key] = json;
4590           return true;
4591         }
4592       }
4593       return false;
4594     },
4595 
4596     /**
4597      * Populates attributes[key] by starting with the last known data from the
4598      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made to that
4599      * key since then.
4600      */
4601     _rebuildEstimatedDataForKey: function(key) {
4602       var self = this;
4603       delete this.attributes[key];
4604       if (this._serverData[key]) {
4605         this.attributes[key] = this._serverData[key];
4606       }
4607       Bmob._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
4608         var op = opSet[key];
4609         if (op) {
4610           self.attributes[key] = op._estimate(self.attributes[key], self, key);
4611           if (self.attributes[key] === Bmob.Op._UNSET) {
4612             delete self.attributes[key];
4613           } else {
4614             self._resetCacheForKey(key);
4615           }
4616         }
4617       });
4618     },
4619 
4620     /**
4621      * Populates attributes by starting with the last known data from the
4622      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made since
4623      * then.
4624      */
4625     _rebuildAllEstimatedData: function() {
4626       var self = this;
4627 
4628       var previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
4629 
4630       this.attributes = _.clone(this._serverData);
4631       Bmob._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
4632         self._applyOpSet(opSet, self.attributes);
4633         Bmob._objectEach(opSet, function(op, key) {
4634           self._resetCacheForKey(key);
4635         });
4636       });
4637 
4638       // Trigger change events for anything that changed because of the fetch.
4639       Bmob._objectEach(previousAttributes, function(oldValue, key) {
4640         if (self.attributes[key] !== oldValue) {
4641           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, self.attributes[key], {});
4642         }
4643       });
4644       Bmob._objectEach(this.attributes, function(newValue, key) {
4645         if (!_.has(previousAttributes, key)) {
4646           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, newValue, {});
4647         }
4648       });
4649     },
4650 
4651     /**
4652      * Sets a hash of model attributes on the object, firing
4653      * <code>"change"</code> unless you choose to silence it.
4654      *
4655      * <p>You can call it with an object containing keys and values, or with one
4656      * key and value.  For example:<pre>
4657      *   gameTurn.set({
4658      *     player: player1,
4659      *     diceRoll: 2
4660      *   }, {
4661      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
4662      *       // The set failed validation.
4663      *     }
4664      *   });
4665      *
4666      *   game.set("currentPlayer", player2, {
4667      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
4668      *       // The set failed validation.
4669      *     }
4670      *   });
4671      *
4672      *   game.set("finished", true);</pre></p>
4673      *
4674      * @param {String} key The key to set.
4675      * @param {} value The value to give it.
4676      * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for the set.
4677      *     The only supported options are <code>silent</code>,
4678      *     <code>error</code>, and <code>promise</code>.
4679      * @return {Boolean} true if the set succeeded.
4680      * @see Bmob.Object#validate
4681      * @see Bmob.Error
4682      */
4683     set: function(key, value, options) {
4684       var attrs, attr;
4685       if (_.isObject(key) || Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(key)) {
4686         attrs = key;
4687         Bmob._objectEach(attrs, function(v, k) {
4688           attrs[k] = Bmob._decode(k, v);
4689         });
4690         options = value;
4691       } else {
4692         attrs = {};
4693         attrs[key] = Bmob._decode(key, value);
4694       }
4695 
4696       // Extract attributes and options.
4697       options = options || {};
4698       if (!attrs) {
4699         return this;
4700       }
4701       if (attrs instanceof Bmob.Object) {
4702         attrs = attrs.attributes;
4703       }
4704 
4705       // If the unset option is used, every attribute should be a Unset.
4706       if (options.unset) {
4707         Bmob._objectEach(attrs, function(unused_value, key) {
4708           attrs[key] = new Bmob.Op.Unset();
4709         });
4710       }
4711 
4712       // Apply all the attributes to get the estimated values.
4713       var dataToValidate = _.clone(attrs);
4714       var self = this;
4715       Bmob._objectEach(dataToValidate, function(value, key) {
4716         if (value instanceof Bmob.Op) {
4717           dataToValidate[key] = value._estimate(self.attributes[key],
4718                                                 self, key);
4719           if (dataToValidate[key] === Bmob.Op._UNSET) {
4720             delete dataToValidate[key];
4721           }
4722         }
4723       });
4724 
4725       // Run validation.
4726       if (!this._validate(attrs, options)) {
4727         return false;
4728       }
4729 
4730       this._mergeMagicFields(attrs);
4731 
4732       options.changes = {};
4733       var escaped = this._escapedAttributes;
4734       var prev = this._previousAttributes || {};
4735 
4736       // Update attributes.
4737       Bmob._arrayEach(_.keys(attrs), function(attr) {
4738         var val = attrs[attr];
4739 
4740         // If this is a relation object we need to set the parent correctly,
4741         // since the location where it was parsed does not have access to
4742         // this object.
4743         if (val instanceof Bmob.Relation) {
4744           val.parent = self;
4745         }
4746 
4747         if (!(val instanceof Bmob.Op)) {
4748           val = new Bmob.Op.Set(val);
4749         }
4750 
4751         // See if this change will actually have any effect.
4752         var isRealChange = true;
4753         if (val instanceof Bmob.Op.Set &&
4754             _.isEqual(self.attributes[attr], val.value)) {
4755           isRealChange = false;
4756         }
4757 
4758         if (isRealChange) {
4759           delete escaped[attr];
4760           if (options.silent) {
4761             self._silent[attr] = true;
4762           } else {
4763             options.changes[attr] = true;
4764           }
4765         }
4766 
4767         var currentChanges = _.last(self._opSetQueue);
4768         currentChanges[attr] = val._mergeWithPrevious(currentChanges[attr]);
4769         self._rebuildEstimatedDataForKey(attr);
4770 
4771         if (isRealChange) {
4772           self.changed[attr] = self.attributes[attr];
4773           if (!options.silent) {
4774             self._pending[attr] = true;
4775           }
4776         } else {
4777           delete self.changed[attr];
4778           delete self._pending[attr];
4779         }
4780       });
4781 
4782       if (!options.silent) {
4783         this.change(options);
4784       }
4785       return this;
4786     },
4787 
4788     /**
4789      * Remove an attribute from the model, firing <code>"change"</code> unless
4790      * you choose to silence it. This is a noop if the attribute doesn't
4791      * exist.
4792      */
4793     unset: function(attr, options) {
4794       options = options || {};
4795       options.unset = true;
4796       return this.set(attr, null, options);
4797     },

4799     /**
4800      * Atomically increments the value of the given attribute the next time the
4801      * object is saved. If no amount is specified, 1 is used by default.
4802      *
4803      * @param attr {String} The key.
4804      * @param amount {Number} The amount to increment by.
4805      */
4806     increment: function(attr, amount) {
4807       if (_.isUndefined(amount) || _.isNull(amount)) {
4808         amount = 1;
4809       }
4810       return this.set(attr, new Bmob.Op.Increment(amount));

4870     /**
4871      * Returns a JSON-encoded set of operations to be sent with the next save
4872      * request.
4873      */
4874     _getSaveJSON: function() {

4876       Bmob._objectEach(json, function(op, key) {
4877         json[key] = op.toJSON();
4878       });
4879       return json;
4880     },

4889     /**
4890      * Fetch the model from the server. If the server's representation of the
4891      * model differs from its current attributes, they will be overriden,
4892      * triggering a <code>"change"</code> event.
4893      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the fetch
4894      *     completes.
4895      */
4896     fetch: function(options) {
4897       var self = this;
4898       var request = Bmob._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'GET');
4899       return request.then(function(response, status, xhr) {
4900         self._finishFetch(self.parse(response, status, xhr), true);
4901         return self;
4902       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
4903     },
4904 
4905     /**
4906      * Set a hash of model attributes, and save the model to the server.
4907      * updatedAt will be updated when the request returns.
4908      * You can either call it as:<pre>
4909      *   object.save();</pre>
4910      * or<pre>
4911      *   object.save(null, options);</pre>
4912      * or<pre>
4913      *   object.save(attrs, options);</pre>
4914      * or<pre>
4915      *   object.save(key, value, options);</pre>
4916      *
4917      * For example, <pre>
4918      *   gameTurn.save({
4919      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
4920      *     diceRoll: 2
4921      *   }, {
4922      *     success: function(gameTurnAgain) {
4923      *       // The save was successful.
4924      *     },
4925      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
4926      *       // The save failed.  Error is an instance of Bmob.Error.
4927      *     }
4928      *   });</pre>
4929      * or with promises:<pre>
4930      *   gameTurn.save({
4931      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
4932      *     diceRoll: 2
4933      *   }).then(function(gameTurnAgain) {
4934      *     // The save was successful.
4935      *   }, function(error) {
4936      *     // The save failed.  Error is an instance of Bmob.Error.
4937      *   });</pre>
4938      *
4939      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
4940      *     completes.
4941      * @see Bmob.Error
4942      */
4943     save: function(arg1, arg2, arg3) {
4944       var i, attrs, current, options, saved;
4945       if (_.isObject(arg1) || Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(arg1)) {
4946         attrs = arg1;
4947         options = arg2;
4948       } else {
4949         attrs = {};
4950         attrs[arg1] = arg2;
4951         options = arg3;
4952       }
4953 
4954       // Make save({ success: function() {} }) work.
4955       if (!options && attrs) {
4956         var extra_keys = _.reject(attrs, function(value, key) {
4957           return _.include(["success", "error", "wait"], key);
4958         });
4959         if (extra_keys.length === 0) {
4960           var all_functions = true;
4961           if (_.has(attrs, "success") && !_.isFunction(attrs.success)) {
4962             all_functions = false;
4963           }
4964           if (_.has(attrs, "error") && !_.isFunction(attrs.error)) {
4965             all_functions = false;
4966           }
4967           if (all_functions) {
4968             // This attrs object looks like it's really an options object,
4969             // and there's no other options object, so let's just use it.
4970             return this.save(null, attrs);
4971           }
4972         }
4973       }
4974 
4975       options = _.clone(options) || {};
4976       if (options.wait) {
4977         current = _.clone(this.attributes);
4978       }
4979 
4980       var setOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
4981       if (setOptions.wait) {
4982         setOptions.silent = true;
4983       }
4984       var setError;
4985       setOptions.error = function(model, error) {
4986         setError = error;
4987       };
4988       if (attrs && !this.set(attrs, setOptions)) {
4989         return Bmob.Promise.error(setError)._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
4990       }
4991 
4992       var model = this;
4993 
4994       // If there is any unsaved child, save it first.
4995       model._refreshCache();
4996 
4997 
4998 
4999       var unsavedChildren = [];
5000       var unsavedFiles = [];
5001       Bmob.Object._findUnsavedChildren(model.attributes,
5002                                         unsavedChildren,
5003                                         unsavedFiles);
5004       if (unsavedChildren.length + unsavedFiles.length > 0) {
5005         return Bmob.Object._deepSaveAsync(this.attributes).then(function() {
5006           return model.save(null, options);
5007         }, function(error) {
5008           return Bmob.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
5009         });
5010       }
5011 
5012       this._startSave();
5013       this._saving = (this._saving || 0) + 1;
5014 
5015       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves || Bmob.Promise.as();
5016       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves._continueWith(function() {
5017         var method = model.id ? 'PUT' : 'POST';
5018 
5019         var json = model._getSaveJSON();
5020 
5021         if(method === 'PUT' && model._fetchWhenSave){
5022           //Sepcial-case fetchWhenSave when updating object.
5023           json._fetchWhenSave = true;
5024         }
5025 
5026         var route = "classes";
5027         var className = model.className;
5028         if (model.className === "_User" && !model.id) {
5029           // Special-case user sign-up.
5030           route = "users";
5031           className = null;
5032         }
5033         var request = Bmob._request(route, className, model.id, method, json);
5034 
5035         request = request.then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
5036           var serverAttrs = model.parse(resp, status, xhr);
5037           if (options.wait) {
5038             serverAttrs = _.extend(attrs || {}, serverAttrs);
5039           }
5040           model._finishSave(serverAttrs);
5041           if (options.wait) {
5042             model.set(current, setOptions);
5043           }
5044           return model;
5045 
5046         }, function(error) {
5047           model._cancelSave();
5048           return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
5049 
5050         })._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
5051 
5052         return request;
5053       });
5054       return this._allPreviousSaves;
5055     },
5056 
5057     /**
5058      * Destroy this model on the server if it was already persisted.
5059      * Optimistically removes the model from its collection, if it has one.
5060      * If `wait: true` is passed, waits for the server to respond
5061      * before removal.
5062      *
5063      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
5064      *     completes.
5065      */
5066     destroy: function(options) {
5067       options = options || {};
5068       var model = this;
5069 
5070       var triggerDestroy = function() {
5071         model.trigger('destroy', model, model.collection, options);
5072       };
5073 
5074       if (!this.id) {
5075         return triggerDestroy();
5076       }
5077 
5078       if (!options.wait) {
5079         triggerDestroy();
5080       }
5081 
5082       var request =
5083           Bmob._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'DELETE');
5084       return request.then(function() {
5085         if (options.wait) {
5086           triggerDestroy();
5087         }
5088         return model;
5089       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
5090     },
5091 
5092     /**
5093      * Converts a response into the hash of attributes to be set on the model.
5094      * @ignore
5095      */
5096     parse: function(resp, status, xhr) {
5097       var output = _.clone(resp);
5098       _(["createdAt", "updatedAt"]).each(function(key) {
5099         if (output[key]) {
5100           output[key] = Bmob._parseDate(output[key]);
5101         }
5102       });
5103       if (!output.updatedAt) {
5104         output.updatedAt = output.createdAt;
5105       }
5106       if (status) {
5107         this._existed = (status !== 201);
5108       }
5109       return output;
5110     },

5112     /**
5113      * Creates a new model with identical attributes to this one.
5114      * @return {Bmob.Object}
5115      */
5116     clone: function() {
5117       return new this.constructor(this.attributes);
5118     },

5120     /**
5121      * Returns true if this object has never been saved to Bmob.
5122      * @return {Boolean}
5123      */
5124     isNew: function() {
5125       return !this.id;
5126     },

5128     /**
5129      * Call this method to manually fire a `"change"` event for this model and
5130      * a `"change:attribute"` event for each changed attribute.
5131      * Calling this will cause all objects observing the model to update.
5132      */
5133     change: function(options) {
5134       options = options || {};
5135       var changing = this._changing;
5136       this._changing = true;
5137 
5138       // Silent changes become pending changes.
5139       var self = this;
5140       Bmob._objectEach(this._silent, function(attr) {
5141         self._pending[attr] = true;
5142       });
5143 
5144       // Silent changes are triggered.
5145       var changes = _.extend({}, options.changes, this._silent);
5146       this._silent = {};
5147       Bmob._objectEach(changes, function(unused_value, attr) {
5148         self.trigger('change:' + attr, self, self.get(attr), options);
5149       });
5150       if (changing) {
5151         return this;
5152       }
5153 
5154       // This is to get around lint not letting us make a function in a loop.
5155       var deleteChanged = function(value, attr) {
5156         if (!self._pending[attr] && !self._silent[attr]) {
5157           delete self.changed[attr];
5158         }
5159       };
5160 
5161       // Continue firing `"change"` events while there are pending changes.
5162       while (!_.isEmpty(this._pending)) {
5163         this._pending = {};
5164         this.trigger('change', this, options);
5165         // Pending and silent changes still remain.
5166         Bmob._objectEach(this.changed, deleteChanged);
5167         self._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
5168       }
5169 
5170       this._changing = false;
5171       return this;
5172     },
5173 
5174     /**
5175      * Returns true if this object was created by the Bmob server when the
5176      * object might have already been there (e.g. in the case of a Facebook
5177      * login)
5178      */
5179     existed: function() {
5180       return this._existed;
5181     },

5183     /**
5184      * Determine if the model has changed since the last <code>"change"</code>
5185      * event.  If you specify an attribute name, determine if that attribute
5186      * has changed.
5187      * @param {String} attr Optional attribute name
5188      * @return {Boolean}
5189      */
5190     hasChanged: function(attr) {
5191       if (!arguments.length) {
5192         return !_.isEmpty(this.changed);
5193       }
5194       return this.changed && _.has(this.changed, attr);
5195     },
5196 
5197     /**
5198      * Returns an object containing all the attributes that have changed, or
5199      * false if there are no changed attributes. Useful for determining what
5200      * parts of a view need to be updated and/or what attributes need to be
5201      * persisted to the server. Unset attributes will be set to undefined.
5202      * You can also pass an attributes object to diff against the model,
5203      * determining if there *would be* a change.
5204      */
5205     changedAttributes: function(diff) {
5206       if (!diff) {
5207         return this.hasChanged() ? _.clone(this.changed) : false;
5208       }
5209       var changed = {};
5210       var old = this._previousAttributes;
5211       Bmob._objectEach(diff, function(diffVal, attr) {
5212         if (!_.isEqual(old[attr], diffVal)) {
5213           changed[attr] = diffVal;
5214         }
5215       });
5216       return changed;
5217     },
5218 
5219     /**
5220      * Gets the previous value of an attribute, recorded at the time the last
5221      * <code>"change"</code> event was fired.
5222      * @param {String} attr Name of the attribute to get.
5223      */
5224     previous: function(attr) {
5225       if (!arguments.length || !this._previousAttributes) {
5226         return null;
5227       }
5228       return this._previousAttributes[attr];
5229     },

5240     /**
5241      * Checks if the model is currently in a valid state. It's only possible to
5242      * get into an *invalid* state if you're using silent changes.
5243      * @return {Boolean}
5244      */
5245     isValid: function() {

5249     /**
5250      * You should not call this function directly unless you subclass
5251      * <code>Bmob.Object</code>, in which case you can override this method
5252      * to provide additional validation on <code>set</code> and
5253      * <code>save</code>.  Your implementation should return
5254      *
5255      * @param {Object} attrs The current data to validate.
5256      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-like options object.
5257      * @return {} False if the data is valid.  An error object otherwise.
5258      * @see Bmob.Object#set
5259      */
5260     validate: function(attrs, options) {
5261       if (_.has(attrs, "ACL") && !(attrs.ACL instanceof Bmob.ACL)) {
5262         return new Bmob.Error(Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
5263                                "ACL must be a Bmob.ACL.");
5264       }
5265       return false;
5266     },
5267 
5268     /**
5269      * Run validation against a set of incoming attributes, returning `true`
5270      * if all is well. If a specific `error` callback has been passed,
5271      * call that instead of firing the general `"error"` event.
5272      */
5273     _validate: function(attrs, options) {
5274       if (options.silent || !this.validate) {
5275         return true;
5276       }
5277       attrs = _.extend({}, this.attributes, attrs);
5278       var error = this.validate(attrs, options);
5279       if (!error) {
5280         return true;
5281       }
5282       if (options && options.error) {
5283         options.error(this, error, options);
5284       } else {
5285         this.trigger('error', this, error, options);
5286       }
5287       return false;
5288     },
5289 
5290     /**
5291      * Returns the ACL for this object.
5292      * @returns {Bmob.ACL} An instance of Bmob.ACL.
5293      * @see Bmob.Object#get
5294      */
5295     getACL: function() {
5296       return this.get("ACL");
5297     },

5300      * Sets the ACL to be used for this object.

5303      *     passed in to set.
5304      * @return {Boolean} Whether the set passed validation.
5305      * @see Bmob.Object#set
5306      */
5307     setACL: function(acl, options) {
5308       return this.set("ACL", acl, options);
5309     }
5310 
5311   });

5313    /**
5314     * Creates an instance of a subclass of Bmob.Object for the give classname
5315     * and id.
5316     * @param  {String} className The name of the Bmob class backing this model.
5317     * @param {String} id The object id of this model.
5318     * @return {Bmob.Object} A new subclass instance of Bmob.Object.
5319     */
5320    Bmob.Object.createWithoutData = function(className, id, hasData){
5321      var result = new Bmob.Object(className);
5322      result.id = id
5323      result._hasData = hasData;
5324      return result;
5325    };
5326    /**
5327     * Delete objects in batch.The objects className must be the same.
5328     * @param {Array} The ParseObject array to be deleted.
5329     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
5330     *     callbacks.
5331     * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
5332     *     completes.
5333     */
5334    Bmob.Object.destroyAll = function(objects, options){
5335       if(objects == null || objects.length == 0){
5336 		  return Bmob.Promise.as()._thenRunCallbacks(options);
5337       }
5338       var className = objects[0].className;
5339       var id = "";
5340       var wasFirst = true;
5341       objects.forEach(function(obj){
5342         if(obj.className != className)
5343 			  throw "Bmob.Object.destroyAll requires the argument object array's classNames must be the same";
5344           if(!obj.id)
5345               throw "Could not delete unsaved object";
5346           if(wasFirst){
5347               id = obj.id;
5348               wasFirst = false;
5349           }else{
5350               id = id + ',' + obj.id;
5351           }
5352       });
5353       var request =
5354           Bmob._request("classes", className, id, 'DELETE');
5355       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
5356    };
5357 
5358   /**
5359    * Returns the appropriate subclass for making new instances of the given
5360    * className string.
5361    */
5362   Bmob.Object._getSubclass = function(className) {
5363     if (!_.isString(className)) {
5364       throw "Bmob.Object._getSubclass requires a string argument.";
5365     }
5366     var ObjectClass = Bmob.Object._classMap[className];
5367     if (!ObjectClass) {
5368       ObjectClass = Bmob.Object.extend(className);
5369       Bmob.Object._classMap[className] = ObjectClass;
5370     }
5371     return ObjectClass;
5372   };

5374   /**
5375    * Creates an instance of a subclass of Bmob.Object for the given classname.
5376    */
5377   Bmob.Object._create = function(className, attributes, options) {
5378     var ObjectClass = Bmob.Object._getSubclass(className);
5379     return new ObjectClass(attributes, options);
5380   };
