5388   /**
5389    * Creates a new subclass of Bmob.Object for the given Bmob class name.
5390    *
5391    * <p>Every extension of a Bmob class will inherit from the most recent
5392    * previous extension of that class. When a Bmob.Object is automatically
5393    * created by parsing JSON, it will use the most recent extension of that
5394    * class.</p>
5395    *
5396    * <p>You should call either:<pre>
5397    *     var MyClass = Bmob.Object.extend("MyClass", {
5398    *         <i>Instance properties</i>
5399    *     }, {
5400    *         <i>Class properties</i>
5401    *     });</pre>
5402    * or, for Backbone compatibility:<pre>
5403    *     var MyClass = Bmob.Object.extend({
5404    *         className: "MyClass",
5405    *         <i>Other instance properties</i>
5406    *     }, {
5407    *         <i>Class properties</i>
5408    *     });</pre></p>
5409    *
5410    * @param {String} className The name of the Bmob class backing this model.
5411    * @param {Object} protoProps Instance properties to add to instances of the
5412    *     class returned from this method.
5413    * @param {Object} classProps Class properties to add the class returned from
5414    *     this method.
5415    * @return {Class} A new subclass of Bmob.Object.
5416    */
5417   Bmob.Object.extend = function(className, protoProps, classProps) {
5418     // Handle the case with only two args.
5419     if (!_.isString(className)) {
5420       if (className && _.has(className, "className")) {
5421         return Bmob.Object.extend(className.className, className, protoProps);
5422       } else {
5423         throw new Error(
5424             "Bmob.Object.extend's first argument should be the className.");
5425       }
5426     }
5427 
5428     // If someone tries to subclass "User", coerce it to the right type.
5429     if (className === "User") {
5430       className = "_User";
5431     }
5432 
5433     var NewClassObject = null;
5434     if (_.has(Bmob.Object._classMap, className)) {
5435       var OldClassObject = Bmob.Object._classMap[className];
5436       // This new subclass has been told to extend both from "this" and from
5437       // OldClassObject. This is multiple inheritance, which isn't supported.
5438       // For now, let's just pick one.
5439       NewClassObject = OldClassObject._extend(protoProps, classProps);
5440     } else {
5441       protoProps = protoProps || {};
5442       protoProps.className = className;
5443       NewClassObject = this._extend(protoProps, classProps);
5444     }
5445     // Extending a subclass should reuse the classname automatically.
5446     NewClassObject.extend = function(arg0) {
5447       if (_.isString(arg0) || (arg0 && _.has(arg0, "className"))) {
5448         return Bmob.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, arguments);
5449       }
5450       var newArguments = [className].concat(Bmob._.toArray(arguments));
5451       return Bmob.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, newArguments);
5452     };
5453     Bmob.Object._classMap[className] = NewClassObject;
5454     return NewClassObject;
5455   };
5456 
5457   Bmob.Object._findUnsavedChildren = function(object, children, files) {
5458     Bmob._traverse(object, function(object) {
5459       if (object instanceof Bmob.Object) {
5460         object._refreshCache();
5461         if (object.dirty()) {
5462           children.push(object);
5463         }
5464         return;
5465       }
5466 
5467       if (object instanceof Bmob.File) {
5468         if (!object.url()) {
5469           files.push(object);
5470         }
5471         return;
5472       }
5473     });
5474   };
5475 
5476   Bmob.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue = function(object) {
5477     var canBeSerializedAsValue = true;
5478 
5479     if (object instanceof Bmob.Object) {
5480       canBeSerializedAsValue = !!object.id;
5481 
5482     } else if (_.isArray(object)) {
5483       Bmob._arrayEach(object, function(child) {
5484         if (!Bmob.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
5485           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
5486         }
5487       });
5488 
5489     } else if (_.isObject(object)) {
5490       Bmob._objectEach(object, function(child) {
5491         if (!Bmob.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
5492           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
5493         }
5494       });
5495     }
5496 
5497     return canBeSerializedAsValue;
5498   };
5499 
5500   Bmob.Object._deepSaveAsync = function(object) {
5501     var unsavedChildren = [];
5502     var unsavedFiles = [];
5503     Bmob.Object._findUnsavedChildren(object, unsavedChildren, unsavedFiles);
5504 
5505     var promise = Bmob.Promise.as();
5506     _.each(unsavedFiles, function(file) {
5507       promise = promise.then(function() {
5508         return file.save();
5509       });
5510     });
5511 
5512     var objects = _.uniq(unsavedChildren);
5513     var remaining = _.uniq(objects);
5514 
5515     return promise.then(function() {
5516       return Bmob.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
5517         return remaining.length > 0;
5518       }, function() {
5519 
5520         // Gather up all the objects that can be saved in this batch.
5521         var batch = [];
5522         var newRemaining = [];
5523         Bmob._arrayEach(remaining, function(object) {
5524           // Limit batches to 20 objects.
5525           if (batch.length > 20) {
5526             newRemaining.push(object);
5527             return;
5528           }
5529 
5530           if (object._canBeSerialized()) {
5531             batch.push(object);
5532           } else {
5533             newRemaining.push(object);
5534           }
5535         });
5536         remaining = newRemaining;
5537 
5538         // If we can't save any objects, there must be a circular reference.
5539         if (batch.length === 0) {
5540           return Bmob.Promise.error(
5541             new Bmob.Error(Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
5542                             "Tried to save a batch with a cycle."));
5543         }
5544 
5545         // Reserve a spot in every object's save queue.
5546         var readyToStart = Bmob.Promise.when(_.map(batch, function(object) {
5547           return object._allPreviousSaves || Bmob.Promise.as();
5548         }));
5549         var batchFinished = new Bmob.Promise();
5550         Bmob._arrayEach(batch, function(object) {
5551           object._allPreviousSaves = batchFinished;
5552         });
5553 
5554         // Save a single batch, whether previous saves succeeded or failed.
5555         return readyToStart._continueWith(function() {
5556           return Bmob._request("batch", null, null, "POST", {
5557             requests: _.map(batch, function(object) {
5558               var json = object._getSaveJSON();
5559               var method = "POST";
5560 
5561               var path = "/1/classes/" + object.className;
5562               if (object.id) {
5563                 path = path + "/" + object.id;
5564                 method = "PUT";
5565               }
5566 
5567               object._startSave();
5568 
5569               return {
5570                 method: method,
5571                 path: path,
5572                 body: json
5573               };
5574             })
5575 
5576           }).then(function(response, status, xhr) {
5577             var error;
5578             Bmob._arrayEach(batch, function(object, i) {
5579               if (response[i].success) {
5580                 object._finishSave(
5581                   object.parse(response[i].success, status, xhr));
5582               } else {
5583                 error = error || response[i].error;
5584                 object._cancelSave();
5585               }
5586             });
5587             if (error) {
5588               return Bmob.Promise.error(
5589                 new Bmob.Error(error.code, error.error));
5590             }
5591 
5592           }).then(function(results) {
5593             batchFinished.resolve(results);
5594             return results;
5595           }, function(error) {
5596             batchFinished.reject(error);
5597             return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
5598           });
5599         });
5600       });
5601     }).then(function() {
5602       return object;
5603     });
5604   };
5605 
5606 }(this));

5684     /**

5687     validate: function(attrs, options) {
5688       if ("name" in attrs && attrs.name !== this.getName()) {

5690         if (this.id && this.id !== attrs.objectId) {
5691           // Check to see if the objectId being set matches this.id.
5692           // This happens during a fetch -- the id is set before calling fetch.
5693           // Let the name be set in this case.
5694           return new Bmob.Error(Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
5695               "A role's name can only be set before it has been saved.");

5699               "A role's name must be a String.");
5700         }

5702           return new Bmob.Error(Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
5703               "A role's name can only contain alphanumeric characters, _," +
5704               " -, and spaces.");
5705         }
5706       }
5707       if (Bmob.Object.prototype.validate) {
5708         return Bmob.Object.prototype.validate.call(this, attrs, options);
5709       }
5710       return false;
5711     }

5722   /**
5723    *创建model和options的实体。特别地，你不会直接调用这个方法，你会<code>Bmob.Collection.extend</code>通过创建一*个子类。
5724    * @param {Array} <code>Bmob.Object</code>数组.
5725    *
5726    * @param {Object} options  Backbone-style options 的可选options object.
5727    * 有效的 options<ul>
5728    *   <li>model: Bmob.Object 
5729    *   <li>query: Bmob.Query
5730    *   <li>comparator: 属性名称或排序函数
5731    * </ul>
5732    *
5733    * @see Bmob.Collection.extend
5734    *
5735    *
5736    * <p>提供标准的 collection class。 更详细的信息请看
5737    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Collection">Backbone
5738    * documentation</a>.</p>
5739    */
5740   Bmob.Collection = function(models, options) {
5741     options = options || {};
5742     if (options.comparator) {
5743       this.comparator = options.comparator;
5744     }
5745     if (options.model) {
5746       this.model = options.model;
5747     }
5748     if (options.query) {
5749       this.query = options.query;
5750     }
5751     this._reset();
5752     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
5753     if (models) {
5754       this.reset(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
5755     }
5756   };
5757 
5758   // Define the Collection's inheritable methods.
5759   _.extend(Bmob.Collection.prototype, Bmob.Events,
5760       /** @lends Bmob.Collection.prototype */ {
5761 
5762     // The default model for a collection is just a Bmob.Object.
5763     // This should be overridden in most cases.
5764 
5765     model: Bmob.Object,
5766 
5767     /**
5768      * Initialize 默认是空函数. 请根据自身的逻辑重写这个方法
5769      */
5770     initialize: function(){},
5771 
5772     /**
5773      * 
5774      * json 格式的models'属性数组
5775      */
5776     toJSON: function() {
5777       return this.map(function(model){ return model.toJSON(); });
5778     },
5779 
5780     /**
5781      * 添加model，或者一系列的对象集合。传入**silent**避免触发`add`事件。
5782      */
5783     add: function(models, options) {
5784       var i, index, length, model, cid, id, cids = {}, ids = {};
5785       options = options || {};
5786       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
5787 
5788       // Begin by turning bare objects into model references, and preventing
5789       // invalid models or duplicate models from being added.
5790       for (i = 0, length = models.length; i < length; i++) {
5791         models[i] = this._prepareModel(models[i], options);
5792         model = models[i];
5793         if (!model) {
5794           throw new Error("Can't add an invalid model to a collection");
5795         }
5796         cid = model.cid;
5797         if (cids[cid] || this._byCid[cid]) {
5798           throw new Error("Duplicate cid: can't add the same model " +
5799                           "to a collection twice");
5800         }
5801         id = model.id;
5802         if (!Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(id) && (ids[id] || this._byId[id])) {
5803           throw new Error("Duplicate id: can't add the same model " +
5804                           "to a collection twice");
5805         }
5806         ids[id] = model;
5807         cids[cid] = model;
5808       }
5809 
5810       // Listen to added models' events, and index models for lookup by
5811       // `id` and by `cid`.
5812       for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
5813         (model = models[i]).on('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
5814         this._byCid[model.cid] = model;
5815         if (model.id) {
5816           this._byId[model.id] = model;
5817         }
5818       }
5819 
5820       // Insert models into the collection, re-sorting if needed, and triggering
5821       // `add` events unless silenced.
5822       this.length += length;
5823       index = Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(options.at) ?
5824           this.models.length : options.at;
5825       this.models.splice.apply(this.models, [index, 0].concat(models));
5826       if (this.comparator) {
5827         this.sort({silent: true});
5828       }
5829       if (options.silent) {
5830         return this;
5831       }
5832       for (i = 0, length = this.models.length; i < length; i++) {
5833         model = this.models[i];
5834         if (cids[model.cid]) {
5835           options.index = i;
5836           model.trigger('add', model, this, options);
5837         }
5838       }
5839       return this;
5840     },
5841 
5842     /**
5843      * 移除一个model，或者从集合中移除一系列models。当移除对象时，传入silent避免触发<code>remove</code>事件。  
5844      */
5845     remove: function(models, options) {
5846       var i, l, index, model;
5847       options = options || {};
5848       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
5849       for (i = 0, l = models.length; i < l; i++) {
5850         model = this.getByCid(models[i]) || this.get(models[i]);
5851         if (!model) {
5852           continue;
5853         }
5854         delete this._byId[model.id];
5855         delete this._byCid[model.cid];
5856         index = this.indexOf(model);
5857         this.models.splice(index, 1);
5858         this.length--;
5859         if (!options.silent) {
5860           options.index = index;
5861           model.trigger('remove', model, this, options);
5862         }
5863         this._removeReference(model);
5864       }
5865       return this;
5866     },
5867 
5868     /**
5869      * 通过id获取一个model
5870      */
5871     get: function(id) {
5872       return id && this._byId[id.id || id];
5873     },
5874 
5875     /**
5876      * 通过client id获取一个model
5877      */
5878     getByCid: function(cid) {
5879       return cid && this._byCid[cid.cid || cid];
5880     },
5881 
5882     /**
5883      * 通过下标获取一个model
5884      */
5885     at: function(index) {
5886       return this.models[index];
5887     },
5888 
5889     /**
5890      * 强制collection对自身的元素进行重新排序。一般情况下你不需要调用这个函数，因为当添加对象时这个函数会自动调用
5891      */
5892     sort: function(options) {
5893       options = options || {};
5894       if (!this.comparator) {
5895         throw new Error('Cannot sort a set without a comparator');
5896       }
5897       var boundComparator = _.bind(this.comparator, this);
5898       if (this.comparator.length === 1) {
5899         this.models = this.sortBy(boundComparator);
5900       } else {
5901         this.models.sort(boundComparator);
5902       }
5903       if (!options.silent) {
5904         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
5905       }
5906       return this;
5907     },
5908 
5909     /**
5910      * 采集集合中每个对象的属性
5911      */
5912     pluck: function(attr) {
5913       return _.map(this.models, function(model){ return model.get(attr); });
5914     },
5915 
5916     /**
5917      * When you have more items than you want to add or remove individually,
5918      * you can reset the entire set with a new list of models, without firing
5919      * any `add` or `remove` events. Fires `reset` when finished.
5920      */
5921     reset: function(models, options) {
5922       var self = this;
5923       models = models || [];
5924       options = options || {};
5925       Bmob._arrayEach(this.models, function(model) {
5926         self._removeReference(model);
5927       });
5928       this._reset();
5929       this.add(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
5930       if (!options.silent) {
5931         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
5932       }
5933       return this;
5934     },
5935 
5936     /**
5937      * Fetches the default set of models for this collection, resetting the
5938      * collection when they arrive. If `add: true` is passed, appends the
5939      * models to the collection instead of resetting.
5940      */
5941     fetch: function(options) {
5942       options = _.clone(options) || {};
5943       if (options.parse === undefined) {
5944         options.parse = true;
5945       }
5946       var collection = this;
5947       var query = this.query || new Bmob.Query(this.model);
5948       return query.find().then(function(results) {
5949         if (options.add) {
5950           collection.add(results, options);
5951         } else {
5952           collection.reset(results, options);
5953         }
5954         return collection;
5955       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
5956     },
5957 
5958     /**
5959      * Creates a new instance of a model in this collection. Add the model to
5960      * the collection immediately, unless `wait: true` is passed, in which case
5961      * we wait for the server to agree.
5962      */
5963     create: function(model, options) {
5964       var coll = this;
5965       options = options ? _.clone(options) : {};
5966       model = this._prepareModel(model, options);
5967       if (!model) {
5968         return false;
5969       }
5970       if (!options.wait) {
5971         coll.add(model, options);
5972       }
5973       var success = options.success;
5974       options.success = function(nextModel, resp, xhr) {
5975         if (options.wait) {
5976           coll.add(nextModel, options);
5977         }
5978         if (success) {
5979           success(nextModel, resp);
5980         } else {
5981           nextModel.trigger('sync', model, resp, options);
5982         }
5983       };
5984       model.save(null, options);
5985       return model;
5986     },
5987 
5988     /**
5989      * Converts a response into a list of models to be added to the collection.
5990      * The default implementation is just to pass it through.
5991      * @ignore
5992      */
5993     parse: function(resp, xhr) {
5994       return resp;
5995     },
5996 
5997     /**
5998      * Proxy to _'s chain. Can't be proxied the same way the rest of the
5999      * underscore methods are proxied because it relies on the underscore
6000      * constructor.
6001      */
6002     chain: function() {
6003       return _(this.models).chain();
6004     },
6005 
6006     /**
6007      * Reset all internal state. Called when the collection is reset.
6008      */
6009     _reset: function(options) {
6010       this.length = 0;
6011       this.models = [];
6012       this._byId  = {};
6013       this._byCid = {};
6014     },
6015 
6016     /**
6017      * Prepare a model or hash of attributes to be added to this collection.
6018      */
6019     _prepareModel: function(model, options) {
6020       if (!(model instanceof Bmob.Object)) {
6021         var attrs = model;
6022         options.collection = this;
6023         model = new this.model(attrs, options);
6024         if (!model._validate(model.attributes, options)) {
6025           model = false;
6026         }
6027       } else if (!model.collection) {
6028         model.collection = this;
6029       }
6030       return model;
6031     },
6032 
6033     /**
6034      * Internal method to remove a model's ties to a collection.
6035      */
6036     _removeReference: function(model) {
6037       if (this === model.collection) {
6038         delete model.collection;
6039       }
6040       model.off('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
6041     },
6042 
6043     /**
6044      * Internal method called every time a model in the set fires an event.
6045      * Sets need to update their indexes when models change ids. All other
6046      * events simply proxy through. "add" and "remove" events that originate
6047      * in other collections are ignored.
6048      */
6049     _onModelEvent: function(ev, model, collection, options) {
6050       if ((ev === 'add' || ev === 'remove') && collection !== this) {
6051         return;
6052       }
6053       if (ev === 'destroy') {
6054         this.remove(model, options);
6055       }
6056       if (model && ev === 'change:objectId') {
6057         delete this._byId[model.previous("objectId")];
6058         this._byId[model.id] = model;
6059       }
6060       this.trigger.apply(this, arguments);
6061     }
6062 
6063   });

6065   // Underscore methods that we want to implement on the Collection.
6066   var methods = ['forEach', 'each', 'map', 'reduce', 'reduceRight', 'find',
6067     'detect', 'filter', 'select', 'reject', 'every', 'all', 'some', 'any',
6068     'include', 'contains', 'invoke', 'max', 'min', 'sortBy', 'sortedIndex',
6069     'toArray', 'size', 'first', 'initial', 'rest', 'last', 'without', 'indexOf',
6070     'shuffle', 'lastIndexOf', 'isEmpty', 'groupBy'];
6071 
6072   // Mix in each Underscore method as a proxy to `Collection#models`.
6073   Bmob._arrayEach(methods, function(method) {
6074     Bmob.Collection.prototype[method] = function() {
6075       return _[method].apply(_, [this.models].concat(_.toArray(arguments)));
6076     };
6077   });

6080    * Creates a new subclass of <code>Bmob.Collection</code>.  For example,<pre>

6116   /**
6117    * Creating a Bmob.View creates its initial element outside of the DOM,
6118    * if an existing element is not provided...
6119    *
6120    * <p>A fork of Backbone.View, provided for your convenience.  If you use this
6121    * class, you must also include jQuery, or another library that provides a
6122    * jQuery-compatible $ function.  For more information, see the
6123    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#View">Backbone
6124    * documentation</a>.</p>
6125    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
6126    */
6127   Bmob.View = function(options) {
6128     this.cid = _.uniqueId('view');
6129     this._configure(options || {});
6130     this._ensureElement();
6131     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
6132     this.delegateEvents();
6133   };
6134 
6135   // Cached regex to split keys for `delegate`.
6136   var eventSplitter = /^(\S+)\s*(.*)$/;
6137 
6138   // List of view options to be merged as properties.
6139 
6140   var viewOptions = ['model', 'collection', 'el', 'id', 'attributes',
6141                      'className', 'tagName'];
6142 
6143   // Set up all inheritable **Bmob.View** properties and methods.
6144   _.extend(Bmob.View.prototype, Bmob.Events,
6145            /** @lends Bmob.View.prototype */ {
6146 
6147     // The default `tagName` of a View's element is `"div"`.
6148     tagName: 'div',
6149 
6150     /**
6151      * jQuery delegate for element lookup, scoped to DOM elements within the
6152      * current view. This should be prefered to global lookups where possible.
6153      */
6154     $: function(selector) {
6155       return this.$el.find(selector);
6156     },
6157 
6158     /**
6159      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
6160      * initialization logic.
6161      */
6162     initialize: function(){},
6163 
6164     /**
6165      * The core function that your view should override, in order
6166      * to populate its element (`this.el`), with the appropriate HTML. The
6167      * convention is for **render** to always return `this`.
6168      */
6169     render: function() {
6170       return this;
6171     },
6172 
6173     /**
6174      * Remove this view from the DOM. Note that the view isn't present in the
6175      * DOM by default, so calling this method may be a no-op.
6176      */
6177     remove: function() {
6178       this.$el.remove();
6179       return this;
6180     },
6181 
6182     /**
6183      * For small amounts of DOM Elements, where a full-blown template isn't
6184      * needed, use **make** to manufacture elements, one at a time.
6185      * <pre>
6186      *     var el = this.make('li', {'class': 'row'},
6187      *                        this.model.escape('title'));</pre>
6188      */
6189     make: function(tagName, attributes, content) {
6190       var el = document.createElement(tagName);
6191       if (attributes) {
6192         Bmob.$(el).attr(attributes);
6193       }
6194       if (content) {
6195         Bmob.$(el).html(content);
6196       }
6197       return el;
6198     },
6199 
6200     /**
6201      * Changes the view's element (`this.el` property), including event
6202      * re-delegation.
6203      */
6204     setElement: function(element, delegate) {
6205       this.$el = Bmob.$(element);
6206       this.el = this.$el[0];
6207       if (delegate !== false) {
6208         this.delegateEvents();
6209       }
6210       return this;
6211     },
6212 
6213     /**
6214      * Set callbacks.  <code>this.events</code> is a hash of
6215      * <pre>
6216      * *{"event selector": "callback"}*
6217      *
6218      *     {
6219      *       'mousedown .title':  'edit',
6220      *       'click .button':     'save'
6221      *       'click .open':       function(e) { ... }
6222      *     }
6223      * </pre>
6224      * pairs. Callbacks will be bound to the view, with `this` set properly.
6225      * Uses event delegation for efficiency.
6226      * Omitting the selector binds the event to `this.el`.
6227      * This only works for delegate-able events: not `focus`, `blur`, and
6228      * not `change`, `submit`, and `reset` in Internet Explorer.
6229      */
6230     delegateEvents: function(events) {
6231       events = events || Bmob._getValue(this, 'events');
6232       if (!events) {
6233         return;
6234       }
6235       this.undelegateEvents();
6236       var self = this;
6237       Bmob._objectEach(events, function(method, key) {
6238         if (!_.isFunction(method)) {
6239           method = self[events[key]];
6240         }
6241         if (!method) {
6242           throw new Error('Event "' + events[key] + '" does not exist');
6243         }
6244         var match = key.match(eventSplitter);
6245         var eventName = match[1], selector = match[2];
6246         method = _.bind(method, self);
6247         eventName += '.delegateEvents' + self.cid;
6248         if (selector === '') {
6249           self.$el.bind(eventName, method);
6250         } else {
6251           self.$el.delegate(selector, eventName, method);
6252         }
6253       });
6254     },
6255 
6256     /**
6257      * Clears all callbacks previously bound to the view with `delegateEvents`.
6258      * You usually don't need to use this, but may wish to if you have multiple
6259      * Backbone views attached to the same DOM element.
6260      */
6261     undelegateEvents: function() {
6262       this.$el.unbind('.delegateEvents' + this.cid);
6263     },
6264 
6265     /**
6266      * Performs the initial configuration of a View with a set of options.
6267      * Keys with special meaning *(model, collection, id, className)*, are
6268      * attached directly to the view.
6269      */
6270     _configure: function(options) {
6271       if (this.options) {
6272         options = _.extend({}, this.options, options);
6273       }
6274       var self = this;
6275       _.each(viewOptions, function(attr) {
6276         if (options[attr]) {
6277           self[attr] = options[attr];
6278         }
6279       });
6280       this.options = options;
6281     },
6282 
6283     /**
6284      * Ensure that the View has a DOM element to render into.
6285      * If `this.el` is a string, pass it through `$()`, take the first
6286      * matching element, and re-assign it to `el`. Otherwise, create
6287      * an element from the `id`, `className` and `tagName` properties.
6288      */
6289     _ensureElement: function() {
6290       if (!this.el) {
6291         var attrs = Bmob._getValue(this, 'attributes') || {};
6292         if (this.id) {
6293           attrs.id = this.id;
6294         }
6295         if (this.className) {
6296           attrs['class'] = this.className;
6297         }
6298         this.setElement(this.make(this.tagName, attrs), false);
6299       } else {
6300         this.setElement(this.el, false);
6301       }
6302     }
6303 
6304   });
6305 
6306   /**
6307    * @function
6308    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the view.
6309    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the view.
6310    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>Bmob.View</code>.
6311    */
6312   Bmob.View.extend = Bmob._extend;
6313

6321   /**
6322    * @class
6323    *
6324    * <p>A Bmob.User object is a local representation of a user persisted to the
6325    * Bmob cloud. This class is a subclass of a Bmob.Object, and retains the
6326    * same functionality of a Bmob.Object, but also extends it with various
6327    * user specific methods, like authentication, signing up, and validation of
6328    * uniqueness.</p>
6329    */
6330   Bmob.User = Bmob.Object.extend("_User", /** @lends Bmob.User.prototype */ {
6331     // Instance Variables
6332     _isCurrentUser: false,
6333 
6334 
6335     // Instance Methods
6336 
6337     /**
6338      * Internal method to handle special fields in a _User response.
6339      */
6340     _mergeMagicFields: function(attrs) {
6341       if (attrs.sessionToken) {
6342         this._sessionToken = attrs.sessionToken;
6343         delete attrs.sessionToken;
6344       }
6345       Bmob.User.__super__._mergeMagicFields.call(this, attrs);
6346     },
6347 
6348     /**
6349      * Removes null values from authData (which exist temporarily for
6350      * unlinking)
6351      */
6352     _cleanupAuthData: function() {
6353       if (!this.isCurrent()) {
6354         return;
6355       }
6356       var authData = this.get('authData');
6357       if (!authData) {
6358         return;
6359       }
6360       Bmob._objectEach(this.get('authData'), function(value, key) {
6361         if (!authData[key]) {
6362           delete authData[key];
6363         }
6364       });
6365     },
6366 
6367     /**
6368      * Synchronizes authData for all providers.
6369      */
6370     _synchronizeAllAuthData: function() {
6371       var authData = this.get('authData');
6372       if (!authData) {
6373         return;
6374       }
6375 
6376       var self = this;
6377       Bmob._objectEach(this.get('authData'), function(value, key) {
6378         self._synchronizeAuthData(key);
6379       });
6380     },
6381 
6382     /**
6383      * Synchronizes auth data for a provider (e.g. puts the access token in the
6384      * right place to be used by the Facebook SDK).
6385      */
6386     _synchronizeAuthData: function(provider) {
6387       if (!this.isCurrent()) {
6388         return;
6389       }
6390       var authType;
6391       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6392         authType = provider;
6393         provider = Bmob.User._authProviders[authType];
6394       } else {
6395         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6396       }
6397       var authData = this.get('authData');
6398       if (!authData || !provider) {
6399         return;
6400       }
6401       var success = provider.restoreAuthentication(authData[authType]);
6402       if (!success) {
6403         this._unlinkFrom(provider);
6404       }
6405     },
6406 
6407     _handleSaveResult: function(makeCurrent) {
6408       // Clean up and synchronize the authData object, removing any unset values
6409       if (makeCurrent) {
6410         this._isCurrentUser = true;
6411       }
6412       this._cleanupAuthData();
6413       this._synchronizeAllAuthData();
6414       // Don't keep the password around.
6415       delete this._serverData.password;
6416       this._rebuildEstimatedDataForKey("password");
6417       this._refreshCache();
6418       if (makeCurrent || this.isCurrent()) {
6419         Bmob.User._saveCurrentUser(this);
6420       }
6421     },
6422 
6423     /**
6424      * Unlike in the Android/iOS SDKs, logInWith is unnecessary, since you can
6425      * call linkWith on the user (even if it doesn't exist yet on the server).
6426      */
6427     _linkWith: function(provider, options) {
6428       var authType;
6429       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6430         authType = provider;
6431         provider = Bmob.User._authProviders[provider];
6432       } else {
6433         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6434       }
6435       if (_.has(options, 'authData')) {
6436         var authData = this.get('authData') || {};
6437         authData[authType] = options.authData;
6438         this.set('authData', authData);
6439 
6440         // Overridden so that the user can be made the current user.
6441         var newOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
6442         newOptions.success = function(model) {
6443           model._handleSaveResult(true);
6444           if (options.success) {
6445             options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6446           }
6447         };
6448         return this.save({'authData': authData}, newOptions);
6449       } else {
6450         var self = this;
6451         var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
6452         provider.authenticate({
6453           success: function(provider, result) {
6454             self._linkWith(provider, {
6455               authData: result,
6456               success: options.success,
6457               error: options.error
6458             }).then(function() {
6459               promise.resolve(self);
6460             });
6461           },
6462           error: function(provider, error) {
6463             if (options.error) {
6464               options.error(self, error);
6465             }
6466             promise.reject(error);
6467           }
6468         });
6469         return promise;
6470       }
6471     },
6472 
6473     /**
6474      * Unlinks a user from a service.
6475      */
6476     _unlinkFrom: function(provider, options) {
6477       var authType;
6478       if (_.isString(provider)) {
6479         authType = provider;
6480         provider = Bmob.User._authProviders[provider];
6481       } else {
6482         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6483       }
6484       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6485       var self = this;
6486       newOptions.authData = null;
6487       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6488         self._synchronizeAuthData(provider);
6489         if (options.success) {
6490           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6491         }
6492       };
6493       return this._linkWith(provider, newOptions);
6494     },
6495

6502         authType = provider;
6503       } else {
6504         authType = provider.getAuthType();
6505       }
6506       var authData = this.get('authData') || {};
6507       return !!authData[authType];
6508     },

6540     /**
6541      * Signs up a new user. You should call this instead of save for
6542      * new Bmob.Users. This will create a new Bmob.User on the server, and
6543      * also persist the session on disk so that you can access the user using
6544      * <code>current</code>.
6545      *
6546      * <p>A username and password must be set before calling signUp.</p>
6547      *
6548      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6549      *
6550      * @param {Object} attrs Extra fields to set on the new user, or null.
6551      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6552      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the signup
6553      *     finishes.
6554      * @see Bmob.User.signUp
6555      */
6556     signUp: function(attrs, options) {
6557       var error;
6558       options = options || {};
6559 
6560       var username = (attrs && attrs.username) || this.get("username");
6561       if (!username || (username === "")) {
6562         error = new Bmob.Error(
6563             Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6564             "Cannot sign up user with an empty name.");
6565         if (options && options.error) {
6566           options.error(this, error);
6567         }
6568         return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
6569       }
6570 
6571       var password = (attrs && attrs.password) || this.get("password");
6572       if (!password || (password === "")) {
6573         error = new Bmob.Error(
6574             Bmob.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
6575             "Cannot sign up user with an empty password.");
6576         if (options && options.error) {
6577           options.error(this, error);
6578         }
6579         return Bmob.Promise.error(error);
6580       }
6581 
6582       // Overridden so that the user can be made the current user.
6583       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6584       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6585         model._handleSaveResult(true);
6586         if (options.success) {
6587           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6588         }
6589       };
6590       return this.save(attrs, newOptions);
6591     },

6593     /**
6594      * Logs in a Bmob.User. On success, this saves the session to localStorage,
6595      * so you can retrieve the currently logged in user using
6596      * <code>current</code>.
6597      *
6598      * <p>A username and password must be set before calling logIn.</p>
6599      *
6600      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6601      *
6602      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6603      * @see Bmob.User.logIn
6604      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled with the user when
6605      *     the login is complete.
6606      */
6607     logIn: function(options) {
6608       var model = this;
6609       var request = Bmob._request("login", null, null, "GET", this.toJSON());
6610       return request.then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
6611         var serverAttrs = model.parse(resp, status, xhr);
6612         model._finishFetch(serverAttrs);
6613         model._handleSaveResult(true);
6614         return model;
6615       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
6616     },
6617 
6618     /**
6619      * @see Bmob.Object#save
6620      */
6621     save: function(arg1, arg2, arg3) {
6622       var i, attrs, current, options, saved;
6623       if (_.isObject(arg1) || _.isNull(arg1) || _.isUndefined(arg1)) {
6624         attrs = arg1;
6625         options = arg2;
6626       } else {
6627         attrs = {};
6628         attrs[arg1] = arg2;
6629         options = arg3;
6630       }
6631       options = options || {};
6632 
6633       var newOptions = _.clone(options);
6634       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6635         model._handleSaveResult(false);
6636         if (options.success) {
6637           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6638         }
6639       };
6640       return Bmob.Object.prototype.save.call(this, attrs, newOptions);
6641     },
6642 
6643 
6644     /**
6645      * @see Bmob.Object#fetch
6646      */
6647     fetch: function(options) {
6648       var newOptions = options ? _.clone(options) : {};
6649       newOptions.success = function(model) {
6650         model._handleSaveResult(false);
6651         if (options && options.success) {
6652           options.success.apply(this, arguments);
6653         }
6654       };
6655       return Bmob.Object.prototype.fetch.call(this, newOptions);
6656     },

6746     /**
6747      * Signs up a new user with a username (or email) and password.
6748      * This will create a new Bmob.User on the server, and also persist the
6749      * session in localStorage so that you can access the user using
6750      * {@link #current}.
6751      *
6752      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6753      *
6754      * @param {String} username The username (or email) to sign up with.
6755      * @param {String} password The password to sign up with.
6756      * @param {Object} attrs Extra fields to set on the new user.
6757      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.

6759      *     the signup completes.

6770     /**
6771      * Logs in a user with a username (or email) and password. On success, this
6772      * saves the session to disk, so you can retrieve the currently logged in
6773      * user using <code>current</code>.
6774      *
6775      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6776      *

6779      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.

6781      *     the login completes.

6784     logIn: function(username, password, options) {

6789 
6790     /**
6791      * Logs out the currently logged in user session. This will remove the
6792      * session from disk, log out of linked services, and future calls to
6793      * <code>current</code> will return <code>null</code>.
6794      */
6795     logOut: function() {
6796       if (Bmob.User._currentUser !== null) {
6797         Bmob.User._currentUser._logOutWithAll();
6798         Bmob.User._currentUser._isCurrentUser = false;
6799       }
6800       Bmob.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
6801       Bmob.User._currentUser = null;
6802       Bmob.localStorage.removeItem(
6803           Bmob._getBmobPath(Bmob.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY));
6804     },
6805 
6806 
6807     /**
6808      * Requests a password reset email to be sent to the specified email address
6809      * associated with the user account. This email allows the user to securely
6810      * reset their password on the Bmob site.
6811      *
6812      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6813      *
6814      * @param {String} email The email address associated with the user that
6815      *     forgot their password.
6816      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6817      */
6818     requestPasswordReset: function(email, options) {
6819       var json = { email: email };
6820       var request = Bmob._request("requestPasswordReset", null, null, "POST",
6821                                    json);
6822       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
6823     },
6824 
6825     /**
6826      * Requests email verify
6827      *
6828      * <p>Calls options.success or options.error on completion.</p>
6829      *
6830      * @param {String} email The email address associated with the user that
6831      *     forgot their password.
6832      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
6833      */
6834     requestEmailVerify: function(email, options) {

6837                                    json);
6838       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
6839     },
6840 
6841     /**
6842      * Retrieves the currently logged in BmobUser with a valid session,
6843      * either from memory or localStorage, if necessary.
6844      * @return {Bmob.Object} The currently logged in Bmob.User.
6845      */
6846     current: function() {
6847       if (Bmob.User._currentUser) {
6848         return Bmob.User._currentUser;
6849       }
6850 
6851       if (Bmob.User._currentUserMatchesDisk) {
6852 
6853         return Bmob.User._currentUser;
6854       }
6855 
6856       // Load the user from local storage.
6857       Bmob.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
6858 
6859       var userData = Bmob.localStorage.getItem(Bmob._getBmobPath(
6860           Bmob.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY));
6861       if (!userData) {
6862 
6863         return null;
6864       }
6865       Bmob.User._currentUser = Bmob.Object._create("_User");
6866       Bmob.User._currentUser._isCurrentUser = true;
6867 
6868       var json = JSON.parse(userData);
6869       Bmob.User._currentUser.id = json._id;
6870       delete json._id;
6871       Bmob.User._currentUser._sessionToken = json._sessionToken;
6872       delete json._sessionToken;
6873       Bmob.User._currentUser.set(json);
6874 
6875       Bmob.User._currentUser._synchronizeAllAuthData();
6876       Bmob.User._currentUser._refreshCache();
6877       Bmob.User._currentUser._opSetQueue = [{}];
6878       return Bmob.User._currentUser;
6879     },
6880 
6881     /**
6882      * Persists a user as currentUser to localStorage, and into the singleton.
6883      */
6884     _saveCurrentUser: function(user) {
6885       if (Bmob.User._currentUser !== user) {
6886         Bmob.User.logOut();
6887       }
6888       user._isCurrentUser = true;
6889       Bmob.User._currentUser = user;
6890       Bmob.User._currentUserMatchesDisk = true;
6891 
6892       var json = user.toJSON();
6893       json._id = user.id;
6894       json._sessionToken = user._sessionToken;
6895       Bmob.localStorage.setItem(
6896           Bmob._getBmobPath(Bmob.User._CURRENT_USER_KEY),
6897           JSON.stringify(json));
6898     },
6899 
6900     _registerAuthenticationProvider: function(provider) {
6901       Bmob.User._authProviders[provider.getAuthType()] = provider;
6902       // Synchronize the current user with the auth provider.
6903       if (Bmob.User.current()) {
6904         Bmob.User.current()._synchronizeAuthData(provider.getAuthType());
6905       }
6906     },
6907 
6908     _logInWith: function(provider, options) {
6909       var user = Bmob.Object._create("_User");
6910       return user._linkWith(provider, options);
6911     }
6912 
6913   });
6914 }(this));

6916 
6917 // Bmob.Query is a way to create a list of Bmob.Objects.
6918 (function(root) {
6919   root.Bmob = root.Bmob || {};
6920   var Bmob = root.Bmob;
6921   var _ = Bmob._;
6922 
6923   /**
6924    * Creates a new bmob Bmob.Query for the given Bmob.Object subclass.
6925    * @param objectClass -
6926    *   An instance of a subclass of Bmob.Object, or a Bmob className string.
6927    * @class
6928    *
6929    * <p>Bmob.Query defines a query that is used to fetch Bmob.Objects. The
6930    * most common use case is finding all objects that match a query through the
6931    * <code>find</code> method. For example, this sample code fetches all objects
6932    * of class <code>MyClass</code>. It calls a different function depending on
6933    * whether the fetch succeeded or not.
6934    *
6935    * <pre>
6936    * var query = new Bmob.Query(MyClass);
6937    * query.find({
6938    *   success: function(results) {
6939    *     // results is an array of Bmob.Object.
6940    *   },
6941    *
6942    *   error: function(error) {
6943    *     // error is an instance of Bmob.Error.
6944    *   }
6945    * });</pre></p>
6946    *
6947    * <p>A Bmob.Query can also be used to retrieve a single object whose id is
6948    * known, through the get method. For example, this sample code fetches an
6949    * object of class <code>MyClass</code> and id <code>myId</code>. It calls a
6950    * different function depending on whether the fetch succeeded or not.
6951    *
6952    * <pre>
6953    * var query = new Bmob.Query(MyClass);
6954    * query.get(myId, {
6955    *   success: function(object) {
6956    *     // object is an instance of Bmob.Object.
6957    *   },
6958    *
6959    *   error: function(object, error) {
6960    *     // error is an instance of Bmob.Error.
6961    *   }
6962    * });</pre></p>
6963    *
6964    * <p>A Bmob.Query can also be used to count the number of objects that match
6965    * the query without retrieving all of those objects. For example, this
6966    * sample code counts the number of objects of the class <code>MyClass</code>
6967    * <pre>
6968    * var query = new Bmob.Query(MyClass);
6969    * query.count({
6970    *   success: function(number) {
6971    *     // There are number instances of MyClass.
6972    *   },
6973    *
6974    *   error: function(error) {
6975    *     // error is an instance of Bmob.Error.
6976    *   }
6977    * });</pre></p>
6978    */
6979   Bmob.Query = function(objectClass) {
6980     if (_.isString(objectClass)) {
6981       objectClass = Bmob.Object._getSubclass(objectClass);
6982     }
6983 
6984     this.objectClass = objectClass;
6985 
6986     this.className = objectClass.prototype.className;
6987 
6988     this._where = {};
6989     this._include = [];
6990     this._limit = -1; // negative limit means, do not send a limit
6991     this._skip = 0;
6992     this._extraOptions = {};
6993   };
6994 
6995   /**
6996    * Constructs a Bmob.Query that is the OR of the passed in queries.  For
6997    * example:
6998    * <pre>var compoundQuery = Bmob.Query.or(query1, query2, query3);</pre>
6999    *
7000    * will create a compoundQuery that is an or of the query1, query2, and
7001    * query3.
7002    * @param {...Bmob.Query} var_args The list of queries to OR.
7003    * @return {Bmob.Query} The query that is the OR of the passed in queries.
7004    */
7005   Bmob.Query.or = function() {
7006     var queries = _.toArray(arguments);
7007     var className = null;
7008     Bmob._arrayEach(queries, function(q) {
7009       if (_.isNull(className)) {
7010         className = q.className;
7011       }
7012 
7013       if (className !== q.className) {
7014         throw "All queries must be for the same class";
7015       }
7016     });
7017     var query = new Bmob.Query(className);
7018     query._orQuery(queries);
7019     return query;
7020   };
7021 
7022   Bmob.Query._extend = Bmob._extend;
7023 
7024   Bmob.Query.prototype = {
7025      //hook to iterate result. Added by dennis<xzhuang@bmob.cn>.
7026      _processResult: function(obj){
7027         return obj;
7028     },
7029 
7030     /**
7031      * Constructs a Bmob.Object whose id is already known by fetching data from
7032      * the server.  Either options.success or options.error is called when the
7033      * find completes.
7034      *
7035      * @param {} objectId The id of the object to be fetched.
7036      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7037      */
7038     get: function(objectId, options) {
7039       var self = this;
7040       self.equalTo('objectId', objectId);
7041 
7042       return self.first().then(function(response) {
7043         if (response) {
7044           return response;
7045         }
7046 
7047         var errorObject = new Bmob.Error(Bmob.Error.OBJECT_NOT_FOUND,
7048                                           "Object not found.");
7049         return Bmob.Promise.error(errorObject);
7050 
7051       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, null);
7052     },
7053 
7054     /**
7055      * Returns a JSON representation of this query.
7056      * @return {Object}
7057      */
7058     toJSON: function() {
7059       var params = {
7060         where: this._where
7061       };
7062 
7063       if (this._include.length > 0) {
7064         params.include = this._include.join(",");
7065       }
7066       if (this._select) {
7067         params.keys = this._select.join(",");
7068       }
7069       if (this._limit >= 0) {
7070         params.limit = this._limit;
7071       }
7072       if (this._skip > 0) {
7073         params.skip = this._skip;
7074       }
7075       if (this._order !== undefined) {
7076         params.order = this._order;
7077       }
7078 
7079       Bmob._objectEach(this._extraOptions, function(v, k) {
7080         params[k] = v;
7081       });
7082 
7083       return params;
7084     },
7085 
7086     _newObject: function(response){
7087       if (response && response.className) {
7088         obj = new Bmob.Object(response.className);
7089       } else {
7090         obj = new this.objectClass();
7091       }
7092       return obj;
7093     },
7094     _createRequest: function(params){
7095       return Bmob._request("classes", this.className, null, "GET",
7096                                    params || this.toJSON());
7097     },
7098 
7099     /**
7100      * Retrieves a list of BmobObjects that satisfy this query.
7101      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the find
7102      * completes.
7103      *
7104      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7105      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the results when
7106      * the query completes.
7107      */
7108     find: function(options) {
7109       var self = this;
7110 
7111       var request = this._createRequest();
7112 
7113       return request.then(function(response) {
7114         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
7115           var obj = self._newObject(response);
7116           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
7117           return obj;
7118         });
7119       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7120     },
7121 
7122    /**
7123     * Delete objects retrieved by this query.
7124     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
7125     *     callbacks.
7126     * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
7127     *     completes.
7128     */
7129      destroyAll: function(options){
7130        var self = this;
7131        return self.find().then(function(objects){
7132            return Bmob.Object.destroyAll(objects);
7133        })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7134      },
7135 
7136     /**
7137      * Counts the number of objects that match this query.
7138      * Either options.success or options.error is called when the count
7139      * completes.
7140      *
7141      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7142      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the count when
7143      * the query completes.
7144      */
7145     count: function(options) {
7146       var params = this.toJSON();
7147       params.limit = 0;
7148       params.count = 1;
7149       var request = this._createRequest(params);
7150 
7151       return request.then(function(response) {
7152         return response.count;
7153       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7154     },
7155 
7156     /**
7157      * Retrieves at most one Bmob.Object that satisfies this query.
7158      *
7159      * Either options.success or options.error is called when it completes.
7160      * success is passed the object if there is one. otherwise, undefined.
7161      *
7162      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
7163      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that is resolved with the object when
7164      * the query completes.
7165      */
7166     first: function(options) {
7167       var self = this;
7168 
7169       var params = this.toJSON();
7170       params.limit = 1;
7171       var request = this._createRequest(params);
7172 
7173       return request.then(function(response) {
7174         return _.map(response.results, function(json) {
7175           var obj = self._newObject();
7176           obj._finishFetch(self._processResult(json), true);
7177           return obj;
7178         })[0];
7179       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7180     },
7181 
7182     /**
7183      * Returns a new instance of Bmob.Collection backed by this query.
7184      * @return {Bmob.Collection}
7185      */
7186     collection: function(items, options) {
7187       options = options || {};
7188       return new Bmob.Collection(items, _.extend(options, {
7189         model: this._objectClass || this.objectClass,
7190         query: this
7191       }));
7192     },
7193 
7194     /**
7195      * Sets the number of results to skip before returning any results.
7196      * This is useful for pagination.
7197      * Default is to skip zero results.
7198      * @param {Number} n the number of results to skip.
7199      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7200      */
7201     skip: function(n) {
7202       this._skip = n;
7203       return this;
7204     },
7205 
7206     /**
7207      * Sets the limit of the number of results to return. The default limit is
7208      * 100, with a maximum of 1000 results being returned at a time.
7209      * @param {Number} n the number of results to limit to.
7210      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7211      */
7212     limit: function(n) {
7213       this._limit = n;
7214       return this;
7215     },
7216 
7217     /**
7218      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7219      * be equal to the provided value.
7220      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7221      * @param value The value that the Bmob.Object must contain.
7222      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7223      */
7224     equalTo: function(key, value) {
7225       this._where[key] = Bmob._encode(value);
7226       return this;
7227     },
7228 
7229     /**
7230      * Helper for condition queries
7231      */
7232     _addCondition: function(key, condition, value) {
7233       // Check if we already have a condition
7234       if (!this._where[key]) {
7235         this._where[key] = {};
7236       }
7237       this._where[key][condition] = Bmob._encode(value);
7238       return this;
7239     },
7240 
7241     /**
7242      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7243      * be not equal to the provided value.
7244      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7245      * @param value The value that must not be equalled.
7246      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7247      */
7248     notEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7249       this._addCondition(key, "$ne", value);
7250       return this;
7251     },
7252 
7253     /**
7254      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7255      * be less than the provided value.
7256      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7257      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
7258      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7259      */
7260     lessThan: function(key, value) {
7261       this._addCondition(key, "$lt", value);
7262       return this;
7263     },
7264 
7265     /**
7266      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7267      * be greater than the provided value.
7268      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7269      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
7270      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7271      */
7272     greaterThan: function(key, value) {
7273       this._addCondition(key, "$gt", value);
7274       return this;
7275     },
7276 
7277     /**
7278      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7279      * be less than or equal to the provided value.
7280      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7281      * @param value The value that provides an upper bound.
7282      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7283      */
7284     lessThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7285       this._addCondition(key, "$lte", value);
7286       return this;
7287     },
7288 
7289     /**
7290      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7291      * be greater than or equal to the provided value.
7292      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7293      * @param value The value that provides an lower bound.
7294      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7295      */
7296     greaterThanOrEqualTo: function(key, value) {
7297       this._addCondition(key, "$gte", value);
7298       return this;
7299     },
7300 
7301     /**
7302      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7303      * be contained in the provided list of values.
7304      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7305      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
7306      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7307      */
7308     containedIn: function(key, values) {
7309       this._addCondition(key, "$in", values);
7310       return this;
7311     },
7312 
7313     /**
7314      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7315      * not be contained in the provided list of values.
7316      * @param {String} key The key to check.
7317      * @param {Array} values The values that will not match.
7318      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7319      */
7320     notContainedIn: function(key, values) {
7321       this._addCondition(key, "$nin", values);
7322       return this;
7323     },
7324 
7325     /**
7326      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's value to
7327      * contain each one of the provided list of values.
7328      * @param {String} key The key to check.  This key's value must be an array.
7329      * @param {Array} values The values that will match.
7330      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7331      */
7332     containsAll: function(key, values) {
7333       this._addCondition(key, "$all", values);
7334       return this;
7335     },
7336 
7337 
7338     /**
7339      * Add a constraint for finding objects that contain the given key.
7340      * @param {String} key The key that should exist.
7341      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7342      */
7343     exists: function(key) {
7344       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", true);
7345       return this;
7346     },
7347 
7348     /**
7349      * Add a constraint for finding objects that do not contain a given key.
7350      * @param {String} key The key that should not exist
7351      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7352      */
7353     doesNotExist: function(key) {
7354       this._addCondition(key, "$exists", false);
7355       return this;
7356     },
7357 
7358     /**
7359      * Add a regular expression constraint for finding string values that match
7360      * the provided regular expression.
7361      * This may be slow for large datasets.
7362      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7363      * @param {RegExp} regex The regular expression pattern to match.
7364      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7365      */
7366     matches: function(key, regex, modifiers) {
7367       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", regex);
7368       if (!modifiers) { modifiers = ""; }
7369       // Javascript regex options support mig as inline options but store them
7370       // as properties of the object. We support mi & should migrate them to
7371       // modifiers
7372       if (regex.ignoreCase) { modifiers += 'i'; }
7373       if (regex.multiline) { modifiers += 'm'; }
7374 
7375       if (modifiers && modifiers.length) {
7376         this._addCondition(key, "$options", modifiers);
7377       }
7378       return this;
7379     },
7380 
7381     /**
7382      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a Bmob.Query
7383      * constraint.
7384      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
7385      *                     query.
7386      * @param {Bmob.Query} query The query that should match.
7387      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7388      */
7389     matchesQuery: function(key, query) {
7390       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7391       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7392       this._addCondition(key, "$inQuery", queryJSON);
7393       return this;
7394     },
7395 
7396    /**
7397      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not matches a
7398      * Bmob.Query constraint.
7399      * @param {String} key The key that the contains the object to match the
7400      *                     query.
7401      * @param {Bmob.Query} query The query that should not match.
7402      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7403      */
7404     doesNotMatchQuery: function(key, query) {
7405       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7406       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7407       this._addCondition(key, "$notInQuery", queryJSON);
7408       return this;
7409     },
7410 
7411 
7412     /**
7413      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value matches a value in
7414      * an object returned by a different Bmob.Query.
7415      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
7416      *                     matched.
7417      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
7418      *                          match against.
7419      * @param {Bmob.Query} query The query to run.
7420      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7421      */
7422     matchesKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
7423       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7424       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7425       this._addCondition(key, "$select",
7426                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
7427       return this;
7428     },
7429 
7430     /**
7431      * Add a constraint that requires that a key's value not match a value in
7432      * an object returned by a different Bmob.Query.
7433      * @param {String} key The key that contains the value that is being
7434      *                     excluded.
7435      * @param {String} queryKey The key in the objects returned by the query to
7436      *                          match against.
7437      * @param {Bmob.Query} query The query to run.
7438      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7439      */
7440     doesNotMatchKeyInQuery: function(key, queryKey, query) {
7441       var queryJSON = query.toJSON();
7442       queryJSON.className = query.className;
7443       this._addCondition(key, "$dontSelect",
7444                          { key: queryKey, query: queryJSON });
7445       return this;
7446     },
7447 
7448     /**
7449      * Add constraint that at least one of the passed in queries matches.
7450      * @param {Array} queries
7451      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7452      */
7453     _orQuery: function(queries) {
7454       var queryJSON = _.map(queries, function(q) {
7455         return q.toJSON().where;
7456       });
7457 
7458       this._where.$or = queryJSON;
7459       return this;
7460     },
7461 
7462     /**
7463      * Converts a string into a regex that matches it.
7464      * Surrounding with \Q .. \E does this, we just need to escape \E's in
7465      * the text separately.
7466      */
7467     _quote: function(s) {
7468       return "\\Q" + s.replace("\\E", "\\E\\\\E\\Q") + "\\E";
7469     },
7470 
7471     /**
7472      * Add a constraint for finding string values that contain a provided
7473      * string.  This may be slow for large datasets.
7474      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7475      * @param {String} substring The substring that the value must contain.
7476      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7477      */
7478     contains: function(key, value) {
7479       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value));
7480       return this;
7481     },
7482 
7483     /**
7484      * Add a constraint for finding string values that start with a provided
7485      * string.  This query will use the backend index, so it will be fast even
7486      * for large datasets.
7487      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7488      * @param {String} prefix The substring that the value must start with.
7489      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7490      */
7491     startsWith: function(key, value) {
7492       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", "^" + this._quote(value));
7493       return this;
7494     },
7495 
7496     /**
7497      * Add a constraint for finding string values that end with a provided
7498      * string.  This will be slow for large datasets.
7499      * @param {String} key The key that the string to match is stored in.
7500      * @param {String} suffix The substring that the value must end with.
7501      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7502      */
7503     endsWith: function(key, value) {
7504       this._addCondition(key, "$regex", this._quote(value) + "$");
7505       return this;
7506     },
7507 
7508     /**
7509      * Sorts the results in ascending order by the given key.
7510      *
7511      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
7512      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7513      */
7514     ascending: function(key) {
7515       this._order = key;
7516       return this;
7517     },
7518 
7519     /**
7520      * Sorts the results in descending order by the given key.
7521      *
7522      * @param {String} key The key to order by.
7523      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7524      */
7525     descending: function(key) {
7526       this._order = "-" + key;
7527       return this;
7528     },
7529 
7530     /**
7531      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
7532      * values near the point given.
7533      * @param {String} key The key that the Bmob.GeoPoint is stored in.
7534      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point The reference Bmob.GeoPoint that is used.
7535      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7536      */
7537     near: function(key, point) {
7538       if (!(point instanceof Bmob.GeoPoint)) {
7539         // Try to cast it to a GeoPoint, so that near("loc", [20,30]) works.
7540         point = new Bmob.GeoPoint(point);
7541       }
7542       this._addCondition(key, "$nearSphere", point);
7543       return this;
7544     },
7545 
7546     /**
7547      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
7548      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
7549      * @param {String} key The key that the Bmob.GeoPoint is stored in.
7550      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point The reference Bmob.GeoPoint that is used.
7551      * @param maxDistance Maximum distance (in radians) of results to return.
7552      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7553      */
7554     withinRadians: function(key, point, distance) {
7555       this.near(key, point);
7556       this._addCondition(key, "$maxDistance", distance);
7557       return this;
7558     },
7559 
7560     /**
7561      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
7562      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
7563      * Radius of earth used is 3958.8 miles.
7564      * @param {String} key The key that the Bmob.GeoPoint is stored in.
7565      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point The reference Bmob.GeoPoint that is used.
7566      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in miles) of results to
7567      *     return.
7568      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7569      */
7570     withinMiles: function(key, point, distance) {
7571       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 3958.8);
7572     },
7573 
7574     /**
7575      * Add a proximity based constraint for finding objects with key point
7576      * values near the point given and within the maximum distance given.
7577      * Radius of earth used is 6371.0 kilometers.
7578      * @param {String} key The key that the Bmob.GeoPoint is stored in.
7579      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} point The reference Bmob.GeoPoint that is used.
7580      * @param {Number} maxDistance Maximum distance (in kilometers) of results
7581      *     to return.
7582      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7583      */
7584     withinKilometers: function(key, point, distance) {
7585       return this.withinRadians(key, point, distance / 6371.0);
7586     },
7587 
7588     /**
7589      * Add a constraint to the query that requires a particular key's
7590      * coordinates be contained within a given rectangular geographic bounding
7591      * box.
7592      * @param {String} key The key to be constrained.
7593      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} southwest
7594      *     The lower-left inclusive corner of the box.
7595      * @param {Bmob.GeoPoint} northeast
7596      *     The upper-right inclusive corner of the box.
7597      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7598      */
7599     withinGeoBox: function(key, southwest, northeast) {
7600       if (!(southwest instanceof Bmob.GeoPoint)) {
7601         southwest = new Bmob.GeoPoint(southwest);
7602       }
7603       if (!(northeast instanceof Bmob.GeoPoint)) {
7604         northeast = new Bmob.GeoPoint(northeast);
7605       }
7606       this._addCondition(key, '$within', { '$box': [southwest, northeast] });
7607       return this;
7608     },
7609 
7610     /**
7611      * Include nested Bmob.Objects for the provided key.  You can use dot
7612      * notation to specify which fields in the included object are also fetch.
7613      * @param {String} key The name of the key to include.
7614      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7615      */
7616     include: function() {
7617       var self = this;
7618       Bmob._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
7619         if (_.isArray(key)) {
7620           self._include = self._include.concat(key);
7621         } else {
7622           self._include.push(key);
7623         }
7624       });
7625       return this;
7626     },
7627 
7628     /**
7629      * Restrict the fields of the returned Bmob.Objects to include only the
7630      * provided keys.  If this is called multiple times, then all of the keys
7631      * specified in each of the calls will be included.
7632      * @param {Array} keys The names of the keys to include.
7633      * @return {Bmob.Query} Returns the query, so you can chain this call.
7634      */
7635     select: function() {
7636       var self = this;
7637       this._select = this._select || [];
7638       Bmob._arrayEach(arguments, function(key) {
7639         if (_.isArray(key)) {
7640           self._select = self._select.concat(key);
7641         } else {
7642           self._select.push(key);
7643         }
7644       });
7645       return this;
7646     },
7647 
7648     /**
7649      * Iterates over each result of a query, calling a callback for each one. If
7650      * the callback returns a promise, the iteration will not continue until
7651      * that promise has been fulfilled. If the callback returns a rejected
7652      * promise, then iteration will stop with that error. The items are
7653      * processed in an unspecified order. The query may not have any sort order,
7654      * and may not use limit or skip.
7655      * @param callback {Function} Callback that will be called with each result
7656      *     of the query.
7657      * @param options {Object} An optional Backbone-like options object with
7658      *     success and error callbacks that will be invoked once the iteration
7659      *     has finished.
7660      * @return {Bmob.Promise} A promise that will be fulfilled once the
7661      *     iteration has completed.
7662      */
7663     each: function(callback, options) {
7664       options = options || {};
7665 
7666       if (this._order || this._skip || (this._limit >= 0)) {
7667         var error =
7668           "Cannot iterate on a query with sort, skip, or limit.";
7669         return Bmob.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7670       }
7671 
7672       var promise = new Bmob.Promise();
7673 
7674       var query = new Bmob.Query(this.objectClass);
7675       // We can override the batch size from the options.
7676       // This is undocumented, but useful for testing.
7677       query._limit = options.batchSize || 100;
7678       query._where = _.clone(this._where);
7679       query._include = _.clone(this._include);
7680 
7681       query.ascending('objectId');
7682 
7683       var finished = false;
7684       return Bmob.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
7685         return !finished;
7686 
7687       }, function() {
7688         return query.find().then(function(results) {
7689           var callbacksDone = Bmob.Promise.as();
7690           Bmob._.each(results, function(result) {
7691             callbacksDone = callbacksDone.then(function() {
7692               return callback(result);
7693             });
7694           });
7695 
7696           return callbacksDone.then(function() {
7697             if (results.length >= query._limit) {
7698               query.greaterThan("objectId", results[results.length - 1].id);
7699             } else {
7700               finished = true;
7701             }
7702           });
7703         });
7704       })._thenRunCallbacks(options);
7705     }
7706   };
7707 
7708    Bmob.FriendShipQuery = Bmob.Query._extend({
7709      _objectClass: Bmob.User,
7710      _newObject: function(){
7711       return new Bmob.User();
7712     },
7713      _processResult: function(json){
7714       var user = json[this._friendshipTag];
7715       if(user.__type === 'Pointer' && user.className === '_User'){
7716         delete user.__type;
7717         delete user.className;
7718       }
7719       return user;
7720     },
7721    });
7722 }(this));
