7725 /*global _: false, document: false, window: false, navigator: false */
7726 (function(root) {
7727   root.Bmob = root.Bmob || {};
7728   var Bmob = root.Bmob;
7729   var _ = Bmob._;
7730 
7731   /**
7732    * History serves as a global router (per frame) to handle hashchange
7733    * events or pushState, match the appropriate route, and trigger
7734    * callbacks. You shouldn't ever have to create one of these yourself
7735    * — you should use the reference to <code>Bmob.history</code>
7736    * that will be created for you automatically if you make use of
7737    * Routers with routes.
7738    *
7739    * <p>A fork of Backbone.History, provided for your convenience.  If you
7740    * use this class, you must also include jQuery, or another library
7741    * that provides a jQuery-compatible $ function.  For more information,
7742    * see the <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#History">
7743    * Backbone documentation</a>.</p>
7744    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
7745    */
7746   Bmob.History = function() {
7747     this.handlers = [];
7748     _.bindAll(this, 'checkUrl');
7749   };
7750 
7751   // Cached regex for cleaning leading hashes and slashes .
7752   var routeStripper = /^[#\/]/;
7753 
7754   // Cached regex for detecting MSIE.
7755   var isExplorer = /msie [\w.]+/;
7756 
7757   // Has the history handling already been started?
7758   Bmob.History.started = false;
7759 
7760   // Set up all inheritable **Bmob.History** properties and methods.
7761   _.extend(Bmob.History.prototype, Bmob.Events,
7762            /** @lends Bmob.History.prototype */ {
7763 
7764     // The default interval to poll for hash changes, if necessary, is
7765     // twenty times a second.
7766     interval: 50,
7767 
7768     // Gets the true hash value. Cannot use location.hash directly due to bug
7769     // in Firefox where location.hash will always be decoded.
7770     getHash: function(windowOverride) {
7771       var loc = windowOverride ? windowOverride.location : window.location;
7772       var match = loc.href.match(/#(.*)$/);
7773       return match ? match[1] : '';
7774     },
7775 
7776     // Get the cross-browser normalized URL fragment, either from the URL,
7777     // the hash, or the override.
7778     getFragment: function(fragment, forcePushState) {
7779       if (Bmob._isNullOrUndefined(fragment)) {
7780         if (this._hasPushState || forcePushState) {
7781           fragment = window.location.pathname;
7782           var search = window.location.search;
7783           if (search) {
7784             fragment += search;
7785           }
7786         } else {
7787           fragment = this.getHash();
7788         }
7789       }
7790       if (!fragment.indexOf(this.options.root)) {
7791         fragment = fragment.substr(this.options.root.length);
7792       }
7793       return fragment.replace(routeStripper, '');
7794     },
7795 
7796     /**
7797      * Start the hash change handling, returning `true` if the current
7798      * URL matches an existing route, and `false` otherwise.
7799      */
7800     start: function(options) {
7801       if (Bmob.History.started) {
7802         throw new Error("Bmob.history has already been started");
7803       }
7804       Bmob.History.started = true;
7805 
7806       // Figure out the initial configuration. Do we need an iframe?
7807       // Is pushState desired ... is it available?
7808       this.options = _.extend({}, {root: '/'}, this.options, options);
7809       this._wantsHashChange = this.options.hashChange !== false;
7810       this._wantsPushState = !!this.options.pushState;
7811       this._hasPushState = !!(this.options.pushState &&
7812                               window.history &&
7813                               window.history.pushState);
7814       var fragment = this.getFragment();
7815       var docMode = document.documentMode;
7816       var oldIE = (isExplorer.exec(navigator.userAgent.toLowerCase()) &&
7817                    (!docMode || docMode <= 7));
7818 
7819       if (oldIE) {
7820         this.iframe = Bmob.$('<iframe src="javascript:0" tabindex="-1" />')
7821                       .hide().appendTo('body')[0].contentWindow;
7822         this.navigate(fragment);
7823       }
7824 
7825       // Depending on whether we're using pushState or hashes, and whether
7826       // 'onhashchange' is supported, determine how we check the URL state.
7827       if (this._hasPushState) {
7828         Bmob.$(window).bind('popstate', this.checkUrl);
7829       } else if (this._wantsHashChange &&
7830                  ('onhashchange' in window) &&
7831                  !oldIE) {
7832         Bmob.$(window).bind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
7833       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
7834         this._checkUrlInterval = window.setInterval(this.checkUrl,
7835                                                     this.interval);
7836       }
7837 
7838       // Determine if we need to change the base url, for a pushState link
7839       // opened by a non-pushState browser.
7840       this.fragment = fragment;
7841       var loc = window.location;
7842       var atRoot  = loc.pathname === this.options.root;
7843 
7844       // If we've started off with a route from a `pushState`-enabled browser,
7845       // but we're currently in a browser that doesn't support it...
7846       if (this._wantsHashChange &&
7847           this._wantsPushState &&
7848           !this._hasPushState &&
7849           !atRoot) {
7850         this.fragment = this.getFragment(null, true);
7851         window.location.replace(this.options.root + '#' + this.fragment);
7852         // Return immediately as browser will do redirect to new url
7853         return true;
7854 
7855       // Or if we've started out with a hash-based route, but we're currently
7856       // in a browser where it could be `pushState`-based instead...
7857       } else if (this._wantsPushState &&
7858                  this._hasPushState &&
7859                  atRoot &&
7860                  loc.hash) {
7861         this.fragment = this.getHash().replace(routeStripper, '');
7862         window.history.replaceState({}, document.title,
7863             loc.protocol + '//' + loc.host + this.options.root + this.fragment);
7864       }
7865 
7866       if (!this.options.silent) {
7867         return this.loadUrl();
7868       }
7869     },
7870 
7871     // Disable Bmob.history, perhaps temporarily. Not useful in a real app,
7872     // but possibly useful for unit testing Routers.
7873     stop: function() {
7874       Bmob.$(window).unbind('popstate', this.checkUrl)
7875                      .unbind('hashchange', this.checkUrl);
7876       window.clearInterval(this._checkUrlInterval);
7877       Bmob.History.started = false;
7878     },
7879 
7880     // Add a route to be tested when the fragment changes. Routes added later
7881     // may override previous routes.
7882     route: function(route, callback) {
7883       this.handlers.unshift({route: route, callback: callback});
7884     },
7885 
7886     // Checks the current URL to see if it has changed, and if it has,
7887     // calls `loadUrl`, normalizing across the hidden iframe.
7888     checkUrl: function(e) {
7889       var current = this.getFragment();
7890       if (current === this.fragment && this.iframe) {
7891         current = this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe));
7892       }
7893       if (current === this.fragment) {
7894         return false;
7895       }
7896       if (this.iframe) {
7897         this.navigate(current);
7898       }
7899       if (!this.loadUrl()) {
7900         this.loadUrl(this.getHash());
7901       }
7902     },
7903 
7904     // Attempt to load the current URL fragment. If a route succeeds with a
7905     // match, returns `true`. If no defined routes matches the fragment,
7906     // returns `false`.
7907     loadUrl: function(fragmentOverride) {
7908       var fragment = this.fragment = this.getFragment(fragmentOverride);
7909       var matched = _.any(this.handlers, function(handler) {
7910         if (handler.route.test(fragment)) {
7911           handler.callback(fragment);
7912           return true;
7913         }
7914       });
7915       return matched;
7916     },
7917 
7918     // Save a fragment into the hash history, or replace the URL state if the
7919     // 'replace' option is passed. You are responsible for properly URL-encoding
7920     // the fragment in advance.
7921     //
7922     // The options object can contain `trigger: true` if you wish to have the
7923     // route callback be fired (not usually desirable), or `replace: true`, if
7924     // you wish to modify the current URL without adding an entry to the
7925     // history.
7926     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
7927       if (!Bmob.History.started) {
7928         return false;
7929       }
7930       if (!options || options === true) {
7931         options = {trigger: options};
7932       }
7933       var frag = (fragment || '').replace(routeStripper, '');
7934       if (this.fragment === frag) {
7935         return;
7936       }
7937 
7938       // If pushState is available, we use it to set the fragment as a real URL.
7939       if (this._hasPushState) {
7940         if (frag.indexOf(this.options.root) !== 0) {
7941           frag = this.options.root + frag;
7942         }
7943         this.fragment = frag;
7944         var replaceOrPush = options.replace ? 'replaceState' : 'pushState';
7945         window.history[replaceOrPush]({}, document.title, frag);
7946 
7947       // If hash changes haven't been explicitly disabled, update the hash
7948       // fragment to store history.
7949       } else if (this._wantsHashChange) {
7950         this.fragment = frag;
7951         this._updateHash(window.location, frag, options.replace);
7952         if (this.iframe &&
7953             (frag !== this.getFragment(this.getHash(this.iframe)))) {
7954           // Opening and closing the iframe tricks IE7 and earlier
7955           // to push a history entry on hash-tag change.
7956           // When replace is true, we don't want this.
7957           if (!options.replace) {
7958             this.iframe.document.open().close();
7959           }
7960           this._updateHash(this.iframe.location, frag, options.replace);
7961         }
7962 
7963       // If you've told us that you explicitly don't want fallback hashchange-
7964       // based history, then `navigate` becomes a page refresh.
7965       } else {
7966         window.location.assign(this.options.root + fragment);
7967       }
7968       if (options.trigger) {
7969         this.loadUrl(fragment);
7970       }
7971     },
7972 
7973     // Update the hash location, either replacing the current entry, or adding
7974     // a new one to the browser history.
7975     _updateHash: function(location, fragment, replace) {
7976       if (replace) {
7977         var s = location.toString().replace(/(javascript:|#).*$/, '');
7978         location.replace(s + '#' + fragment);
7979       } else {
7980         location.hash = fragment;
7981       }
7982     }
7983   });
7984 }(this));
7985 
7986 /*global _: false*/
7987 (function(root) {
7988   root.Bmob = root.Bmob || {};
7989   var Bmob = root.Bmob;
7990   var _ = Bmob._;
7991 
7992   /**
7993    * Routers map faux-URLs to actions, and fire events when routes are
7994    * matched. Creating a new one sets its `routes` hash, if not set statically.
7995    *
7996    * <p>A fork of Backbone.Router, provided for your convenience.
7997    * For more information, see the
7998    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Router">Backbone
7999    * documentation</a>.</p>
8000    * <p><strong><em>Available in the client SDK only.</em></strong></p>
8001    */
8002   Bmob.Router = function(options) {
8003     options = options || {};
8004     if (options.routes) {
8005       this.routes = options.routes;
8006     }
8007     this._bindRoutes();
8008     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
8009   };
8010 
8011   // Cached regular expressions for matching named param parts and splatted
8012   // parts of route strings.
8013   var namedParam    = /:\w+/g;
8014   var splatParam    = /\*\w+/g;
8015   var escapeRegExp  = /[\-\[\]{}()+?.,\\\^\$\|#\s]/g;
8016 
8017   // Set up all inheritable **Bmob.Router** properties and methods.
8018   _.extend(Bmob.Router.prototype, Bmob.Events,
8019            /** @lends Bmob.Router.prototype */ {
8020 
8021     /**
8022      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
8023      * initialization logic.
8024      */
8025     initialize: function(){},
8026 
8027     /**
8028      * Manually bind a single named route to a callback. For example:
8029      *
8030      * <pre>this.route('search/:query/p:num', 'search', function(query, num) {
8031      *       ...
8032      *     });</pre>
8033      */
8034     route: function(route, name, callback) {
8035       Bmob.history = Bmob.history || new Bmob.History();
8036       if (!_.isRegExp(route)) {
8037         route = this._routeToRegExp(route);
8038       }
8039       if (!callback) {
8040         callback = this[name];
8041       }
8042       Bmob.history.route(route, _.bind(function(fragment) {
8043         var args = this._extractParameters(route, fragment);
8044         if (callback) {
8045           callback.apply(this, args);
8046         }
8047         this.trigger.apply(this, ['route:' + name].concat(args));
8048         Bmob.history.trigger('route', this, name, args);
8049       }, this));
8050       return this;
8051     },
8052 
8053     /**
8054      * Whenever you reach a point in your application that you'd
8055      * like to save as a URL, call navigate in order to update the
8056      * URL. If you wish to also call the route function, set the
8057      * trigger option to true. To update the URL without creating
8058      * an entry in the browser's history, set the replace option
8059      * to true.
8060      */
8061     navigate: function(fragment, options) {
8062       Bmob.history.navigate(fragment, options);
8063     },
8064 
8065     // Bind all defined routes to `Bmob.history`. We have to reverse the
8066     // order of the routes here to support behavior where the most general
8067     // routes can be defined at the bottom of the route map.
8068     _bindRoutes: function() {
8069       if (!this.routes) {
8070         return;
8071       }
8072       var routes = [];
8073       for (var route in this.routes) {
8074         if (this.routes.hasOwnProperty(route)) {
8075           routes.unshift([route, this.routes[route]]);
8076         }
8077       }
8078       for (var i = 0, l = routes.length; i < l; i++) {
8079         this.route(routes[i][0], routes[i][1], this[routes[i][1]]);
8080       }
8081     },
8082 
8083     // Convert a route string into a regular expression, suitable for matching
8084     // against the current location hash.
8085     _routeToRegExp: function(route) {
8086       route = route.replace(escapeRegExp, '\\$&')
8087                    .replace(namedParam, '([^\/]+)')
8088                    .replace(splatParam, '(.*?)');
8089       return new RegExp('^' + route + '$');
8090     },
8091 
8092     // Given a route, and a URL fragment that it matches, return the array of
8093     // extracted parameters.
8094     _extractParameters: function(route, fragment) {
8095       return route.exec(fragment).slice(1);
8096     }
8097   });
8098 
8099 
8100   /**
8101    * @function
8102    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the router.
8103    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the router.
8104    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>Bmob.Router</code>.
8105    */
8106   Bmob.Router.extend = Bmob._extend;
8107 }(this));

8205   /**

8207    * @param {Object} data -  具体的参数请查看<a href="https://docs.bmob.cn/restful/developdoc/index.html?menukey=develop_doc&key=develop_restful">推送文档</a>.

8210   Bmob.Push.send = function(data, options) {
8211     if (data.where) {

8221     }
8222 
8223     if (data.expiration_time && data.expiration_time_interval) {
8224       throw "Both expiration_time and expiration_time_interval can't be set";
